loans.name: Erlinda Aurora

texts.es:
Erlinda Aurora tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de La Florida San Miguel, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Región Cajamarca que pertenece a la sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica junto a su hijo a la preparación y venta de comida, cuenta con un restaurant típico-rural-campestre, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, Erlinda ha solicitado un préstamo de 3200 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus comidas como sacos de arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros y de esta manera poder variedad de platos para ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que esto aumentará sus ingresos y sus ganancias lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Erlinda Aurora   is 51 years old and lives with her son in the district of La Florida San Miguel, located in Cajamarca region,  which is part of Peru's northern highlands.  It is a community with green landscapes.  People who live there engage in agriculture and commerce, and raise livestock.
 
She and her son prepare and sell food. She has a traditional country-style restaurant, with more than 20 years experience in the business. 

Erlinda has requested a loan of 3200 nuevos soles in order to purchase ingredients and supplies for preparing her food, such a sacks of race, cooking oil, sugar and other items, enabling her to prepare a variety of dishes to offer her customers, as this way she will increase her income and earnings, which will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and supplies for preparing her meals, such as sacks of rice, cooking oil, sugar and other items, enabling her to prepare a variety of dishes to offer her customers.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлуда занимается древним ремеслом своего народа. Она шьет курпа и курпача (стеганые ватные одеяла), использующиеся в быту у таджиков по сей день. Мавлуда продолжает ремесло своей матери, которое передается в их семье по женской линии из поколения к поколению. Этой деятельностью Мавлуда занимается уже 15 лет. Она профессионал в своей области. 
Мавлуде 54 года. Она жительница северной части Таджикистана, города Худжанд. Она живет там с мужем, сыном и невесткой. 
Мавлуда берет кредит для продолжения своей деятельности. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита она купит необходимые ткани для шитья. Кредит поможет ей увеличить количество клиентов.
texts.en:
Mavluda is involved in an ancient trade of her people. She sews kurpa and kurpacha (stitched, cotton-filled blankets), used in Tajiks' daily lives to this day. Mavluda continues the trade of her mother, passed on to women in her family generation after generation. Mavluda has been involved in this business for 15 years already. She is a professional in her field.

Mavluda is 54 years old. She is a resident of the city of Khujand in the northern part of Tajikistan. She lives there with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Mavluda is requesting this loan to continue her business. She will use the loan amount to buy necessary fabrics for sewing. The loan will help her increase the number of her customers.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and a pig fattening business. Jerlyn is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

Jerlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en: Yuliana is a 31-year-old single mother who lives with her parents. She started working when she was 15 years old selling t-shirts. Later, she opened a water purification and distribution business. Yuliana is asking for a loan to refurbish her business, improve its appearance and hopefully get more clients. Her biggest accomplishment is opening and maintaining her business and providing financial stability for her daughter.

loans.use: to refurbish her business to attract more customers.

loans.name: Callen

texts.en: Callen is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as patient. She operates an M-Pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as having an inadequate float. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add an M-Pesa float. Her business goal is to have an established business within 5 years.

loans.use: to add an M-Pesa float.

loans.name: Sivanu

texts.en: Sivanu is a 54-year-old, married woman with eight children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Sivanu needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Sivanu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, and sacks of onions and potatoes

loans.name: Fesolai

texts.en: Fesolai is 35 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for two years. Fesolai needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, salt, rice, canned items, soft drinks, snacks and a new cash register machine. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and to help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy to sell like bags of flour, sugar, salt, rice, canned items, etc. and a new cash register machine.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years.

Eseta  joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services. She has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, brushes, material, stencils, wooden designs, rollers and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brushes, material, stencils, wooden designs, rollers and a new cutter

loans.name: Sukanya

texts.en:
Sukanya has never known an easy life. She was born in 1967 and she has lived through heartbreak that most people would find hard to overcome. She was a child during the Mlabri Tribe's painful struggle to adapt from peaceful hunting and gathering to the modern world. Her youth was a time when many of the tribe died of malnourishment and malaria, while the rest were forced into indentured servitude in toxic slash and burn agriculture. 

Sukanya had six children of her own who lived, as well as three who died in infancy. Her husband left her for another woman and she has faced with courage and resolve the task of raising her children as a single mother.

Hammock weaving made it possible for Sukanya to provide for her family. Weaving hammocks is her primary source of income and the only available work that makes it possible for her children to grow up healthy and educated.

Sukanya grew up with no schooling; numbers and letters are still strangers to her, though necessity has taught her basic math. She manages to budget her money to keep her family fed and clothed and is intensely interested in her children's education.

This is Sukanya's second Kiva loan through the field partner program. As a member of the inaugural class of Kiva weavers, she went through a financial literacy program, improved her budgeting skills and opened her first bank account!

Through her Kiva loan, Sukanya will be able to maintain her family's stability and live within her annual budget, ensuting that her children are provided for. Her flexible schedule will allow her to dedicate her energy to work, schooling and family.

loans.use: to increase her overall production capacity and secure long term weaving work.

loans.name: Yalana

texts.en:
Yalana is an artisan hammock weaver and the mother of 3 children. She was one of the first Yellow Leaf artisans and is one of the most talented and prolific weavers. Because of her generosity of spirit and the way she bolsters the entire community, she has grown to be a leader among the village weavers. She is rich in friends and respected by her peers. 

Yalana was born in the jungles of rural northern Thailand at the end of an era for her tribe, the Mlabri. Her father was a respected sorcerer and very knowledgeable about traditional Mlabri life. But when she was young, life rapidly changed as deforestation destroyed the jungles where they had lived for generations. Without any land rights or capital to farm, Yalana eventually became an indentured servant, along with her parents and the rest of the tribe. They worked clearing land in the fields of the more powerful tribes in the region. The back-breaking slash and burn was dangerous and the payment was meager, but there were no alternatives available. 

Hammock weaving presented Yalana's first opportunity to build a new life and she greeted this excellent opportunity with ambition and diligence! Today she lives in the Ban Bunyuen Village and helps provide for her family by applying her traditional artisan talents toward weaving hammocks that are sold around the world. 

She has acquired enough independence to be able to plant rice fields for her family, generally harvesting enough grain to last from one harvest to the next. Hunting and foraging continue to play a role in her family’s daily sustenance, but they are no longer limited to what they can hunt or catch; her income from making hammocks affords them healthcare, education, and food security formerly unavailable to them.

With the hunter and gatherer lifestyle lost to the past,  Yalana has adjusted to her new situation while maintaining her pride and confidence as a Mlabri woman.

This is Yalana's second Kiva loan through the field partner program. As a member of the inaugural class of Kiva weavers, she went through a financial literacy program, improved her budgeting skills and opened her first bank account!

Just a few years ago, this level of stability was out of reach for Yalana. For a woman born in her circumstances, the opportunity to earn a solid wage and be offered reliable credit is truly remarkable. With this Kiva loan, Yalana will continue to build a strong foundation for her family's future and will begin saving money in her new bank account!

loans.use: to increase her production capacity by investing in raw materials.

loans.name: Tee

texts.en: Tee is a 40-year-old, divorced woman with two children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Tee needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. Tee has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups.

loans.name: Talafulu

texts.en:
Talafulu is 35 years old and divorced with five children. She owns and operates a small shop selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years. 

Talafulu needs a loan to buy snacks, a chest freezer, cases of milk, soft drinks, cigarettes, alcohol, frozen goods and a new display fridge. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with her children's school fees. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, a chest freezer, cases of milk, soft drinks, cigarettes, alcohol, frozen goods and a new display fridge

loans.name: Silaumua

texts.en:
Silaumua is a 32-year-old married woman with five children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Silaumua needs a loan to buy cordials, foam cups, sugar, a new cooler, a mini chest freezer, Chinese candy, a large spoon and rubber gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Silaumua has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cordials, foam cups, sugar, a new cooler, a mini chest freezer, Chinese candy, a large spoon and rubber gloves

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  06 membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BAKAMANI, un des villages de SANANKORO DJITOUMOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec  AWA, qui est la seule personne assise  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,50 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  55.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group BENKADI III are married women who average 35 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in BAKAMANI, a village located in SANANKORO DJITOUMOU, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 3rd loan cycle with the MFI. 

AWA grows groundnuts and rice. She is the member sitting in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village to a clientele consisting of resellers and consumers.  

Awa expects to earn an average profit of 55,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products and ingredients for her business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are helping each other to generate income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to pay for more quantities of products such as fish, pork, charcoal and different ingredients for grilling. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen dreams to have more loyal customers, and hopes that her children will have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fish, pork, charcoal and different ingredients for grilling.

loans.name: Anong

texts.en:
Anong is a model of perseverance and good humor. Although she has seen the difficult side of life up close, she continues to keep her spirits high and to believe in a brighter future.

Anong is a mother, wife and member of the close-knit Mlabri tribe in rural northern Thailand. Although she now lives in the Ban Boonyuen Village with many of her fellow Mlabri, she spent years without stability. Like many of her fellow Mlabri, Anong was forced into indentured servitude as a field laborer working in slash & burn agriculture. She and her family worked in back-breaking toxic farming in order to pay off a never-ending cycle of debt to stronger clans.

For Anong and the rest of the Mlabri, the past decades have been full of heartbreak, tragedy and incredible perseverance. The gentle Mlabri once lived a peaceful lifestyle as migrant hunter & gatherers, but the teak deforestation and guerrilla warfare of the late 20th century destroyed their lifestyle forever. Impoverished, enslaved and malnourished, the tribe lost most of its members to malaria and other illnesses- with just 300 members left in the world, the Mlabri are listed on UNESCO’s “endangered languages” list. 

Hammock weaving is the first proven path for Anong and her fellow Mlabri artisans to break free of the cycle of debt and servitude. Although she is a skilled artisan weaver, she used to be compelled to return to fieldwork when there were not enough hammock orders. Raising three children while moving from place to place in the slash & burn fields was daunting and discouraging.

This is Anong's second Kiva loan through the field partner program. As a member of the inaugural class of Kiva weavers, she went through a financial literacy program, improved her budgeting skills and opened her first bank account!

Anong is finally breathing easily and allowing herself to believe that her children will have a chance to grow up without the same fear and hardship she faced. She is very grateful to the Kiva community for supporting the stability she spent her life hoping for.

loans.use: to help expand production and ensure that her family can work + learn during the slow season.

loans.name: Daeng

texts.en:
Daeng was one of the first of his generation of Mlabri to grow up in contact with the outside world. Before him, his father had known the hardships – and the independence– of a life lived mainly in the jungles. Rampant deforestation and extensive agriculture reduced forested land to a fraction of its past area. By the time Daeng was born in 1983, the Mlabri people had been reduced to indentured servitude in the slash & burn fields of other ethnic groups in Thailand.

Daeng grew up in the Ban Bunyuen Village and learned to read and write at the school there. Basic education opened up many new avenues of knowledge for him, while village elders and his older relatives introduced him to the ways of the jungle. Daeng thus straddles both generations; he is an example to the younger ones, and a help in guiding the older ones through the intricacies of modern life.

Daeng does not have the same fear of the outside world as the older generation does. He can hold his own in a pinch and he knows where to go for help when he’s hard pressed.

Like many of his fellow weavers, Daeng weaves hammocks to provide a better life for his wife and their children- he’s a great dad! He is savvy enough to make wise decisions in his purchases, yet retains a uniquely Mlabri penchant for helping others – something that weaving hammocks allows him to do. 

Daeng was one of the first to tell about Mlabri life in his lead role in the documentary film, The Importance of Being Mlabri. He still functions as a liaison with outsiders, running interference for those with fewer skills in those areas.

This is Daeng's second Kiva loan through the field partner program. As a member of the inaugural class of Kiva weavers, he went through a financial literacy program, improved his budgeting skills and opened his first bank account!

Daeng's last Kiva loan helped him save up for a new motorcycle, which gives his family more independence and mobility. Through this loan, he hopes to continue to improve their home, stability and opportunities for the future - all while staying within his means and working hard.

loans.use: to help increase hammock production to have more financial security and savings.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and married with two children. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her store.

Rebecca has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as those listed above. In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Chanai

texts.en:
After rampant environmental destruction drove the Mlabri tribe from their traditional forest home, Chanai and her family were forced into bondage as field laborers in back-breaking toxic agriculture. Exploited, impoverished and malnourished, only 300 Mlabri survived this dark era. 

Today, hammocks are empowering Chanai and her family to build a brighter future. Weaving work is safe, highly paid and community-focused. Chanai is overjoyed that her children are able to attend school instead of toiling in the fields. 

As one of the most outgoing weavers, she keeps the old Mlabri traditions alive with her love of storytelling. Chanai loves the freedom that she has to work at her own pace as a weaver- it suits her relaxed, fun-loving nature. 

Chanai is also a traditional Mlabri in the sense that she puts the community first. For example, she has had several extended family members move in with her during the past year. In many cultures, this would be an unwelcome strain on finances- but Chanai sees this as an opportunity to teach her family how to weave and share more work with everyone. 

She is excited to use this Kiva loan to help expand production and ensure that her family can work and learn during the slow season. They will build momentum and stockpile hammocks for a busy spring!

As a member of the newest class of Kiva weavers, Chanai also has support creating a family budget, is part of an ongoing financial literacy program and will receive assistance opening up her first bank account!

loans.use: to increase her production capacity to secure consistent weaving work.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with two children, both currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feeds, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Helen would like to save enough money so that in the future she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock including rice, feeds, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Khaen

texts.en:
Khaen is proud to be a working mother (of two)! As a member of the first generation of Mlabri to grow up in a village instead of the jungle, she spent her youth worried about what her future opportunities would be. She didn't want her future children to have to work in the slash and burn fields where she spent her childhood, but she also did not want to leave her family and community behind to look for work in the city. She knew that living in the city as a Mlabri would leave her vulnerable, but just as importantly, she felt a strong desire to settle down with someone from her tribe and continue Mlabri traditions. 

Now Khaen feels like she has achieved many of the goals that used to seem impossible. She married Daeng, a Mlabri young man who also believes in carrying on the tribe's traditions. They work as a team, each weaving hammocks and caring for the children. They are diligent savers and are determined to build a comfortable and stable life for their young family. Through their hard work, they have started to fix up their small home! 

Khaen can hardly believe that she has been able to build a happy life after so many years of uncertainty. She is determined to save for her children's future and provide them with more opportunity. She will be using this Kiva loan to stabilize her income, manage her workflow during the coming year and find balance between the busy weaving season and the slower months.

As a member of the newest class of Kiva weavers, Khaen also has support creating a family budget, is part of an ongoing financial literacy program and will receive assistance opening up her first bank account!

loans.use: to increase production capacity and secure consistent weaving work.

loans.name: Jeab

texts.en:
Jeab grew up caught between her tribe's past and its future. Her mother, just one generation ahead of her, lived as a hunter-gatherer in the secluded jungles of nothern Thailand. The Mlabri Tribe's existence was changed forever by rampant deforestation, guerrilla warfare and the unstoppable encroachment of the modern world. By the time Jeab was a girl, the traditional lifestyle of the Mlabri had vanished. Without education, land or opportunity, her family was forced to work in back-breaking slash and burn agriculture as indentured servants for neighboring tribes. 

From a young age, Jeab battled to create new opportunities for herself. Despite her family's difficult circumstances, she persevered in attending school as often as she could. She holds the distinction of being the very first Mlabri person to reach the 6th grade in school! She has continued to take non-formal education classes even after marrying and becoming a mother herself. 

While Jeab has not lived the same life her mother did, she still feels rooted to her community and tribe. With her language and reading skills, she would probably be able to find work in a distant city. But with only a small group of Mlabri left in the world, she feels a commitment to making sure her children grow up near family and she is proud to be able to support her mother, who lives with her. 

Hammock weaving has created an opportunity for Jeab to hold a skilled job and earn a healthy wage within her village. With her reading ability and smarts, she often helps other weavers learn new designs. For Jeab, the ability to live a stable life and be regarded as a teacher is truly remarkable. With her Kiva loan, she will be able to plan her weaving for the coming year and balance her time between work and home responsibilities. 

As a member of the newest class of Kiva weavers, Jeab also has support creating a family budget, is part of an ongoing financial literacy program and will receive assistance opening up her first bank account!

loans.use: to increase production capacity and secure consistent weaving work.

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en:
Faasuamalie is 31 years old and divorced with two children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for two years. 

Faasuamalie needs a loan to buy Samoan printed materials, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, shoes, Samoan coconut oil and Samoan woven caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan printed materials, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles, shoes, Samoan coconut oil and Samoan woven caps

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino de 62 años de edad, vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos que dependen de él, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de abarrotería, frescos, verduras y también vende carne de cerdo.
Don Faustino también se dedica a la construcción, tiene apartamentos de alquiler y sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que transitan por la carretera que lleva hacia el hospital.
Don Faustino está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de manteca, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, salsas, pastas, sal, pan, galletas, etc. y también para realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda, con el apoyo de este crédito espera mejorar sus ingresos y su negocio, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014
texts.en:
Faustino is 62 years old. He lives with his wife, and does not have any dependent children. He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. He has his own home and for 11 years has been selling groceries, drinks and vegetables. He also sells pork. Faustino also works in construction; he rents apartments. His customers are his friends, neighbors and passersby on the road that leads towards the hospital.

Faustino is requesting the loan to purchase butter, rice, sugar, beans, sauces, pasta, salt, bread, cookies, etc., as well as to make some home improvements. With the support of this loan, he hopes to improve his income and his business. He is very pleased to continue working with Prisma.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to purchase butter, rice, sugar, beans, sauces, pasta, salt, bread, cookies, etc. for his market.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 38 years old, married and has two children. She is in the direct-selling business for income, and her husband is a government employee. Her son wants to become an engineer, but she has insufficient funds to sustain his education.

With her desire to continuously send her son to school, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay tuition fees and buy books and a uniform for him. She hopes this loan will be given as additional funding for the educational expenses of her son.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and buy books and a uniform for her child.

loans.name: Jonalee

texts.en: Jonalee is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Jonalee has a jewelry selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of jewelry to sell. She has been in this business for eight years. Jonalee would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina works hard to support her family. Albina is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Albina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Albina has been in this business for six years now.

Albina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 34 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennifer has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOBOLA, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  TARIBA, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  145.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of the BENKADI I group are married women who are all around 47 years old, with five children each; all of them live in polygamous families in Bobola, one of the villages in N'kouraba, the second largest region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association in order to successfully drive their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the organisation. They grow peanuts and millet via Tariba, the first person standing up on the left in the photo. With her loan, she aims to purchase fertiliser, seeds and to pay the labour costs for cultivating 1.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the crops are sold at the village to a customer base primarily made up of wholesalers and end consumers. She aims to generate an average profit of 145,000 FCFA per harvest. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the family's expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for labour, fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 51, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ruben and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continuously provide income for her everyday expenses.

Vilma operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Vilma hopes her business grows and dreams of good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn owns and operates a food-selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for six years and has been earning well to sustain their living. With her membership and loans from GDMPC, her business is improving and is doing well. She attended various training sessions conducted by the cooperative, and with this knowledge her business abilities improved. 

Evalyn borrowed a new loan recently to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks and street foods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks and street foods to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOBOLA, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  RAMATOU, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of the BENKADI II group are married women who are all around 38 years old, with five children each; all of them live in polygamous families in Bobola, one of the villages in N'kouraba, the second largest region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association in order to successfully drive their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the organisation. They grow peanuts and millet via Ramatou, the first person standing up on the left in the photo. With her loan, she aims to purchase fertiliser, seeds and to pay the labour costs for cultivating 1.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the crops are sold at the village to a customer base primarily made up of wholesalers and end consumers. She aims to generate an average profit of 45,000 FCFA per harvest. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the family's expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for labour, fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Don Domingo, tiene 69 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos  y vive con su esposa e hijos, en el municipio de San José de Comayagua. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, inicio con la siembra de caña y hace 6 años que produce café. Esta producción de café la vende en pergamino y es vendida a los intermediarios. Esta solicitando ya un noveno ciclo de préstamo con el actual que es por 26,000 lempiras este dinero lo invertirá en el mantenimiento del cultivo de café en la compra de abono y limpieza del mismo, su objetivo es mejorar la producción y piensa comprar 2 manzanas de tierra para sembrar mas café.
texts.en:
Don Domingo, 69 years of age, is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the municipality of San Jose de Comayagua. 

He has always worked in agriculture, starting with sugarcane planting, and he has been producing coffee for 6 years. 

This coffee is sold in parchment, and is sold to intermediaries. He is asking for a ninth cycle of loans, this one for 26,000 lempiras (1250 USD). This money will be invested in maintaining the coffee crops, in the purchase of fertilizer, and the cleaning of the coffee. His objective is to improve production, and he is thinking of buying two manzanas of land to plant coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to clean the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jairo Alberto

texts.es: Jairo agradece a los financiadores de Kiva y pide " que sigan apoyando a los microempresarios para que sigan adelante en su negocio." él con su anterior credikiva logró mejorar el surtido de su negocio y obtner mas utilidades pues pudo comprar gran variedad de mercancias  y agregarlas a su oferta. En la actualidad está asolicitando un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará herramientas de trabajo, llaveros, candados, llaves, clavos y otros materiales para surtir una vez mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Jairo is grateful to Kiva lenders and asks "that they keep supporting micro-enterprisers so that  they can get ahead in their businesses."  With his previous Kiva loan, he was able to improve the stocked merchandise in his business and earn better profits because he was able to buy a large variety of products and add them to what he offers.  

Currently he is asking for a Kiva loan with which he will buy work tools, key rings, padlocks, keys, nails, and other supplies in order to restock his business.

loans.use: to buy tools, key rings, padlocks, keys, nails, and other supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOBOLA, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec FANTA, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of the BENKADI III group are married women who are all around 39 years old, with six children each; all of them live in polygamous families in Bobola, one of the villages in N'kouraba, the second largest region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association in order to successfully drive their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the organisation. They grow peanuts and millet via Fanta, the first person standing up on the left in the photo. With her loan, she aims to purchase fertiliser, seeds and to pay the labour costs for cultivating 1 hectare of land. Once harvested, the crops are sold at the village to a customer base primarily made up of wholesalers and end consumers. She aims to generate an average profit of 95,000 FCFA per harvest. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the family's expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for labour, fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 63 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos, en casa propia, la cual queda en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos.

Yolanda se dedica a la actividad de corte y confeccion de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros, desde hace más de 20 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de telas para la confeccion de prendas de vestir. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 63 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in her own home, located in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's north coast. She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors.

Yolanda has been dedicated to cutting and sewing items of clothing for women and men and has more than 20 years in the business, working from her own home. 

Yolanda is soliciting a loan to purchase cloth for making additional items of clothing. In this manner, she will expand her business and obtain more income, increasing her earnings and, thus, improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cloth for making items of clothing as a seamstress.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Малика жительница района Джиликуль. Ей 39 лет. Она замужняя женщина. У нее четверо детей. Ее старший сын находится на заработках заграницей. Малика живет вместе с мужем, детьми и родителями мужа. У них большая семья. Мух Малики занимается земледелием.
Сама Малика вот уже 19 лет как занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает бижутерию и золотые изделия. Также она очень любит работу на поле, она предпочитает заниматься растениеводством. Для продолжения своего дела, посева сельскохозяйственных культур она берет кредит.
texts.en: Malika is a resident of the Jilikul district. She is 39 years old. She is a married woman with four children. Her oldest son works abroad. Malika lives with her husband, children and parents-in-law. They have a large family. Malika's husband is involved in farming. Malika has been involved in sales at a market for 19 years. She sells jewelry and gold. She also loves working on a field very much and prefers to be involved in agriculture. She is requesting this loan to continue her business and plant agricultural crops.

loans.use: to plant agricultural crops

loans.name: Teegawende De Lao Group

texts.fr:
Mme TANGA SUZANNE représente le groupe TEEGAWENDE DE LAO. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a plus de 30ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation depuis 2011. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les dolotières.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de sorgho blanc pour transformer en sorgho germé pour la préparation de la bière de mil.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité  et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Tanga Suzanne represents the Teegawende de Lao group. She is a married mother of 7 children, the eldest of whom is over 30 and the youngest is 12. Three attend school, and she has another three people in her care. 
She has prepared sorghum since 2011. She sources her goods from the local villages, and her customers are dolo (a millet beer) brewers. She wishes to purchase two bags of white sorghum in order to transform it into milled sorghum for the preparation of millet beer. With the profits generated she aims to boost her business, and aims to grow her business and better care for her children.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of white sorghum which she will turn into milled sorghum as preparation for millet beer

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Манзура 45-летняя жительница района Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Она умелая мастерица и занимается шитьем разнообразной женской одежды. Данной услугой она занимается 8 лет. 
Манзура замужем и у нее двое детей. Дочери 24 года, сыну 18 лет. Дочь работает уборщицей в производственном предприятии шумоизоляции, а сын предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту квартир. Дочь одновременно помогает матери в ее швейном деле.
Манзура сейчас обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет закупить необходимые ткани для шитья. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Manzura is a 45-year-old resident of Khujand city in the B. Gafurov district. She is masterful seamstress, involved in sewing various women's clothing. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Manzura is married and has two children. Her daughter is 24 years old, and son is 18 years old. Her daughter works as a janitor at a sound-proofing manufacturing company, and son provides apartment repair services. The daughter concurrently helps her mother with the sewing business. Manzura requested this loan to buy necessary fabrics for sewing. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy necessary fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Benkadi  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOBOLA, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le gombo avec MAIMOUNA, 2ème personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  145.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The 10 members of the BENKADI IV group are married women who are all around 30 years old, with five children each; all of them live in polygamous families in Bobola, one of the villages in N'kouraba, the second largest region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association in order to successfully drive their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the organisation. They grow peanuts and millet via Maimouna, the second person standing up on the left in the photo. With her loan, she aims to purchase fertiliser, seeds and to pay the labour costs for cultivating 1.5 hectares of land. Once harvested, the crops are sold at the village to a customer base primarily made up of wholesalers and end consumers. She aims to generate an average profit of 145,000 FCFA per harvest. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to assist her husband with the family's expenditures.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina finds better ways of living with her manufacturing business. She sells a number of hollow blocks weekly and it helps a lot to sustain their living. Her previous loan, used for buying a motorcycle, was successfully repaid. She was able to go to the neighboring villages to promote her business. 

Recently, she took a new loan primarily to buy spare parts and accessories. A portion of this amount will also be used to buy cement used for manufacturing. In the future, Carina wants to improve her business as well as the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories and also to buy cement

loans.name: Bandera De España Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Bandera de España, es integrado por seis socios emprendedores, y es coordinado por la señora Marcela de 21 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de tres años, por quien se ha propuesto mejorar su calidad de vida para poder ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida, es propietaria de una pulpería, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, cajas de jabón, pasta dental, jabón para lavar trastos, shampoo, etc., con el crédito anterior la socia logro implementar la venta de productos que antes no vendía y se ha propuesto seguir aumentando su negocio. Otra de las socias es la señora Jessenia de 24 años de edad, comerciante de frutas sus principales clientes son de la capital y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de nancites, jocote, mamón, etc., la señora Janet de 49 años de edad, quien se dedica a la comercialización de coctel en las principales calles de Granada, Masaya y Catarina, la señora Perla de 27 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de ayote, chayote, nancite, mamón, jocote, etc., el señor Elmer de 34 años de edad, quien elabora y vende canastos en la capital, y la señora Reyna de 28 años de edad, comerciante de frutas y verduras en la municipalidad desde hace dos años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mango, mamón, nancite, etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Bandera de España” (Banner of Spain) consists of six enterprising members. The group coordinator is Sra. Marcela. She is 21 years old, married, and the mother of a three-year-old son. Marcela wants to improve her son’s quality of life by providing him better living conditions. She is the owner of a store that she operates with the help of her husband. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy staple products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, cases of soap, toothpaste, dishwashing soap, shampoo, and other items. Her previous loan allowed her to sell products that she wasn’t able to before, which helped to increase her business.

The other members are as follows:
• Sra. Jessenia is 24 years old and works as a fruit merchant. Her main customers are from the capital. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy nance fruit, hog plums, Spanish limes, and other products.
• Sra. Janet is 49 years old and sells cocktails along the main roads in Granada, Masaya, and Catarina.
• Sra. Perla is 27 years old. She works as a fruit and vegetable merchant. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy pumpkins, chayote squash, nance fruit, Spanish limes, hog plums, and other products.
• Sr. Elmer is 34 years old. He manufactures and sells baskets in the capital.
• Sra. Reyna is 28 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in her town for two years. Her loan will be invested in mangos, Spanish limes, nance fruit, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, cases of soap, toothpaste, dishwashing soap, shampoo, and other products.

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU représente le groupe FILWENDE.  Elle se porte bien ainsi que les autres membres. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme vend des ignames  depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 06sacs d’ignames.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne construire sa parcelle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. BINTOU is the representative of the FILWENDE group. She and the other group members are doing well. She is the married mother of four children aged 28 to 12, one of whom goes to school. She supports a total of six people. 

Mrs. Bintou has been selling yams for 15 years. She buys her stock at a local market. She wants to buy six sacks of yams. 

Mrs. Bintou plans to save her profits. Her goals are to build on her land, and to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of yams.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 47 years old and married with one child.

Dina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Dina has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising chickens.

Dina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru:
Гулдаста 46-летняя женщина проживающая в районе Джиликуль. Гулдаста замужем. У нее двое детей. Они несовершеннолетние, учатся в школе. Гулдаста работает на рынке. Она готовит и продает свежие пирожки, самбусу, хот-доги и пироги. В этой области она имеет хороший опыт. Гулдасте помогает ее муж. 
Гулдаста берет кредит для покупки продуктов, чтобы приготовить большое количество пирогов, пирожков на продажу и на заказ.
texts.en: Guldasta is a 46-year-old woman living in the Jilikul district. Guldasta is married and has two children, all of whom are underage and attend school. Guldasta works at a market. She cooks and sells fresh piroshki, samosa, hot dogs and pirogi. She has good experience in this business. Guldasta's husband helps her in this business. Guldasta is requesting this loan to buy products to cook a large number of pirogi and piroshki for sale and to-order.

loans.use: to buy products to cook a large number of pirogi and piroshki for sale and to-order

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en: Maridel has been working in her own retail store for many years while her husband works in a private institution to make a living. With her generated income, she was able to repay successfully her previous loans used for the business. Planning to improve it, she took a new loan recently to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Maridel hopes to increase her sales so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to save for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pucara, es una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, y está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, realizando esta actividad desde hace 2 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en compra de gaseosas y arreglos de su domicilio mejroando asi su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Petronila is 51 years old and lives in the Pucara District. It is a tranquil community with a hot climate, whose population work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Jaen province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the North of Peru. 

She works selling food, and has been doing this work for 2 years. She has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of soft drinks and fixes for her home, in this way improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, and to accomplish little fixes for her home, generating better earnings and in this way improving her quality of life.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 39 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Editha and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Editha is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Editha has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Editha can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Aura Ester

texts.es:
Aura, a sus 24 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 8 años de trayectoria en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Aura manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Aura, 24 years of age, is a charismatic and helpful woman, dedicated to working in her own business -- a grocery store she began due to the need to generate income to advance her family. Despite adversities, she has had the fortitude and determination to elevate herself and continue ahead for 8 years in this activity.

Her purpose in life is to continue progressing and, to do that, she wishes to fortify her business, advancing it by purchasing a variety of products, including groceries, grains, snacks, soft drinks and, in general, basic products from the family basket. In this manner, she will be able to offer her customers better quality and service, notably expanding her sales and the income she receives from them.

Aura says her greatest hope is to continue growing with her business and, in the future, she hopes to convert her business into a supermarket where customers can find all the articles they need and, thus, improve her profitability and offer a better quality of life for her family.

Helping with this loan will be contributing to the entrepreneurship of Colombian women!

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business, such as groceries, grains, soft drinks, shacks, liquors and other consumer items to resupply her store and improve its presentation.

loans.name: Gerber Mauricio

texts.es:
Gerber de 50 años de edad, es un agricultor de la zona, el cual no posee ningún tipo de estudio académico. Está casado y ha procreado dos hijos los cuales uno de ellos ya está acompañado y tiene un hijo y ya no vive junto a ellos y el otro hijo  está con él y está yendo a la escuela a 8° grado.

Desde que tenía 20 años de edad, Gerber es agricultor de maíz, esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre. Actualmente, cultiva dos hectáreas a una distancia de 3 kilómetros en las faldas de un volcán, en unas tierras que tiene que rentar todos loa años y así es como se gana el sustento de él y de su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semillas para sembrar el maíz y también en la compra de insumos tales como abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, ya que ya tiene una buena parte de dinero y solo necesita ajustar para poder completar su presupuesto, además una pequeña parte será invertida en el arrendamiento de las tierras que cultivara.

Gerber tiene una ilusión más grande en su vida,  necesita construir su casa de ladrillo, ya que la que tiene actualmente es la mitad de palma de coco y la otra mitad de ladrillo y con la cosecha que sacara podrá pagar su crédito y la otra parte la invertirá en la construcción de la casa que hará y sabe que lo lograra con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
50-year old Gerber is a farmer. He has never attended school. He is married and has two sons, one of whom is married, has a son, and lives independently. His other son still lives at home and is in grade 8.

For twenty years Gerber has grown maize, a job he learned from his father. Currently he   farms two hectares of land which is located three km from his home, on the slopes of a volcano. He has to rent the land; this is how he earns money to support his family.

The loan that Gerber is seeking from CrediCampo is to buy maize seeds as well as such items as manure, fertilizer, herbicide etc. He already has some of the money he needs but lacks funds to complete his budget. Gerber also needs some money to lease the land he farms.

His greatest wish is to build a brick house as the one he has at the moment is partly made of coconut palms and partly brick. After the harvest he will be able to pay off his loan and start building the house. He knows that he will succeed with the help of the loan.

loans.use: Buy maize seeds, agricultural supplies, and pay the rent on his land

loans.name: Djekafo  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKAFO I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à GAMA, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le gombo avec  NIA, 2ème personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group DJEKAFO I are married women who average 35 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in GAMA, a village located in N’KOURABA, 2nd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 3rd loan cycle with the MFI. 

NIA grows groundnuts, millet and okra. She is the member standing 2nd from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village to a clientele consisting of resellers and consumers.  

Nia expects to earn an average profit of 195,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna de 42 años  de edad,  es madre  soltera no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de propia  se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de ropa interior y ropa para damas y caballeros.
Doña Reyna su venta es de lunes  a domingo, sus cliente son los amigos y personas que a diario visitan su negocio,  también vende lácteos en su carro hacia el Salvador.
Doña Reyna es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de zapatos, sandalias, tenis, blusas, camisas, pantalones, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener más utilidades, es un cliente que solicita su quinto préstamo. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Reyna is 42 years old, is a single mom, and has no dependent children. She lives in her own house. 

For the past five years she has been in the business of selling underwear and clothing for women and men. She works from Monday through Sunday and her customers are friends and people who visit her business every day.  She also sells dairy products from her cart on the road to El Salvador. 

Reyna is a hard worker who wishes to get ahead.  She is asking for the loan so that she can buy shoes, sandals, sneakers, blouses, shirts, pants, etc. This will allow her to improve her business and earn more profits.  This will be her fifth loan.  Her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, sneakers, blouses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Honorio

texts.en:
This is Honorio, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Benilda, who also operates a food stall business, and they have five children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Honorio operates a pineapple growing farm. He grows pineapple on their farm located in Cavite, in the highlands where it is suited to growing pineapple and other fruits. He sells his product in the market and fruit stores that he regularly supplies and to the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Honorio dreams of giving his children a good and quality education as well as improving and expanding his farming business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farming inputs for his business.

loans.name: Lolelai

texts.en: Lolelai is a 50-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living within her community. She has nine years of experience with this business. Lolelai needs a loan to buy spark plugs, a new pulling string, petrol, motor oil, safety glasses and new overalls. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lolelai joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, a new pulling string, petrol, motor oil, safety glasses and new overalls

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Las Exitosas, lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras, y es coordinado por la señora Arlen de 35 años de edad y soltera, que se dedica a la venta de artículos escolares en la librería de un colegio ubicado en su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace cuatro años, y solicita el crédito para la compra de memorias USB, manuales de computación, parlantes para computadoras y computadoras de escritorio, lapiceros, cuadernos, borradores, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores ha surtido su negocio con los productos que más demanda tienen por parte de los estudiantes, y se ha propuesto seguir ampliando su negocio. Las otras socias son la señora Julia de 25 años de edad, quien es estilista y comercializa productos AVON desde hace tres años y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de tintes, tratamientos para el cabello, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas, vanidades, cremas corporales, body, etc., y la señora Anielcka de 25 años de edad, quien elabora y vende bisuterías y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de alambre de amarre, piedras, candados pequeños, etc.
texts.en: The 'Las Exitosas' group is made up of 3 enterprising women. It is coordinated by Arlen, who is 33 years old and single. She sells school supplies in a school bookstore located in her community. She started this business 4 years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy USB flash drives, computer manuals, computer speakers, desktop computers, pens, notebooks, erasers, etc. With the previous loans, she has stocked up her business with products that are most in demand by the students and she decided to further expand her business. Another of the members is Jelua, 25, who is a stylist and has been selling Avon products for 3 years. Her loan will be used to buy dyes, hair treatments, lipstick, nail polish, makeup compacts, body lotions, etc. Anielcka, 25, makes and sells jewelry. Her loan will be used to buy tie wire, stones, clasps, etc.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Diriomito Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cuatro socios laboriosos, lo que le ha permitido emprender sus propios negocios, el grupo es coordinado por la señora Sofía quien tiene la edad de 22 años, casada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 3 años y 10 meses, quienes son motivos de su superación, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos Avon y recarga telefónicas (movistar y claro), el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cremas corporales, cremas para las manos, tratamientos para el cabello, perfumes para damas y caballeros, pinturas labiales, pinturas de unas, etc., con el objetivo de aumentar la clientela y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá reinvertir en su negocio y otra parte cubrir los gastos familiares. Los otros socios son la señora Meyling de 22 años de edad, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías, el señor Rodolfo de 22 años de edad, comerciante de productos varios como es frijol, arroz, aceite, azúcar, cacao, maíz, etc., al por mayor y al detalle en el mercado de la municipalidad, y la señora María Elena de 51 años de edad, quien comercializa ropa nueva en su comunidad y también se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cobertores, almohadas, camisas, blusas, sudaderas, etc.
texts.en:
This committed group is made up of four hardworking members. Working as a group has allowed them to start their own businesses. The group is coordinated by 22-year old Sra. Sofia who is married and has two children aged 3 and 10. They are the reason why she works so hard to get ahead.

Sofia earns her living selling Avon cosmetics and telephone cards (Movistar and Claro). She is seeking a loan to buy body lotion, hand cream, hair products, perfume for men and women, lipstick, nail polish etc. Then she will be able to increase her customer base and sales. This will allow her to invest more money in her business as well as cover family expenses.

The other members of the group are 22-year old Meyling who makes and sells crafts; 22-year old Rodolfo who sells beans, rice, oil, sugar, maize etc., both in bulk and in the local market; and 51-year Sra. María Elena who sells new clothing in the community as well as raising pigs in her home. The loan money María Elena is seeking will be used to buy blankets, pillows, shirts, blouses, sweatshirts etc.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and telephone cards

loans.name: Renafe

texts.en: Renafe lives in Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental province with her family. Her husband works as a private employee, and she manages their own banana farm to earn a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming and gives better return to improve their living. With her income, she was able to buy a motorcycle to use for their personal services. She took a new loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. Renafe wants to make sure that in the future, their main source of income will become certain.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 52 years old, married and has two children. As a way of generating income, he has engaged in a variety store business within his community in Cavite, Philippines for years now. He, together with his wife, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Manuel wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Manuel hopes for his business to flourish and dreams for his family to have a well-to-do life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business

loans.name: Geserie

texts.en:
Geserie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Geserie is 40 years old and her six children are in school.

Geserie has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Geserie requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Geserie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Geserie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. Her loan also helped in the education of her child, while her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She continues to work hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of Barley products. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Felicisima dreams that her business will continue to flourish and last longer. She hopes to give her child a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional stock of Barley products

loans.name: Ana Cleta

texts.en:
Ana Cleta previously obtained a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed for her business.
