Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household, and business expenses. She has been in this business for three years, and she is looking forward to expanding her business.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ana Cleta dreams of putting up her own service center and having a bigger customer connection. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel has been working with her husband on their own farm for many years to make a living. Planning to improve their income, they both decided to build a piggery business.

After joining GDMPC, she took a new loan to buy feeding supplies. Maridel hopes to increase her income as well as the general livelihood of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Juling

texts.en:
Juling is 39 years old, married, and has four children. They live in Tuguegarao City. She relies on income from buying and selling junk materials such as plastic bottles, cans, and jars. 

She patiently involves herself with this kind of business to sustain her family's needs, especially for the educational expenses of her children. Her daughter is a freshman student studying Secondary Education. Juling is very proud of her child, so she wanted to help her finish her studies. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees. She hopes to continue giving a good education to her child.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her child

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada has been growing bananas for more than nine years. She is earning better income from this, and it has supported her living expenses. 

With her farm, she was able to successfully repay her previous loan used for farming. She is thankful to Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) for having access to microfinance services. 

Recently, she took a new loan to cover the cost of land cultivating. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of land cultivating

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been engaged in a hog-raising business within her community to have additional income. She is 50 years old and blessed with three children. 

She and her husband aim to improve their status of living to give their children a better future. With this in mind, Marilyn would like to strengthen their business to generate sufficient income. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is seeking an additional 20,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. Being a diligent mother, she believes that this financial assistance will enable her to make the business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 56 years old, married and has three children. She is a vendor in their village, where she sells fruits and vegetables.

Her daughter, Maryjoy, wanted to become a teacher someday. She hopes to fulfill her daughter's dream, so that is why she is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees and allowances. This will help give the best education to her child. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowances

loans.name: Rafael De Jesús

texts.es:
Rafael  de 44 años de edad, es hombre que se dedica a la actividad agrícola, su nivel académico solo llega hasta 3° grado de educación básica.  Actualmente, vive solo junto a sus dos hijos los cuales están estudiando en la escuela, ya que le ha tocado sacarlos adelante ya que su madre falleció hace 4 años por un paro cardiaco. 

Rafael es agricultor y desde que era muy pequeño su padre le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura ya que tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela pero por muy pocos años, todas las mañanas salía con su padre a trabajar le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar maíz, frijol y jícama y ahora Rafael alquila dos hectáreas de terreno para sembrar jícama, esta actividad la está realizando desde hace 5 años, estas tierras le quedan a una distancia de 3 kilómetros pero esto no es nada de dificultad para realizar esta actividad, ya que en esta fecha a cultivado una hectárea de maíz en unas tierras que le presta un familiar para cultivarlas.

Este crédito será invertido en la compra de semillas,  el año que paso no logro comprar la semilla así que un vecino le venderá la cantidad que necesita para poder sembrar las dos hectáreas de jícama y la otra parte para comparar los insumos para darle mantenimiento al cultivo  hasta que haya dado sus frutos y así venderlas.

Rafael tiene un gran sueño en la vida, el cual consiste en cultivar estas dos hectáreas de jícama y con la venta de dicho cultivo podrá pagar los estudios de sus hijos para que en el futuro tengan mayores oportunidades de un buen empleo y sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
44-year old Rafael earns his living farming. He has a grade 3 education. He lives with his two children who attend school. It is up to him to raise them as their mother died four years ago from a heart attack.

Rafael is a farmer. Ever since he was young his father taught him how to work the land. He had the opportunity to go to school but only for a few years. Every morning he used to leave the house with his father to help him grow maize, beans, and jicama. For the last five years  Rafael has been growing his own jicama on two hectares of land which he rents. His fields are 3km from his home which doesn't cause him a problem. He also has one hectare where he grows maize on land that a relative rents to him.

The loan money will be used to buy seeds. Last year he didn't manage to buy seeds. A neighbour will sell him the seeds he needs for two hectares of jicamas. The rest of the loan money will be used to buy agricultural supplies so he can look after the plants before selling the produce.

Rafael's big dream is to use the money from the harvest of the jicamas to pay for his children's education. Then they will have better opportunities to get get good jobs. He knows he will succeed with the help of this loan.

loans.use: Buy jicama seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jesery

texts.en:
Jesery is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Jesery's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. 

Jesery requested a housing loan from NWTF for 9,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Jesery has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With this loan, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Jesery would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 4 hijos, y reside  en una aldea del municipio de Siguatepeque, cerca de Taulabe. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, anteriormente cultivaba hortalizas y hace  10 años  se dedica al cultivo de café. Esta producción la vende en grano oro en la misma zona. Esta solicitando el segundo ciclo de préstamo que es de 25,000 lempiras, este mismo lo utilizara en la compra de abonos para su cultivo y le ayudara a mejorar la producción. Su plan es sembrar una manzana más de café para incrementar la producción.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old, he lives with his common law wife with whom he has four children. He lives in a village in the Siguatepeque municipality, near Taulabe. 

He has always worked in agriculture, he previously grew vegetables but spent the last 10 years growing coffee. He sells the coffee beans in the same area.

He is asking for his second loan, of 25,000 lempiras, that he will use to buy fertlizers for his crops and will help him improve his output. His plan is to sow another plot (approx. 1.7 acres) of coffee to increase his output.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing coffee.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She is a vendor while her spouse is a farmer. Her daughter Shirlyn is a biology student in her second year in college. 

Evangeline has insufficient funds for education so she requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to pay tuition fees for her child. This loan will help provide good education for Shirlyn who will become successful in her chosen career.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for her child

loans.name: Djekafo  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKAFO II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à GAMA, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le mil et le gombo avec  KOROTOUMOU, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  145.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djekafo 11 group are married woman of an average age of 35 years with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Gama, one of the villages in N’kouraba, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming activities in the winter.
This is their third rural loan from the institution.
Korotoumou grows peanut, millet and gumbo. She is the first person standing on the left in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds and to pay labour costs for the upkeep of 1.5 hectares.
She sells the production in the village after the harvest to a clientele of consumers and retailers.
She hopes to make an average profit of 145.000FCFA per plot of land.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour costs, to purchase fertiliser and seeds.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has helped her husband work on their own farm for many years. Aside from the crop business, she has raised pigs and sells them in town. 

With her income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying feed. To help her raise more pigs, she recently took a new loan to buy additional piglets.

Hoping to have better income from this, she is planning to build a piggery to enhance the business. In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: José Nemesio

texts.es: Don José es un hombre soñador, un hombre al que le gustaría tener un gran negocio, tener mejores ingresos y vivir tranquilamente, Don José inicio su propio negocio cuando tenía 40 años de edad con el que logro sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que ahora ya son independientes de él. A sus 59 años Don José ha estado viendo la necesidad de mejorar su motor de trabajo que es su molino para carne y/o granos como maíz, cacao, trigo entre otros de igual forma la de su local donde atiende a todos sus clientes. Es por tal razón que desea realizar un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su molino y comprar otro nuevo y brindarles un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes. Estima que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener más ganancias y de esta manera lograr agrandar su local de trabajo. Sus principales metas son construir otros nuevos locales donde viven sus hijos y prestar el servicio del  molino.
texts.en:
José is a dreamer, a man who would like to have a big business, to have a better income and to live peacefully. José started his own business when he was 40 years old and with this achievement he supported his three children who are now all independent from him. At 59 years old, José noticed the need to repair his work machinery, which is his grinder for meat and/or grains such as corn, cocoa, wheat, among other things from his area, where he tends to all of his customers. 

He hopes to get a loan to do maintenance on his grinder and to buy a new one, to give his customers better service. He thinks the loan he requested will be very helpful since he will be able to make a larger profit and make his shop bigger. His main goals are to build other new shops where his children live and to lend his services of the grinder.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his grinder and to buy a new one.

loans.name: Djekafo  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJEKAFO III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à GAMA, un des villages de N’KOURABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  OROKIA, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djekafo 111 group are married woman of an average age of 32 with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Gama, one of the villages in N’kouraba, in the second administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming activities in the winter.
This is their third rural loan from the institution.
Orokia grows peanut and millet. She is the first person standing on the left in the photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy products for the earth, seeds and to pay labour costs for the upkeep of 1 hectare.
She sells the production in the village after the harvest to a clientele of consumers and retailers.
She hopes to make an average profit of 95.000FCFA per plot of land.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with his daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay labour costs, to buy fertiliser and seeds.

loans.name: Florante

texts.en:
Florante is 61 years old and has 10 children, four of whom live with him. He is a rice farmer. He pays laborers who help him in the farming business.

Florante requested a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides and pay for labor costs. With a good harvest, he will be able to earn more profits and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 44 years old and married. He has three children who are studying in school. He relies on an income he earns through a farming business. His wife also helps him with the business. They plant and harvest rice with the help of laborers he pays also. He is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for use in farming. These farm inputs will help prevent pests that will affect the growth of his crops. 

Robert hopes to achieve a productive harvest and earn good profits some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for use in farming.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by the super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her pig-fattening business and has been in NWTF since 2012.  Juanita is now requesting a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Juanita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maa Annapurna Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Annapurna SHG (Self Help Group) is a newly formed group. It is made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation. 

Sitaya is the lady in the picture who is seated fifth from left, the featured borrower of the group. She is 27 years old and is a married mother of a son. She sells seasonal fruits and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than four years. She sells fresh fruits like oranges, apples, bananas, pineapples, guavas, etc. With her new loan, she plans to buy fresh fruits in bulk to resell. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings so as to better establish her business. 

Other members of this group are engaged in different businesses like milk selling, fish selling, vegetable selling, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg Group

texts.en:
Tikeswar, aged 30, is the leader of this "Maa Thakurani SHG" group that hails from a small village of Balangir district of Odisha state, India. She lives with her parents and her three children. Tikeswar is running a grocery store in her locality, keeping daily household items with the support of her husband. 

Tikeswar, along with ten other members of her village, formed this group and wants to take out a loan for the first time from People's Forum for the development of their existing businesses. Tikeswar will use her portion to purchase sugar, edible oil, flour, rice, biscuits, detergent powder, etc., in bulk. Currently she is earning about 3,000 INR per month from her business, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. She hopes that after the investment in the shop, she will be able to make 6,000 INR per month. 

The other members have businesses such as a grocery shop, dry foods business, a fancy store and vegetable shop. All the members are very grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the globe for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, edible oil, flour, rice, biscuits, detergent powder, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Actualmente ella vive solo junto a su hijo, en la casa de su madre quien le apoya moralmente.

 Carolina tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa que es la elaboración y venta de pupusas, actividad que aprendió de una amiga a quien ella le trabajaba todos los fines de semana en un lugar que le llaman tiangue, que es donde se comercializa ganado de este modo ella decidió poner su propio negocio hace dos años, Carolina vende cuatro días a la semana, además de esta actividad económica ella tiene otro tipo de ingresos el cual es el envío de remesas que su pareja le envía todos los fines de cada mes.

El dinero de este préstamo será invertido en la compra de una plancha industrial, la cual le sera muy util, ya que la que tiene es muy pequeña, además comprara una refrigeradora para vender bebidas heladas y guardar parte de comida la cual pone a la venta.

El sueño de Carolina es que su negocio mejore y poder poner un pequeño comedor con este mejorara sus ingresos, ya que tendrá una mayor variedad de bebidas para vender y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Carolina currently lives alone with her son in her mother's house. Her mother is a source of moral support.

Carolina has a small business making and selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas), which she learned how to do from a friend. Carolina worked with her friend every weekend at the tiangue, the livestock market, but two years ago she decided to start her own business.  She sells four days per week. Besides this business, she has another source of income which are the remittances her partner sends at the end of every month.

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of an industrial griddle, which will be very useful since the one she has is very small. She will also buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks and to keep some of the food she sells in it. Carolina's dream is for her business to expand and to add a small dining room.  This will increase her income and she will have a greater variety of drinks to sell.  She knows that she will be able to accomplish this with the support of the loan.

loans.use: to buy an industrial griddle which will be very useful because the one she has is very small. She will also buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks and to keep the food she sells in it.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 50 years old, married and has four children. She and her spouse are farmers, planting and harvesting rice to sell. Her husband is also a carpenter. In order to ensure good crop nutrition, she has to give enough farm inputs to her crops. So, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming. 

Someday, she hopes to keep maintaining healthy crops to increase production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en: Leilanie, age 29, is married and blessed with four children. She manages an auto repair shop in her village and earns a net income of PHP 2,500 daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase a compressor and double piston for her auto repair shop. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable so she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor and double piston for her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Dilhayo

texts.ru: Дилхаё вместе со своими родителями живет в отдаленном регионе на Севере Таджикистана. Она не замужем. Дилхаё с детства мечтала стать портнихой и шить красивые женские платья и таким образом радовать милых дам своего района. Она 2 месяца назад осуществила свою детскую мечту. Она начала свой бизнес предоставлением услуги швеи местным жителям. Дилхаё теперь хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С такой целью она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она уверена, в том, что ее бизнес будет развеваться. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и вышивальной машинки.  Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilhayo lives with her parents in a remote region of northern Tajikistan. She is not married. Since childhood she has dreamed of becoming a seamstress and sewing beautiful dresses for the lovely ladies of her area. Two months ago she was able to realize her dream and start a local sewing business. Now she would like to expand her business and increase her profits.  She participated in the course "Achieving Success," organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She is confident that her business will succeed. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 somoni to purchase a sewing machine and an embroidery machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing and embroidery machines for a new business

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo ditrito de Oyotún, que esta en la rpovincia de Chiclayo, región de Lamabyeque, costa norte de Perú.

Diana se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, pavos, cerdos, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio: ella solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, asi aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y con ello tambien mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old, and married with two children. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, in the Chiclayo province, Lamabyeque region, in the north coast of Peru.

Diana makes a living breeding and selling animals, such as roosters, chickens, turkeys, pigs, etc. She has over 10 years experience in the business, which is located in her home. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals; this investment will give her a bigger variety and productivity of animals, which will greatly effect her business. Increasing her supply of animals will meet the diverse tastes and needs of customers in the area, which will increase her income, improve her profits, thereby improving her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals, to have a greater variety and productivity of animals, which will greatly effect her business.

loans.name: Claudia Azucena

texts.es:
Claudia, está acompañada, comparte una vivienda familiar con su abuela, su compañero de vida y un hijo, en este momento se encuentra a la de espera del nacimiento de su próximo hijo; ella es propietaria de una tienda de en la que ofrece productos de la canasta básica y otros productos de uso doméstico, atiende en un horario de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche todos los días, el negocio lo heredo de su abuela y es su fuente de ingresos para cubrir parte de los gastos familiares.
Invertirá en la compra de jabón, granos básicos, aceite, pan, azúcar, sal, bebidas, etc., tendrá mejor surtido su negocio, espera aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, para cancelar puntualmente las cuotas de la deuda adquirida y mejorar el estilo de vida que ella y su familia tienen en este momento.
Sus sueños son ir ampliando su negocio, sobresalir más ente la competencia y cuidar del bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is in a relationship and shares the family home with her grandmother, her life companion, and her child. At the moment, she is awaiting the birth of her next child. Claudia is the owner of a store where she offers basic staples and other household goods. She attends to the store on a schedule from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. every day. Claudia took over the business from her grandmother and it serves as a source of income for covering part of her family’s expenses.

She will invest in the purchase of soap, basic grains, oil, bread, sugar, salt, beverages, and other products. Her store will be better stocked, so Claudia expects to increase her sales and earnings. This will allow her to submit her loan payments on time and to improve the lifestyle that she and her family have at the moment.

Her dreams include expanding her business, staying ahead of the competition, and looking after the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, basic grains, oil, bread, sugar, salt, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora  Gladis de 61 años  de edad es casada,   vive con sus  dos nietos y su madre  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 17 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería.
Doña Gladis su negocio está ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, también vende comidas, frescos, sopas de mondongo, tortillas para baleadas y agua en bolsa, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, gracias a su actividad ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Doña Gladis está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como aceite, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, plátanos, leche, huevos, etc. para surtir su negocio,  espera que con esta inversión pueda mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante, está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma y es el tercer préstamo uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Gladis is 61 years old, married, and lives with her mother and her two grandchildren. She has made a living for the past 17 years in the business of grocery sales. Dona Gladis' business is located in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. In her shop, she sells everything related to the family basket, including ready meals, soft drinks, vegetable soup, tortillas for baleadas, and bottled water.

She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman with a lot of desire to succeed. Thanks to her hard work, she has provided well for her children. Dona Gladis is asking for a loan in order to buy groceries like oil, sugar, rice, beans, cheese, butter, bananas, milk, eggs, etc. to stock her business. She hopes that with this investment she will be able to raise her income and continue improving. She is very grateful for her third loan from Prisma, and she dreams of continuing to better her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2014.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice, beans, cheese, butter, bananas, milk, eggs, etc. for her business

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luís de 46 años de edad, es un señor agricultor, estudio hasta sexto grado. Actualmente, esta casado desde hace 4 años; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domesticos y de ves en cuando tambien hace ventas en la comunidad, ella hace pan y sale a vender. Tienen 6 hjos en comun y solo la ultima hija estudia va al instituto, con ellos viven 3 nietos mas pero de Luís solo dependen 4.

Luís se dedica a la agricultura, él dice que ya lleva casi 14 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, siembra de maiz y frijoles, lo aprendio de sus padres que en sus tiempos solo a la agricultura se dedicaban y pues fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron este trabajo a él, viendo la situacion que él no podia encontrar otro trabajo decidio dedicarse a la siembra de maíz y frijol, el terreno donde ellos cultivan esta retirado de su casa hacen unas 4 horas de camino y viajan en carro, su esposa tambien le colabora mucho, ya que cuando puede viaja con él para ayudarle con los trabajos de la milpa, los horarios dependen a veces de 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 11:30 y por la tarde de 2:00 pm hasta las 5:00 pm

Hace un año él solicito un crédito con otra institución, pero en esa siembra nada pudo cosechar ya que perdio la cosecha, y el crédito aun no lo a podido terminar de cancelar, por eso él solicita este crédito para poder cancelar, y otra parte para invertirle a su milpa. 

Tiene la esperanza que con lo que se coseche este año podra cancelar el crédito.Desea que Dios le permita poder tener buena salud ya que esta enfermo , y que su familia este bien, para él poder seguir trabajando y poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos con el alimento diario.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old. He is a farmer and has a sixth grade education. He is currently married, and his wife of four years is a homemaker. Once in a while she also goes out to the community to sell home-baked bread. They have six children together and only the youngest daughter is still in school. Three grandchildren also live with them but Luis has only four dependants. 

Luis has been a farmer for almost fourteen years. He grows corn and beans, and learned from his parents. Back then his parents' only source of income was farming, so they taught him how to do this work. When he found himself in the situation of not being able to find any other job, he decided to work growing corn and beans. The land he farms is far away from his home, so they travel about four hours by car. His wife also helps him a lot since, whenever she can, she travels with him to help him on the cornfield. His schedule varies. Sometimes it is from 6:30 am to 11:30 am and from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm.

A year ago, he requested a loan from a different organization, but he wasn't able to harvest anything because his crop was lost. He hasn't been able to finish paying off the debt, which is why he is requesting this loan. He will also use part of it to invest in his cornfield.

He is hopeful that this year's harvest will allow him to pay off this loan. Since he is ill, he hopes that God will allow him to be in good health so that he can keep working and helping to support his children for his family to be well.

loans.use: to pay off a debt incurred last year with a different organization.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 42 años de edad, es un agricultor que parte de su vida se a dedica al cultivo de maíz, no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico ya que cuando estaba pequeño sus padres no le tomaron importancia al estudio.  Está acompañado y de dicho hogar a procreado un hijo el cual está estudiando 3° grado en la escuela de su cantón.

Gran parte de su vida la ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz, empezó a trabajar cuando tenía 12 años trabajando como jornal junto a su padre salían muy temprano todos los días a limpiar las milpas de personas que cultivaban  y de esa manera se ganaba el pan de cada día junto a su padre, actualmente se dedica a la misma actividad con la gran diferencia que ahora su trabajo es propio ya que ha tenido mucha experiencia  en la actividad así que desde hace 6 años él trabaja propio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semillas para sembrar el maíz y también en la compra de insumos tales como abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, ya que tiene una buena parte de dinero y solo necesita ajustar para poder completar su presupuesto.

Él tiene un sueño en la vida, el cual consiste en darle el estudio académico a su hijo, ya que él no tuvo esa oportunidad, también parte de las ganancias que obtendrá del fruto de su cultivo va a mejorar su vivienda y sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel is 42 years old and is a farmer who has spent part of his life growing corn. He has no education because when he was small his parents did not think that going to school was important. He has a life partner and they have one child who is in third grade at the local school. 

Miguel began working when he was 12 years old as a day laborer with his father. They would leave early each morning to clear the farmers' corn fields and this is how he and his father earned their daily bread.  Today he works in the same business, but the big difference is that with all of his experience he started his own business 6 years ago and now works for himself.  The loan he is asking CrediCampo for is to buy seeds to plant corn and also to buy supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and herbicide.  He has most of the money he needs, but the loan will provide the shortfall to meet his budget.

He has a lifetime dream which is to provide his son with an education, since he did not have that opportunity.  He also will use some of his earnings from his crops to improve his house.  He knows that he will achieve these goals with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn and also to buy supplies such as manure, fertilizer, herbicide as he has most of the money but just needs a bit more to meet his budget.

loans.name: Jay Bajarang Bali Shg Group

texts.en:
The Jai Bajarang Bali SHG (self help group) is made up of 12 members. All of them are from one of the small villages of Balangir district of Odisha state, India. All the women met because they are from the same village and community and chose to get a loan in a mutually supportive group, and in that way be able to help themselves economically to invest in their different businesses. 

Jangya, who is the president of the group and has the responsibility of making the payments on time, has an economic activity involving cultivating and selling vegetables. In the picture, the lady standing fourth from right is Jangya. She wakes up very early to pluck the vegetables from the plants so she can sell fresh vegetables in the market to satisfy her customers. 

She wants the funding to invest in her business by purchasing a higher quality of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. The other members of this group are engaged in different livelihood activities like fish selling, a grocery shop, a food stall, etc. All the members are very happy and thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase a higher quality of seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Heber Alonso

texts.es:
Heber es un joven de 33 años de edad, reside en Tegucigalpa. Actualmente realiza sus estudios universitarios a distancia, en la universidad Metropolitana de Honduras donde espera graduarse de Ingeniero en negocios.
Heber se considera un joven amigable, luchador en diferentes circunstancias de la vida que persevera hasta el final de sus metas, es sociable en cuanto a entornos laborales y amigable siempre con las personas.
Su principal motivación para convertirse en profesional académico, es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia,brindando un ambiente de seguridad para vivir y en su empresa desempeñarse como una persona competitiva en sus actividades laborales.
Heber considera que la mejor forma de contribuir al desarrollo de su país es generar empleos mediante la creación de su propia empresa. 
En cuanto a experiencias que le han enseñado el valor del estudio y preparación académica, Heber recuerda muchas veces haber pasado situaciones que lo hacían sentir de bajo rendimiento ante sus compañeros de trabajo, ya que la mayoría de ellos habían finalizado sus estudios y el no sentía la motivación de seguir su carrera universitaria. Fue hasta ese entonces que decidió tomar la mejor decisión de su vida y es la de seguir estudiando para cumplir sus metas.
Heber agradece a muchas personas que le apoyan en este proceso,por creer en su espíritu de superación día a día.
En sus planes a futuro, desea convertirse en un joven preparado profesionalmente para crear su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Heber is a young man of 33 who lives in the Alemán district of Tegucigalpa.

He is currently  undertaking his university studies, by distance learning, at the Metropolitan University of Honduras where he expects to graduate as a business engineer.

Heber considers himself to be a friendly young man, determined in life's different circumstances, someone who perseveres until he achieves his goals. He is sociable in working environments and always friendly with people.

His main motivation to become an academically-qualified professional is to improve his family's living conditions, providing a safe environment in which to live, and to operate within his business as a competitive person in his work activities.

Heber believes that the best way to contribute to the development of his country is to generate jobs through the creation of his own company. 

With regard to experiences that have taught him the value of  studying and academic preparation, Heber recalls often having been in  situations that made him feel he was performing poorly compared with his work colleagues, as most of them had completed their studies and he had not felt the motivation to continue his university career. It was then that he decided to take the best decision of his life: to continue studying to accomplish his goals.

Heber thanks many people for their support in this process, by believing in his spirit of  improving himself day by day.

In his plans for the future, he wants to become a young man professionally prepared to start his own company.

loans.use: to complete his university studies

loans.name: Xiomara Judith

texts.es:
Judith se considera una joven trabajadora y responsable en cada aspecto de su vida.
A sus 39 años de edad es madre soltera y  actualmente reside en Tegucigalpa desde hace 10 años en donde vive con sus padres, su hermano y su hija de 13 años. 
Actualmente esta por culminar sus estudios universitarios, obtendrá el titulo de licenciada en mercadotecnia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación propia.
El motivo principal para continuar estudiando es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y su pequeña hija. la joven quiere contribuir al desarrollo de su país mediante los conocimientos y experiencias adquiridas a lo largo de su vida y carrera universitaria.
Como experiencia y a la ves aprendizaje,la joven considera que para lograr las metas y objetivos que uno se propone en la vida se debe pasar por obstáculos, los cuales son superados mediante la fe y esperanza de querer seguir adelante.
La joven desea en un futuro continuar sus estudios de maestría y así capacitarse lo mas que pueda ya que vivimos en un mundo totalmente cambiante y es solamente para personas valientes que deseen afrontar los retos del diario vivir.
texts.en:
Judith considers herself a hard-working and responsible young woman in every aspect of her life.  At 39, she is a single mother and resides in the Tegucigalpa community where she has lived for 10 years with her parents, brother, and her 13-year-old daughter.

She is currently about to finish her university studies; after much effort and dedication, she will get a bachelor's degree in marketing.  Her primary motive to continue school is to improve the living conditions of her family and young daughter.  Judith wants to contribute to the development of her country through knowledge and acquired experiences throughout her life and her university career.

Through experience and learning, Judith believes that to achieve the goals that one sets up in life, one has to cross obstacles which are overcome through the faith and hope of wanting to succeed.

In the future, Judith wants to continue her graduate studies and thus prepare herself as much as possible since we live in a world that is completely changing and it is only the brave people who want to confront the goals of their everyday life.

loans.use: to finish her university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a door, and iron bars, bricks, cement, sand and gravel to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Brenda Beatriz

texts.es:
Brenda, vive en una vivienda familiar con su madrastra y dos hijos en edades de 2 y 5 años, ella es la que tiene la responsabilidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante; por necesidad de tener recursos económicos para costear sus gastos y los de sus hijos desde hace 2 años se dedica a vender tortillas y variedad de cosméticos, el oficio lo aprendió hace 3 años con uno de sus tíos, lo realiza junto a su madrastra, su horario para elaborar la venta de tortillas es de 6:00 a.m. a 12:00 m. y el resto de la tarde se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, su ventaja es que la zona donde lo realiza no tiene competencia.
EL capital que requiere lo utilizara para construir un corredor en el que ubicara un espacio especial para el negocio, de esta manera sus clientes se resguardaran del sol o la lluvia mientras esperan que les atienda,  se mantendrá trabajando, no representa dificultades ya que la zona en donde vive no existe mucha delincuencia y mantiene la fidelidad de sus clientes.
Brenda comenta que sus proyectos son mantener su negocio funcionando, finalizar la construcción de su vivienda y dar a sus hijos oportunidades de superación académica.
texts.en:
Brenda lives in a home with her stepmother and two children, aged 2 and 5. She is the only who has all the responsibility for raising and providing for her children. In order to have economic resources and pay for the cost of her (and her children's) expenses, she has made a living selling tortillas and a variety of cosmetics for the past two years. 

She learned of this trade three years ago with one of her uncles, and she now performs it together with her stepmother. They sell tortillas from 6am to 12pm. The rest of the afternoon they make a living selling cosmetics, an advantage being that in her area, she has no competition.

The capital that she needs will be used to build a corridor in her house so she can have a special space for her business. Here her customers will be able to be protected from the sun and rain while they wait. Luckily she does not have many difficulties, because there is little crime where she lives, and she has maintained customer loyalty.

Brenda says her hopes are to keep her business running, to finalize the construction of her home, and to give her children opportunities for academic improvement.

loans.use: to build a corridor in her house so that she will have a special space for her business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 50 años, separada, vive en casa propia, junto a sus 02 hijos, quienes actualmente trabajan, su familia es unida, y viven en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia, que esta ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costs nrote de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, cuenta con ganado lechero, patos, cerdos, pollos y chivos. Además cuenta con ingresos por pensión de alimentos por el padre de sus hijos, necsita el préstamo para invertir en compra de animales, mantenimiento de cultivo y gastos personales para una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 50 years old, separated from her spouse, and lives in her own home along with her two children who are currently working. Her family is close. They live in a community that is known for trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding. It is located in the District of Cayaltí in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Luz Marina raises and sells animals. She has dairy cows, ducks, pigs, chickens, and goats. In addition, she receives a food stipend from the father of her children. Luz needs a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of animals, the maintenance of her crops, and personal expenses in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals, pay for crop maintenance, and cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 24-year-old resident of Silang,Cavite, Philippines, operates a "Buko" business (more commonly known as coconut business). She is single and works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. She helps her family to provide for their needs.

Jennifer buys coconut fruit that are native to the Philippines, which are grown mostly in the South Region of Luzon. She also sells other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coconut to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jennifer hopes to grow her investment and increase her profit through all her hard work. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for coconut needed in her business.

loans.name: La Colonia Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Colonia, lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras, es coordinado por la señora Ana de 57 años de edad y acompañada, cuyo negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos en las calles de su comunidad, este negocio lo impulso hace cinco años con ayuda de su compañero de vida, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas corporales, tratamiento para el cabello, body, vanidades, rubores, delineadores, etc., además la compra de blusas, camisetas, short, jean, trajes para niños, etc. Las otras integrantes son la señora Cruz Lorena de 40 años de edad y propietaria de una mini pulpería en su domicilio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de gaseosas, frutas, azúcar, etc., y la señora María Gabriela de 23 años de edad, quien comercializa cosméticos tanto en su comunidad como en su domicilio desde hace tres años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Colonia is made up of three enterprising women and is coordinated by Ana. She is 57 years old and has a life partner. Her business is selling new clothing and cosmetics in the streets of her neighborhood. She started this business five years ago with the help of her life partner.

Ana is asking for the loan so she can buy fragrances for men and women, body lotions, hair and body treatments, blusher, eyeliner, etc. Additionally, she will buy blouses, undershirts, shorts, jeans, children's clothing, etc.

The other members are Cruz Lorena who is 40 years old and owns a mini grocery which she runs out of her house. She will use loan proceeds to buy soft drinks, fruit, sugar, etc.. The other one is Maria Gabriela who is 23 years old. She has been selling cosmetics throughout her neighborhood and from her home for the past three years.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning is 54 years old and married.  She has three children. With one child still in school, Luningning works very hard to provide for them. Luningning's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Luningning has restarted her fishing and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Luningning has taken a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Luningning is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amalia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Amalia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes, accessories, perfumes, cosmetics, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lita

texts.en:
Ma. Lita is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Lita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.
.
In the future, Ma. Lita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina is 41 years old and has two children. Maria Gina is married and has one child who is currently in school.  Maria Gina and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Maria Gina is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Maria Gina has been an NWTF borrower since 2012..

With your help, Maria Gina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Don Julio Antonio es una persona muy trabajadora, labora para el sector publico, su esposa diario sale a vender de forma ambulante ropa usada y de esta manera se gana el pan de cada día, ambos han luchado por salir adelante con mucho sacrificio y brindan lo mejor a sus tres hijos que son menores de edad.  Don Julio se refiere a Afodenic para solicitar un crédito con Kiva que necesita para terminar la construcción de un porche que inicio y le falta el techo y el piso; así brindar mejores condiciones y espacio a su familia por quienes trabaja y son prioridad en su vida.
texts.en:
Don Julio Antonio is a very hard working person.  He works in the public sector and his wife sells second-hand clothing door-to-door. This is how they earn their daily bread. Both have struggled to get ahead with a great deal of sacrifice, and they provide the best for their three children who are still young. 

Julio has come to AFODENIC to request a Kiva loan which he needs to complete construction on a porch he started, but it still needs the roof and floor. This will provide better living conditions and more space for the family he works so hard for and who are the priority in his life.

loans.use: to build a porch in the back of his house.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo has been in his ice delivery services for more than three years. He delivers ice in the market for vendors using ice. The business is doing well enough that it sustains their daily expenditures. He had joined GDMPC and is taking a new loan to buy a container used for iced cube delivery. His previous loan for the business was successfully repaid. He had competitors but with good services rendered to his customers, he had no trouble having more customers to patronize his business. In the future, he wants to acquire a vehicle to be used for delivery.

loans.use: to acquire a freezer for his ice-supply business.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Myrna's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Myrna is taking out a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Myrna has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Marcia has engaged in a variety store business within her community for almost a year now.  She is 41 years of age and blessed with four children. Her husband, Neri, helps her in their business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Marcia wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. 

Marcia hopes that as she expands her business, there will also a significant increase in her profit. She dreams for her children to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis Antonio de 43  años de edad, vive con su esposa,  tiene 01 hijo que dependen de él,  posee casa propia, se dedica desde hace 24  años al negocio del transporte y sus clientes son los alumnos de las escuelas, iglesias, colegios, vecinos y amigos que lo conocen.
Don Luis Antonio vive  en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de tres  llantas nuevas, para  seguirles brindando el servicio de transporte a sus clientes, con el apoyo del préstamo espera  mejorar su unidad de transporte, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma y es su tercer préstamo que solicita.
Don Luis Antonio uno de sus sueños es seguir mejorando su carro y comprarse otra unidad.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis Antonio is 43 years old and lives with his wife. He has a dependent child. Luis owns his home. For the past 24 years, he has been in the transportation business. His customers include elementary and high school students, churchgoers, neighbors, and friends who know him.

Don Luis Antonio lives in a community in San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. He is requesting a loan in order to buy three new tires so that he can continue providing transportation services to his customers. With the help of this loan, he hopes to improve his vehicle. He is pleased to continue working with Prisma. This is the third loan he has requested. Among his dreams are to continue improving his vehicle and to purchase another one.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy new tires for his bus.

loans.name: Bibiroziya

texts.ru:
Бибирозия жительница района Вахш. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. Бибирозия общительная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она мать четверых детей. У нее трое мальчиков и дочь. Сыновьям 19, 16 и 14 лет. Самой младшей, дочери, 6 лет. Муж Бибирозии временно не работает. Он целыми днями работает на земельном участке, который при их доме, чтобы получить овощи со своего огорода и сэкономить на покупки овощей. Бибирозия имеет среднее образование. Из-за того что у нее нет высшего образования она решила заняться животноводством. Вот уже шесть лет она занимается этим видом деятельности. Трудится во благо своих детей. В молодости она не смогла получить высшее образование, но своим детям она постарается помочь получить высшее образование. 
Бибирозия берет кредит для закупа коровы и несколько голов телят, чтобы расширить свою деятельность и откладывать деньги для обеспечения хорошего будущего своим детям.
texts.en: Bibiroziya is a resident of the Vakhsh district. She is 48 years old and married. Bibiroziya is a sociable and hardworking woman. She is a mother of four children. She has three boys and one daughter. Her sons are 19,16 and 14 years old. Her youngest, the daughter, is 6 years old. Bibiroziya's husband is temporarily unemployed. He spends entire days working on the land plot by their house to grow vegetables in order to save money by not buying vegetables. Bibiroziya has a secondary education. Because she does not have a higher education, she decided to get involved in animal husbandry. She has now been involved in this business for six years. She works to benefit her children. In her youth, she could not obtain a higher education, but will try to help her children obtain it. Bibiroziya is requesting this loan to buy a cow and several calves to expand her business and save money to provide a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow and several calves to expand her business and save money to provide a good future for her children

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is a farmer and a responsible father who raises his family in a rural community. He aims to improve his farming business to generate sufficient income and sustain the necessities of his family. To expand his plantation, he is in need of PHP40,000 additional capital to buy the needed herbicides and fertilizer for his crops. Being a patient and hard working father, he is hoping that he will be having high yields this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizer for his crop production

loans.name: Neyda

texts.en:
Neyda and Augusto are partners in life and in their business, FN Beauty and Spa Supply. When they moved to the United States with their young son, they saw the beauty industry as an opportunity to provide a livelihood for their family. 

After starting the business last fall, they have seen an increase in customers. Their determination and ability to reach beauty salon owners in their community has helped them to grow the business. However, in order to continue, they need capital to order inventory to sell to their interested clients.   

Help this dedicated pair grow their business!

loans.use: to purchase inventory to supply to their client base.

loans.name: Aravela

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Aravela works hard to support her family.  She has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. Aravela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her beauty parlor.

Aravela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Jaina

texts.en:
Jaina is 48 years old and married.  She has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Jaina has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aileen is 27 years old and both of her children are in school.
Aileen has a fruit business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of fruits to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits to sell in food stall.

loans.name: Euphemia

texts.en:
Euphemia is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits, vegetables, and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables, and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits, vegetables, and charcoal

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She is 40 years old and currently resides with her husband, Noel, in Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for thirteen years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Josefina would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of 20,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely wants you to know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Josefina hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She dreams to give her children a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира в возрасте 43 лет начинает новый бизнес. Она планирует открыть бизнес откорм-продажа скота в своем районе Гончи. Замира по профессии швея и в течение 15 лет занимается шитьем женских платьев. Ее муж уже многие годы ездит в Россию на заработки. Замира хочет улучшить уровень жизни семьи и поэтому решила параллельно начать животноводческий бизнес. У Замиры при дворе есть хороший сарай для содержания скотов и она уже запаслась кормом для скотов. Теперь для купли крупноргатых скотин ей не хватает 2000 долларов США. Она запрашивает эту сумму в кредит. Она очень надеется на финансовую поддержку, так как благодаря кредиту в ее семье появится еще один источник дохода и она сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи в лучшую сторону.
texts.en: Zamira is 43 years old and starting a new business. She is planning to open a livestock fattening up and reselling business in her district of Gonchi. Zamira is a seamstress by profession and has bee involved in sewing women's dresses for 15 years. Her husband has been going to Russia for work for many years. Zamira wants to raise her family's standard of living and decided to concurrently start an animal husbandry business. Zamira has a good barn in her backyard for keeping livestock, and she has already stocked up on livestock feed. Now she is short 2000 US dollars to buy cattle. She is requesting this amount as a loan. She hopes very much for the financial support because, thanks to this loan, her family would have another source of income, and she would be able to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to start a new business

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 45 years old, married, and has six children.  She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Rhoda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Rhoda has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lorna works hard to support her family.  She has a rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Bahman

texts.en:
Anyone who’s skeptical of the holistic or alternative medicine industries needs only to speak with Bahman for five minutes to be convinced of its efficacy. Bahman has impressed licensed medical doctors with his knowledge of anatomy and his ability to apply that knowledge to pain cases that conventional medicine has difficulty treating.

Bahman currently holds a license as a Holistic Health Practitioner and is working on his dissertation for a Ph.D. in Holistic Medicine. He has chosen to specialize in sport medicine and pain management, and is able to treat cases of frozen shoulder, carpal tunnel, plantar fasciitis and range-of-motion issues using holistic methods rather than the approach called for in conventional medicine: invasive surgery.

Growing up in Germany, he began his career working at German engineering giant Siemens before tiring of corporate life and moving to the US twelve years ago. He eventually got into holistic health, and also works as a yoga instructor and conducts wellness seminars with doctors and other colleagues in the medical field.

Bahman will use his Kiva loan to purchase equipment, such as a UV lamp, precursor and a cold laser, that will help him better treat his patients. With the help of Kiva lenders, Bahman hopes to continue to help relieve his patients’ pain without the need for surgery, and thus help people lead richer, more rewarding lives.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, such as a UV lamp, precursor and a cold laser, that will help him better treat his patients.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Saturnina has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income from selling used clothes.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a  fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.  Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocs of clothes to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Belinda has been in this business for 9 years. Belinda earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Khaticha

texts.ru: Хатича 26 летняя жительница дружелюбного района Гиссар. Хатича там живет со своей семьей. Хатича очень добрая милая и веселая девушка. Она недавно научилась шить и теперь хочет предоставлять услуги швеи. Хатича научилась шить женскую одежду, занавески и национальные ватные одеяла. Хатича училась шить с помощью старой швейной машинки. Теперь она считает, что стала хорошим специалистом, чтобы самостоятельно брать заказы на шитье и начать новую деятельность, которая сделает ее финансово независимой женщиной. Но Хатича понимает, что с такой швейной машинкой она не продвинется вперед и намерена приобрести новую модернизированную швейную машинку, но так как она только начинает бизнес на машинку у нее не хватает средств и Хатича просит ей помочь. Хатича надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Khaticha is a 26-year-old resident of the friendly Gissar district. Khaticha lives there with her family. Khaticha is a very kind, cute and happy young woman. She recently learned how to sew and now wants to provide seamstress services. Khaticha learned to sew women's clothing, drapes and national cotton blankets. Khaticha learned to sew with a help of an old sewing machine. Now she thinks that she has become a good specialist to independently accept sewing orders and start a new business, which would make her a financially independent woman. But Khaticha understands that she cannot advance with such an old sewing machine and intends to buy a new, modern sewing machine. However, since she is just starting her business, she does not have enough money and is asking for help. Khaticha hopes for Your support.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора несколько лет назад развелась с мужем. После развода она вернулась в дом своих родителей. Данное время она живет вместе со своими братьями. Гулнора была вынуждена начать свой бизнес, чтобы прокормить себя. Она взяла на аренду помещение и открыла столовую. Гулнора готовит национальные блюда  и продает местным жителям. Она готовит такие блюда как «ош-палав», «шурбо», «чазза», «самбуса» и т.п. Этим бизнесом она занимается более 2 лет. Ее братья помогают ей введению бизнеса. Она старается готовить вкусно и таким образом привлечь клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки продуктов питания для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnora divorced her husband several years ago. She returned to her parents' house after the divorce. At the present time, she lives with her brothers. Gulnora had to start her own business to support herself. She leased a space and opened a cafe. Gulnora cooks national dishes and sells them to local residents. She cooks dishes, such as "osh-palav", "shurbo", "chazza", "samosa", etc. She has been involved in this business for over 2 years. Her brothers help her with running this business. She tries to cook well and, thus, attract more customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to buy food products in order to refill her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to refill her working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells avacados and onions. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a local area. 

Rose will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of avacados and onions. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of avacados and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is a single woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 30 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Leonor works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a cellphone and accessories shop in the Philippines, and she requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional units of cellphones and accessories to sell.

Leonor has been in this business for 9 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional units of cellphones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Maa Brundabati Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is named "Maa Brundabati Shg" and is from a small village in Balangir district in Odisha, India. This small village is very far from the capital and is in its growth stage. All of the members of the group want to help their families and their community. All the group members are women. All of the members work at rural activities such as raising farmyard animals, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Dhandhei, the lady seated first from the right in the first row, is president of this group. Dhandhei is 31 years old and divorced. She does not have any children. She lives with her parents and siblings. Currently, she has 15 goats. She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed to continue raising her animals and wants to renovate the shed for her goats. She hopes to continue fighting for her family and to improve their lifestyle. All the group members are very excited and very grateful to Kiva's lenders for this kind of help and support.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and renovate the shed for her goats

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.en:
Maria Imelda is 48 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Maria Imelda works very hard to provide for them.
