She runs a direct-selling personal collection business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of personal collection products to sell.

Maria Imelda has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Maria Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Soterania

texts.en:
Soterania is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Soterania has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Myay Ma Hla Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yasagyo township, this community currently has 28 village customers, including 6 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area. In this village, people are friendly and hospitable to everyone although they are struggling with their daily life. They are always enthusiastic to improve their living standards by finding ways to figure out business problems.  That said, this village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.

The new loan will help this village purchase a tractor that will help with the planting and harvesting of crops such as sesame and beans. Nowadays, villagers are struggling to pay to lease a tractor from a neighboring village. It costs each farmer about $10 per day, not including the diesel fees that they must pay to operate the tractor. One gallon of diesel is $5. During harvest, villagers have to pay even more than $10 per day because of the spike in demand.  In addition to farming, villagers cultivate Thanatkhar trees, which is used as a traditional beauty product by Burmese women, and raise livestock.  They also have a long-term plan to cultivate limonia trees for timber and sap. 

Pictured above are the committee members from the village CBO: U Win, U Aung, U Kyaw, U Sein , U Kyi, and U Yin. Included in the photo (third from the right) is U Sein, the father of two children. As there is only a primary school in the village, his children have to go to secondary school in a nearby village. He needs additional capital to purchase farming inputs so that his crop income can support his children's education expenses.

loans.use: will help 28 villagers purchase a tractor so that they do not have to lease from a nearby village

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cellphones for his business.

loans.name: Shahnozai

texts.ru: Шахнозаи жительница столицы Таджикистана, города Душанбе. Она милая общительная молодая женщина в возрасте 23 лет. Шахнозаи уже замужем и имеет одного маленького сыночка. Ее муж таксист и работает по маршрутной линии города. Сама Шахнозаи швея. Она на протяжении 3 лет работает в ателье и предоставляет услуги швеи. Шахнозаи хочет расширить и улучшить свою деятельность. Для этого она просит кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести новую швейную машинку. Ее цель - увеличить количество своих клиенток.
texts.en: Shahnozai is a resident of the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is a cute and sociable 22-year-old young woman. Shahnozai is already married and has one small son. Her husband is a taxi driver and works along a city route. Shahnozai is a seamstress. She has been working at an atelier for 3 years, providing seamstress services. Shahnozai wants to expand and improve her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. Her goal is to increase the number of her clients.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира добрая женщина. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Гулмира замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она начала свой бизнес 6 лет назад скотоводством. Гулмира покупает коров, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Гулмира постепенно развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она имеет достаточно опыта в данной сфере. Она основная кормилица семьи, так как ее муж работает в дом культуре своего района и получает маленькую зарплату, а ее дети еще несовершеннолетние. Гулмира планирует развевать бизнес и таким образом получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода она будет улучшить уровень жизни и образования детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulmira is a kind and hard-working woman.  She is married with two children and she started her business raising livestock six years ago.  She buys cattle, fattens them up for a few months and sells them on at the local market.  Gulmira has gradually increased her business and she now has plenty of experience in her field.  She is the main breadwinner for her family, as her husband works in the House of Culture in their region and he earns a small salary, and her children are still minors.  Gulmira plans to increase her business and bring in a larger income.  With this loan, she can improve their standard of living and their children's level of education.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy livestock.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Renacer De Ipal Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RENACIENTES DE IPAL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "RENACIENTES DE IPAL".  This bank is located in the Vilcabamba district, belonging to the La Convencion province, department of Cusco.

Señora Irene is single, 42 years old, and has 3 children.  This member works in her own grocery store, selling necessary goods such as rice, sugar, milk and oil; she works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She already has 5 years with this business and it is going very well; her dream is to expand the grocery store. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members work in businesses such as selling handmade goods, animal sales, a grocery store, and a restaurant. 

Señora Irene appreciates those who are part of her dream through this loan and is committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to fulfill orders

loans.name: Mirtha Cecilia

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 36 años, es soltera y vive en Imperial junto a sus padres.
Es madre de familia, tiene un pequeño hijo quien es el mejor regalo en la vida y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un futuro mejor. Recibió de sus padres una excelente educación en valores y esos mismos valores aprendidos hoy se lo transmite a su pequeño.
Gracias a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación actualmente tiene un pequeño negocio, una tienda con la que genera ingresos y cubre los gastos del hogar y también apoya a su familia como una manera de agradecer todo lo que sus padres hicieron por ella.
Mirtha está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por el apoyo que le han brindado, ella piensa comprar mercadería como productos de primera necesidad, para surtir el negocio y de esta manera pueda ofrecer variedades de productos a los clientes. Con esto ella generará mayores ingresos y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder "Ampliar su negocio".
texts.en:
Mirtha, 36, is an entrepreneur. She is single and lives in Imperial with her parents. She has a young son who is her greatest gift in life and for whom she fights every day to give him a better future. Her parents gave her an excellent education in values and she passes these along to her son. Thanks to much effort and dedication, she now has a small business, a store that can generate income and cover her household expenses as well as supporting her family as a way to thank her parents for all that they've done for her.

Mirtha is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. She plans to buy merchandise to stock her store, so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers. This will generate more income and she will keep working hard so that one day she can have a bigger store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to fill her grocery store

loans.name: Gudelio

texts.en:
Gudelio learned to cultivate vegetables by growing up on a farm in Mexico. When he moved to the United States, he took a series of odd jobs to support himself and his family. However, he saw an opportunity to produce traditional Mexican herbs and vegetables in the New York area. 

Gudelio began farming on a small plot in Staten Island and selling his produce at local farmers markets. The rarity of his herbs in NYC attracted the attention of many restaurant owners and culinary enthusiasts. Soon, he had raised enough money to begin farming additional land in New Jersey. 

Gudelio has expanded from a small farmers' market to a growing community-supported agriculture group.  Gudelio has started a new CSA pick-up spot in a much more conveniently located spot in Brooklyn where there is a huge market for fresh produce. In order to service his growing customer base, he needs a van to deliver all his produce to his CSA customers and to Farmers Markets. 

Lend to Gudelio so he can purchase a van and grow his farm!

loans.use: to purchase a van to transport produce

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 12 years. Lilibeth earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Roger Miguel

texts.es:
Roger es un joven trabajador, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en Calleria junto a su familia.
Está muy contento y entusiasmado porque pronto será padre y ya quiere tener a su hijo entre sus brazos para poder brindarle mucho amor y ofrecerle un futuro mejor. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Estudió la carrera de Administración y actualmente trabaja como Jefe de Recuperaciones en una entidad Financiera, le va muy bien debido a su excelente desempeño en el trabajo.
Roger está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar madera para construir una cerca en su casa y así pueda ofrecer mayor seguridad a su familia, mejorando su calidad de vida, y seguirá trabajando con mayor tranquilidad al saber que su familia vive con mayor bienestar.
texts.en:
Roger is a hard-working young man. He is 21 years old. He lives in Calleria with his family

He is very happy and excited because he will soon become a dad. He is eager to hold his son in his arms to be able to give him lots of love and provide him with a better future. He is a person eager to get ahead. He studied Business Administration and currently works as manager of collections and recoveries at a financial institution. He is doing very well because of his excellent performance at work.

Roger is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their support, he will be able to buy wood to build a fence around his house. In this way, he will provide greater security to his family—improving their quality of life—and he will keep on working with greater peace of mind, knowing that his family lives with a greater sense of well-being.

loans.use: to buy wood to fence his house.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy and convenient place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Douglas will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Emena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Emena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Emena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: I Gusti Ketut

texts.en:
After succeeding with the last loan, used for his farming program, I Gusti Ketut wants to continue to borrow a new loan. He decided to propose a new loan because he was able to manage his farming business well and earn a satisfactory profit. I Gusti Ketut is a vegetable farmer, he planted carrots, cabbages, cucumbers and other vegetables which are suited to cold weather.

Now he needs a new loan to try a new business as a cow breeder. With the loan he will receive, he will purchase two cows. He will keep them and take care of the cows until they have calves. He will sell the calves. I Gusti Ketut also use the cows' waste as fertilizer for his garden. I Gusti Ketut hopes all the business will go well and bring prosperity to his family.

loans.use: To purchase purchase two cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy churros, soft drinks, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, oil, eggs, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services and also sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

Esther will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more salon equipment. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a better businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment

loans.name: Wan Be Chaing Village

texts.en:
Located in Central Myanmar’s Yasagyo township, this community currently has 29 village customers, including 5 CBO (Community Based Organization) committee members who help to lead the loan program in the area.  This village is located in Myanmar's dry zone, where insufficient rainfall is very common. Most villagers are Buddhist and struggle finding access to affordable credit, as the state-owned agricultural bank is not active in the area.  Additionally, labor to help farmers during the intense planting and harvesting seasons is limited, as most of the village's young people are migrating to other cities in search of economic opportunity.

The previous loan was used by the villagers to purchase seeds such as sesame, various beans, and rice paddies. ThIs new loan will help farmers buy livestock, namely cows, pigs and goats.  These animals can help on the farm, as their manures can be used as a natural fertilizer, and their offspring can be sold for additional income.

Pictured above are the committee members from the village CBO: U Khin, U Tin, U Than, U Min, and Daw Hnin. Included in the photo (second from right) is U Khin, who is 42 years old and the father of one child, who is in secondary school.  He purchased paddy, bean, and sesame seeds with his past loan. He is now saving money to purchase two bulls, which are more expensive than other animals. His new loan, on top of his accrued savings, will make it possible for him to buy the bulls.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business and has been a member of  NWTF since 2013. She is now requesting a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Florence will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Florence would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: La Quinta Estación Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socios exitosos y laboriosos, es coordinado por el señor Alejandro de 60 años de edad y acompañado, se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años, y cuenta con la ayuda de compañera de vida en la comercialización de los productos, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de tres cerdos en pies, con el fin de cubrir la demanda que tiene de este producto y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos. Las otras integrantes son las señoras Claudia de 31 años de edad, quien es propietaria de una mini pulpería y solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, pan, leche, bolsas, etc., y la señora Petrona de 58 años de edad, comerciante de frutas en el mercado más populoso de la capital, desde hace treinta años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mango, mamón, nancite, etc.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three successful and industrious members. The group coordinator is Sr. Alejandro. He is 60 years old and in a relationship. Alejandro has been butchering pigs at his home for the past four years. His companion helps with selling his products. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy three live pigs. This will help him to meet the demand for his products and improve his earnings.

The other members are as follows:
• Claudia is 31 years old and the owner of a mini-market. She is requesting a loan in order to buy sodas, bread, milk, bags, and other items.
• Petrona is 58 years old and sells fruit at the busiest market in the capital. She has been doing this for 30 years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of mangos, Spanish limes, nance fruit, and other products.

loans.use: to buy three live pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Jennifer is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
After returning to California from Argentina in 2008, Mario found himself without a job. After scrambling to find work to support himself in the short term, Mario wanted to start a business that allows him to set his own hours, spend more time with his family, and escape a future of being chained to a desk 40+ hours a week. The epiphany hit him out of nowhere: vending machines.

As a widower with three boys, providing for his family is Mario’s primary motivator in growing his business. Motivation is not the only factor for success, however, as his business competes with larger, more established vending machine operators in the area. To compete, Mario’s strategy is to offer better commissions, better service, and better machines.

Mario will use part of his Kiva loan money to pay for new vending machines, with the rest going towards payroll and operating capital. 

His hopes for the future are to grow conservatively to ensure the best possible machine placements. That way, he will have the strongest possible business to pass to his kids when he’s ready to retire.

loans.use: to purchase new vending machines with the rest going towards payroll and operating capital

loans.name: Glorygen

texts.en:
Glorygen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets for her fishing business.

Glorygen has been in this business for 27 years. Glorygen earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Glorygen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en:
Delsa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

Delsa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Delsa's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Djiguisseme  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUISSEME II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOTOULA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le riz avec  FANTA, 1ère personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  55.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group DJIGUISSEME Ii are married women who average 35 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in KOTOULA, a village located in OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 2nd loan cycle with the MFI. 

FANTA grows groundnuts and rice. She is the member standing first from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village to a clientele consisting of resellers and consumers.  

Fanta expects to earn an average profit of 55,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Gerardo y su esposa Paulina, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare,  tienen 40 y 35 años de edad, respectivamente, están casados por más de 10 años, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la actividad de agricultura, siembran papa y papaliza en una superficie de 3.5 hectáreas. Para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado que es la feria semanal de colomi, el señor requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico y semilla de papa ya que sus ahorros los invirtió en la compra de ganado vacuno de engorde. De esta forma podrá tener mejores ingresos e incrementará su patrimonio familiar para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Gerardo and his wife Paulina live in Cochabamba, which is in Chapare Province. They are ages 40 and 35 respectively. Both of them are financially independent and engage in agriculture, cultivating potatoes and “olluco” (a tuber grown in the Andes) on 3.5 hectares of land. In order to sell his products, he travels to the consolidated market at the weekly fair that is held in Colomi.

Sr. Gerardo is requesting a loan in order to buy organic fertilizer and seed potatoes. With his savings, he will buy cattle for fattening. This will help him to gain more income and increase his family assets, which will improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seed potatoes for his smallholder farm

loans.name: Patricia Arely

texts.es:
Patricia de 39 años de edad, es una mujer que se dedica a los oficios domésticos, no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico ya que sus padres no le brindaron la oportunidad de estudiar.  Actualmente vive  junto a sus dos hijos (una mujer y un hombre), uno de ellos está casado pero vive junto con ella y ayuda a pagar algunos gastos en el hogar, su hija quien es la menor está estudiando en la universidad su tercer año en licenciatura en administración de empresas.

Patricia ha tenido que realizar muchas actividades, para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, hace varios años atrás ella de dedicaba al oficio domestico trabaja en casa de algunos vecinos que tenían buena condición económica y ella tenía que lavar la ropa, planchar, entre otras cosas.

 Actualmente se dedica a la misma actividad solo que de forma fija con una persona que fue ex alcalde de su municipio, otra actividad que realiza es la venta de pupusas tres días por semana, vende pupusas en el patio de su casa, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años aproximadamente.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar unas sillas y mesas de madera, para que se acomoden sus clientes que llegan a comer las pupusas que ella elabora y a medida pasa el tiempo más gente está comprando donde ella, esto significa que su negocio es muy rentable.

El sueño de Patricia es que su negocio mejore y ya no tenga que trabajar en los oficios domésticos y tener un buen ingreso de su negocio de venta de pupusas, además con sus ingresos podrá pagar los estudios de su hija que ya le falta muy poco para terminar su carrera y sabe que lo podrá con la ayuda de  su crédito.
texts.en:
Patricia is 39 years old and is a woman who does housekeeping.  She has no education since her parents did not give her the opportunity to go to school.
She presently lives with her two children (one male, one female); one of them is married but lives with her and helps to pay some of the household expenses. Her daughter, who is younger, is in her third year at the university where she is studying business administration.

Patricia has had many different jobs so that she could raise her children. Several years ago she did housekeeping for a well-off neighbor, washing clothes and ironing, among other things. She is currently doing the same kind of work, but it is a permanent position with the person who is the ex-mayor of her town. Three days per week she also sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) from the patio of her house. She has been doing this for about three years.

The loan she is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy some wooden chairs and tables to accommodate her customers who come to eat the pupusas she makes. As time goes by, more people are buying from her which means that her business is very profitable. 

Patricia's dream is for her pupusa business to grow and provide a good income so that she won't have to do housekeeping any more. Also, with her income she will be able to pay for her daughter's studies as she is close to finishing her degree. Patricia knows she will be able to accomplish these things with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy wooden tables and chairs to accommodate her customers who come to buy the pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) she makes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a room for his children.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: El grupo “YAHVE YIRE” está conformado por socios jóvenes dedicados al comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Jhoselyn tiene 23 años de edad es soltera hace unos meses implemento una pequeña librería en su vivienda en la cual trabaja con el apoyo de su mama. Y a la vez presta servicios cobranza. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una exhibidora para ampliar su librería y más útiles escolares. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jhoselyn es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The “YAHVE YIRE” group consists of young members dedicated to small businesses and providing services. Jhoselyn is 23 years old, single, and 7 months ago opened a small office supply store in her home where she works with her mother. She also works providing bookkeeping services. The loan will be used to buy a display case to expand her store and to buy useful school supplies. The group is grateful to Kiva investors for the loan. Jhoselyn is the first person on the left side.

loans.use: to buy a display case and school supplies.

loans.name: Neomisia Del Rosario

texts.es: Neomisia del Rosario de 43 años de edad, labora para el sector publico, cuenta con la ayuda del esposo en los gastos del hogar pues son una familia muy unidos y ambos han luchado juntos para obtener su vivienda por quien muchas personas anhelan.  Aun con su esfuerzo no es suficientes ya que los altos costos de Construcción superan sus ingresos y no les alcanza para realizar todo de una vez, por lo que Neomisia solicita crédito para comprar Materiales de Construcción como Cemento, Piedras Canteras, Hierro, Zing y pagar mano de obra, para construir un anexo que utilizará como cuarto y así contar con mayor privacidad y espacio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Neomisia del Rosario is 43 years old and works in the public sector. She counts on her husband's help for household expenses. They are a very unified family and both have struggled together to get their house, for which many people yearned. 

Even with her effort, it is not sufficient because the high costs of construction exceed their income. They can not afford to do everything at once, so Neomisia is applying for a loan to buy building materials like cement, stone, iron, zinc and pay labor, to build an annex used as room and thus have more privacy and space in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stones, zinc, iron and blocks to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and install ceramic tile in her home.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 45 years old and married with three children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Sally has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Sally aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
La dedicación es la actitud de ser firme de alcanzar nuestros propios objetivos propuestos en nuestra vida tanto a largo o corto plazo y es que lo ha hecho Daysi que a sus 38 años de edad ya posee su propio negocio donde le va muy bien. Todo empezó hace 20 años cuando Daysi se propuso la meta de superarse económicamente y brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos y fue ahí donde ella inicio con una pequeña cantidad de dinero ahorrado que lo invirtió y lo hizo crecer hasta convertirlo en una pulpería donde comercializa todo tipo de productos de destino para el consumo del hogar, la familia y del cuidado personal.
Pero los deseos de superación de Daysi no quedan hasta ahí puesto que necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio para comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, asi como jabones, aceite, detergentes, shampoo entre otros productos ya que ella anhela transformar su pulpería en una miscelánea y así aumentar sus ganancias y con el tiempo mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dedication is the attitude of being firm about achieving one's objectives in life not only short but also long term. This is what Daysi has done at 38 years old, as she has her own business where she does very well.  It all started 20 years ago when Daysi set the goal to improve her economic situation and provide her children with the best she could.  It was then when she started with a small amount of money saved that she invested and grew until it became a convenience store where she sells all types of products for home, family and personal use.
Daysi's dreams of improvement don't stop here, she needs a loan to invest in her business and buy basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar as well as soaps, oil, detergents, shampoo and other productions.  She wishes to transform her convenience store into a small grocery store and this way have more income and with time improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar as well as soaps, oil, detergents, shampoo and other productions.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from growing vegetables.  Elena is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance for her fishing business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through the past three loans she has taken from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Lirios” está constituida por 06 socias emprendedoras. Eva de 42 años separada con 03 hijos aún dependientes. Hace más de 08 años que Eva se dedica a la venta de carbón. Actualmente le va bien, pues dicho negocio le ha permitido educar a sus menores hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de carbón y así poder distribuir a restaurantes y pollerías. De igual manera el  fin de semana vende frituras de anticucho. El grupo “Los Lirios” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, ya que permite su progreso. Eva es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste casaca rosada.
texts.en: The “Los Lirios” Communal bank consists of 6 hard-working members. 42 year old Eva is separated, with 3 children. Eva has been selling coal for more than 8 years. Her business is going well today, and it has enabled her to send her children to school. She seeks a loan to buy coal to distribute to restaurants and rotisserie grills. On the weekends she sells sauteed meat. The "Los Lirios" group is thankful to the people who make this loan possible, as it enables them all to grow. Eva is the second person from the left, dressed in a pink top.

loans.use: to pay for coal to distribute to restaurants and rotisserie grills.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from operating both a general store and a seafood business. Elsie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through the past 15 loans she has taken from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un almacén en el que vende mercancía como manualidades, objetos decorativos y para regalos. 

Inicio el negocio hace 2 años desde que fallecieron sus padres y a pesar del dolor que tuvo que enfrentar, nunca se rindió y siempre procura por salir adelante.

Ella desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar aun mas sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de vitrinas y exhibidores con las que podrá mostrar su producto de una mejor manera, adicionalmente comprara surtido de mercancía como adornos y objetos decorativos con los que actualmente no cuenta para abastecer su negocio. 

De esta actividad es que depende su supervivencia y es por eso que siempre pone todo su empeño.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a woman full of energy to tackle the world and have a full life thanks to her efforts. She has a store where she sells handicrafts, decorative objects, and items for gifts. She began the business 2 years ago when her parents died, and in spite of the pain she continued looking toward the future and she never gave up her dream.

She wishes to expand the products she sells, which would improve her sales and inject capital into her business. So she is asking for a loan to give her the opportunity to be self-supporting and have the resources to grow her business. The money will be invested in buying display cases where she can better display her products. In addition she wants to buy items to stock her business such as decorative objects, which she currently does not have enough of in her business. She depends on this business for her livelihood and it is where she is putting all her efforts.

She has many hopes for her business and believes that her future can be considerably better thanks to the loans that make it possible for people like her to be able to dream of a better, more stable life.

loans.use: to buy display cases and decorative objects to stock her business.

loans.name: Negba Group

texts.en:
The Negbe group is made up of eight people who reside in the same locality. They are selling grocery, jewelry, cloth, gari (cassava flour), energy drinks, soap, underwear, fish and cosmetics.

James, who is the leader of this group, is the one standing at the far right in the photo. James is 56 years old and is married to a woman named Regina. The couple has grown-up children who are on their own. James lives with his wife and his grandchildren. He is responsible for the household expenses. James attended school to the secondary level. For twelve years he has been a goldsmith who molds and sells jewelry in his region. James buys the gold from the mining town in Ghana. Hoping to build up his business and better answer the demands of his customers, James requests a loan from ID-Ghana with the other members of Negbe group.

loans.use: to buy gold from the mining town in Ghana to make jewerly.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 58 years old and widowed. She lives with one of her children in a rural community. She engages herself in cooking and selling meals and snacks to generate income. She aims to make her business viable in order to sustain the necessities of her family. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to gain access to financial assistance through KIVA lenders amounting to 11,000 PHP in order to buy meat, chicken, rice vegetables, condiments, eggs, ketchup, fish balls and kikiam (ground pork and vegetables wrapped in bean curd sheets) to cook and sell. 

Being a diligent mother, she believes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice vegetables, condiments, eggs, ketchup, fish balls and kikiam to cook and sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. 

He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to open another butchery outlet. His business goal is to excel within five years. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will be a better person.

loans.use: to open another butchery outlet

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vivian is 50 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Vivian has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Vivian requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Vivian has been in this business for three years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Daysi Yanira

texts.es:
Daysi de 48 años de edad, es maestra, está casada, su esposo es mecánico automotriz, tienen dos hijos de los cuales solo el menor estudia, su otra hija está acompañada.

Daysi tiene 26 años de ser maestra, profesión de la cual se siente  muy orgullosa, ya que con sus conocimientos ayuda a que muchos jóvenes puedan iniciar el sueño de convertirse en agentes de cambio para la sociedad. De lunes a viernes Daysi viaja en bus, aproximadamente 6 km hasta su lugar de trabajo y sus turnos de trabajo son de 1:00 pm a 5:00 pm

El crédito será invertido para colocar un negocio de ropa, como pantalones, blusas, camisetas, licras, vestidos, ropa interior para dama y caballero, ya que Daysi ha tenido el sueño de trabajar en esta actividad y con el crédito, se está ayudando a que Daysi pueda cumplirlo.
	
Con el crédito Daysi está cumpliendo uno de sus sueños, también desea mejorar su vivienda, y sobre todo apoyar a sus hijos, para que sean personas de bien y seguir ayudando a sus alumnos, para que logren prepararse académicamente.
texts.en:
Daysi is 48 years old, a teacher, married, and her husband is an automotive mechanic. They have 2 children, the younger one attends school and the other is married. Daysi has been a teacher for 26 years, a profession of which she is very proud as she knows she has helped many young people be able to start their dreams in becoming change agents in the community. From Monday through Friday, Daysi travels by buy approximately 6 kilometers to her workplace, working from 1 PM - 5 PM.

The loan will be used to open a clothing business. She will buy pants, blouses, t shirts, exercise clothing, dresses, underwear for women and men, etc. Daysi has a dream of opening this kind of business and this loan is helping her to do so. With the loan Daysi is fulfilling one of her dreams, she also wants to make home improvements, and above all support her children so that they become good people, and she wants to continue helping her students so that they are prepared academically.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Nora tiene 32 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder continuar con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "San Jose", and is located in Cusco province. Nora is 32 years old, has three children, and married. She alternates her daily chores with raising small animals such as chickens. Her business is going well and she tends to it every day. She wishes to continue her business by working hard every day to keep it successful. She seeks a loan to buy chickens. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 44 years old and from Camiling, Tarlac. She is married with two children. Their family’s source of income is farming. Their son Mhelgar is taking up hotel and restaurant services. He chose this course because he loves to cook.  Though they struggle financially, he wants to finish college so he can help his parents in the future, for he knows that it is through studying that he will fulfill his dreams. To do that, they want to avail an educational loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man. He has two children with ages 2 years and 5 years. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a barber shop where he does hair cutting. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a business friendly area, and his primary customers are regulars. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy barber shop equipment. His business goal is to have high returns within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Marilyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 42 years old and she is married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, egg, etc.

Aileen has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and she also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, egg, etc

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Cirila tiene 68 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es viuda, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de flores ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de flores como margaritas,calas,rosas entre otros, la socia vende en uno de los cementerios de la ciudad, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder continuar con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de rosas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the San Jose communal bank; the bank is located in Cusco province.

Cirila is 68 years old, has 5 children, and is a widow. She splits her time between working with a business selling flowers. She sells different types of flowers such as daisies, callas, and roses among others; she sells them in one of the city's cemeteries.  She has spent quite some time in this business which is going well for her thanks to the dedication that she puts each day into her business. She wants to be able to continue with her business which is going very well due to the determination that she puts into it each day.

She asks for a loan to buy roses.

She is grateful for the loan which has been granted to her and commits to meeting all the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase roses.

loans.name: Apple

texts.en:
Apple, age 33, is married to a car painter and blessed with two children. 

Apple has managed an auto paint shop in her village for almost two years and earns a weekly net income of PHP 3,000. She and her husband also repair cars for additional income. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the family's food expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase a buffing machine for her shop. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase a buffing machine for her auto repair shop.

loans.name: Allen Grace

texts.en:
Allen Grace is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Allen Grace is 33 years old and two of her children are in school.

Allen Grace has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Allen Grace has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her general store business.

Angeline has been in this business for 27 years. Angeline earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Angeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Uzokbek

texts.ru:
Узокбек добродушный  мужчина в возрасте 58 лет. Он женат  и имеет троих детей. Все его дети уже взрослые и имеют свои семьи. Узокбек живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Несмотря на свой возраст, он полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Узокбек  занимается деканством и животноводством.

У него имеется  земельная площадь, которая  составляет около 12 га. Из общей площади земли  8 га составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли.  На этой земле  Узокбек занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот.  Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Узокбек хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Узокбек заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Uzokbek is a kind-hearted man who is 58 years old and married with three children.  All of his children are grown and have their own families, and Uzokbek lives with his wife in a small house in a village.  Despite his age, he is a very strong and wants to work for the good of his family.  He works in a deanery and he also raises livestock.

He has a plot of land, which is roughly 12 hectares.  Of the entire plot, 8 hectares are for dry farming and the rest is irrigated.  Uzokbek grows carrots, potatoes and wheat on his land, and his wife helps him raise and take care of the livestock.  Since their plot of land is large, they also use part of it for their cattle.  Their livestock business brings in a good income, which is why Uzokbek wants to expand it by increasing his head of livestock.  This is why he has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle.  Uzokbek thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto con su esposo y 3 hijos. Su casa cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, vive en una comunidad rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, está ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza, Provincia de Morropon, departamento de Piura, Costa norte del Perú.

Rebeca se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de Jora, adicionalemente vende cerveza y piqueos, actividad que realiza con una antiguedad de más de 10 años, recibe el apoyo de sus hijas mayores. Ellla ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en el mejoramiento del local en el cual atiende a sus clientes, Cliente con buen comportamiento de pago para Edpyme alternativa lo que le ha permitido una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 44 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her 3 kids. Her house has the basic services of water and electricity. She lives in a rural area where its population works mostly in farming, commerce, and the cattle industry. It is located in the district of La Matanza, the province of Morropon, municipality of Piura, in the North Coast of Peru.

She makes and sells corn beer, and she also sells beer and appetizers. She has been doing this for over 10 years. She gets help from her older daughters. 

She has requested a 4,500 NUEVOS SOLES loan to Edypyme Alternativa, to invest it in the improvement of the shop where she serves her clients.

She has been a good client for Edpyme, always making her payments on time, and that has allowed her to improve her life's quality.

loans.use: to make improvements to her shop where she serves her clients

loans.name: Mburucuya Poty Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son todas mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando por sus seres queridos, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una persona que se destaca es Lidia, es costurera y hace todo tipo de trabajo para poder tener los medios necesarios y así ayudar a su familia. La Sra. Lidia solicita este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, etc., lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos., y también poder seguir con su trabajo y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Twenty women make up this group, all of them are single mothers and the heads of their families. They struggle for their loved ones. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight program, where each one wants to improve their living conditions.

One member who stands out is Lidia. She is a seamstress and does any type of work to have the necessary means to help her family. Lidia is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons etc. This will help her solidify her business plan and that will help her increase her income. And she can continue with her work and fill her clients orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and buttons.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 41 años de edad soltera, madre de una hija y se dedica al comercio de la hoja de coca.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, tuerte y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de Pariri situado en cercanìas al lago Titicaca, a una altura de cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Julia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, estatura media, cada mañana con los primeros rayos de sol ella comienza su labor sacando a su puesto de venta sus morrales de coca, sus clientes diarios comienzan a llegar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, este trabajo lo realiza de lunes a domingo, hasta las seis de la tarde hora en que guarda sus morrales.
Julia sueña ver a su hija terminar sus estudios superiores por la necesidad que tiene de mejorar su calidad de vida, ella quiere mejorar la produccion de su megocio realizando la compra de una vada lechera.
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un prestamo para la compra de una vaca lechera y diversificaar su negocio para ayudar en el pago de los estudios superiores de su hija
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old and single. She has one daughter and her work is selling coca leaves.  She is enterprising, determined, strong and very hard-working. Her business is located in Pariri which is near Lake Titicaca and is 4,000 meters above sea level. Julia has a dark complexion; long, dark, braided hair; and is of medium height.

Each morning with the first rays of sun she begins her work hauling her sacks of coca to her stand. Her regular clients begin arriving very early.  She does this work from Monday through Sunday until 6:00 p.m. when she packs up her sacks.

Julia dreams of seeing her daughter finish her higher education so that she will be able to improve her quality of life. She wants to improve her business by buying a dairy cow.  This is why she is asking for a loan. By diversifying her business she will be able to help pay for her daughter's higher education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so she can diversify her business to help pay for her daughter's higher education.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 39 años, es soltera, es muy conocida en su comunidad, por su labor de servicio venta de pan en su mototaxi. Ella vive en casa familiar de su madre, quien en la actualidad se encuentra en Lima, madre percibe pensión de viudez. Raquel es una persona con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, su comunidad está ubicada a 45 Km de la provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, con un clima cálido, su población es muy agradable y se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Raquel se dedica a prestar servicio de la venta de pan en su mototaxi, desde hace más de 06 años aproximadamente, además da en alquiler otra mototaxi de su propiedad, ella necesita el préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo para incrementar su negocio con la venta de soya, avena, y tamales, para de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, y asi incrementar sus ingresas, sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is 39, single, and very well-known in her community for her bread sales business using her mototaxi. She lives in the home of her mother, who is in Lima at the moment and obtains a pension. Raquel has good references from her neighbours. Her community is located 45 km from the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque department, on the north cost of Peru. The region has a warm climate. The people are very friendly and work in agriculture, business, and livestock.
Raquel has been selling bread in her mototaxi for over six years. She also rents out another mototaxi. She needs this loan to invest in working capital to expand her business through selling soybeans, oats, and tamales. This way, her business will grow and her income will improve. This will result in improvement of her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to expand her business through selling soybeans, oats, and tamales.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural, en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de chiclayo, region de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Roberto se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el cual está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, y solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de infraestructura donde guarda sus herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, y además él piensa mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is 54 years old, single, with no children, and lives with his family in a rural zone in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, in Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

Roberto works offering agricultural services, with his own tools, and has more than 10 years of experience in this work, which is located in his own home, and he asks for a loan to maintain the structure where he stores his tools. This investment will serve him to have his equipment and tools in better shape, and also he plans to improve the productivity of his services and, in turn, be able to take care of the diverse needs of his customers in the zone, which will generate increased income, increased profits, in in the end, a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain the structure where he stores his tools, this investment will serve him to have his equipment and tools in better shape.

loans.name: Juraboi

texts.ru:
Джурабой жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 38 лет женат имеет сына и дочь. Он работает в ансамбле "Шабнам" в качестве барабанщика а также , преподает в музыкальном училище для обучающихся. Его основная работа проведение корпоративных мероприятий, свадебные торжества, юбилеи и другие торжественные вечера. Сейчас он нуждается в новом музыкальном инструменте под названием "Гонги". Это ударные музыкальные инструменты используются для исполнения более сложных ритмов прибегают к помощи палочек от малого барабана.  При сильном ударе по такому гонгу маленькой колотушкой получается интересный грохочуще-воющий звук с повышением или снижением тона. 
Но для покупки инструмента у него недостаточно средств, поэтому он просит кредит от Арванд и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Juraboi is a cheerful man who is 38 years old and he is married with a son and a daughter.  He works in the ensemble "Shabnam" as a drummer, and he also teaches music at the musical school for students.  Most of his work involves corporate events, weddings, parties and other special occasions.  Now he needs a new musical instrument called a "gonga."  It's a percussion instrument which is used to create more complicated rhythms with the help of drumsticks and a snare drum.  When the "gonga" is struck, a small rattle produces an interesting howling sound with either an increased or decreased tone.  But Juraboi doesn't have enough money to buy this instrument, which is why he is asking for a loan from Arvand and he is counting on their support.

loans.use: to buy a musical instrument

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan, tiene 56  años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de maíz, frijoles, hortalizas  y café. Su mayor fuente de ingresos es el cultivo de café. El que vende en la misma zona. Ha solicitado varios préstamos a la institución para poder mantener sus cultivos. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes foliares y pago de mano de obra para darle asistencia a la finca de café. Su plan es crecer en la caficultura y tener una familia digna.
texts.en: Juan is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife in a village of the municipality of Gracias Lempira. He has always worked in the cultivation of corn, beans, garden vegetables, and coffee. His greatest source of income in the cultivation of coffee, which he sells within the region. He has requested various loans from the institution to be able to maintain his crops. Now he requests another loan of 15,000 Lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of foliar feeding fertilizers and payment of laborers to help him on his coffee plantation. His plan is to increase his coffee growing and have a worthy family.

loans.use: To buy foliar feeding fertilizer and pay for laborers to help him on his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en:
Deolita is 43 years old and she is widowed with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Deolita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Deolita has been pig fattening for six years and she also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es:
Ana de 40 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9° grado, está acompañada, su compañero de vida es vigilante de una empresa de seguridad, tienen dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, quienes están estudiando educación básica.


Ana ha trabajado desde pequeña junto a sus padres, como jornaleros en las fincas de café, es una persona que se ha esforzado mucho para lograr salir adelante. Actualmente no trabaja, dado que sufrió una caída que le provoco una lesión. sin embargo, esta al cuidado de sus dos hijos y de los quehaceres del hogar. Cuando se recupere continuara con su trabajo, el cual es de oficios domésticos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, leche, aceite, pan, fósforos, galletas, golosinas, etc, para inicira con la instalación de una tienda en su casa. De esta forma, obtendrá ingresos, para su hogar y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos. 
 	
Ana tiene el sueño de que sus dos hijos puedan estudiar y preparase y que sean personas de bien, y que no sufra las dificultades que ha tenido que pasar ella. También, espera poder trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y así tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 40 years old, studied up to the 9th grade, has a partner, and her life partner is a security guard in a security business. They have two children who are 11 and 5 years old, and are primary school students.

Ana has worked since she was little with her parents, as day laborers in coffee plantations. She is a person who has worked hard in order to get ahead. She currently doesn't work since she suffered a fall that caused an injury.  However, she cares for the two children and for the household tasks. When she recovers, she will continue with her work, which is as a domestic laborer.

The loan that she is asking CREDICAMPO for is to purchase rice, beans, corn, sugar, milk, oil, bread, matches, chickens, sweets, etc. to begin with the installation of a general store in her house. In this way, she will have an income, for her household and to help her partner with the expenses. 

Ana has a dream that her two children will be able to study, prepare themselves, and become good people, that they don't suffer the difficulties that she has had.  Also, she wants to be able to work to help her partner with the household expenses and, in turn, try to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, corn, sugar, milk, oil, bread, matches, chickens, sweets, etc. to begin with the installation of a general store in her house. In this way, she will have an income, for her household and to help her partner with the expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her beer vending business

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tienen cinco hijos de 20, 18, 14, 8 y 2 años de edad, de ellos solamente estudian tres, los demás ayudan a su padre en la agricultura.

Ana inicio a trabajar junto a sus padres en la siembra de maíz y frijol a los 12 años de edad, luego consiguió trabajo en una venta de frutas y verduras, donde trabajo por 7 años. Hace cinco años decidió iniciar en un negocio propio, el cual es de venta de tortillas y pupusas que está ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad, todos los días le corresponde viajar en bus, aproximadamente10 km de su casa a su negocio. Inicia sus labores a las  7 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar maíz, quesillo, Chicharrón, frijoles, aceite para elaborar las tortillas y las pupusas y para comprar frutas y verduras que también desea vender en su puesto de venta. 
 	
Ana tiene el sueño de mejorar su casa, también ayudar a que sus tres hijos continúen estudiando y que sus otros dos hijos puedan encontrar un trabajo digno. También, desea seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 35 years old, went to school through third grade. She is married. Her husband works in agriculture. They have five children, ages 20, 18, 14, 8, and 2. Only three of them are in school. The others help their father in agriculture.

Ana began to work with her parents planting corn and beans at the age of 12. Then she found work selling fruits and vegetables, where she worked for 7 years. Five years ago she decided to begin her own business selling tortillas and pupusas; it is located in the city market. Every day she travels approximately 10 km by bus from her house to her business. She begins her work at 7 in the morning and works until 3 in the afternoon.

The loan that she is applying for at CrediCampo is to buy corn, fresh cheese, pork rinds, beans, and oil to make the tortillas and the pupusas and to buy fruits and vegetables that she also wants to sell at her sales stand.

Ana has a dream of improving her house and also helping her three children to continue studying and having her other two children find worthy jobs. She also want to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, pork rinds, beans, and oil to make tortillas and pupusas and to buy fruits and vegetables that she also wants to sell in her sales stall

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc for her fishing business.

Nena has been in this business for 22 years and earns more income from buy and sell of dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the slow season. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy extra clothes to sell. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy extra clothes to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 40 years old and has three children. She is married, and her three children are in school.

Aileen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Aileen has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old and single.

Rosalie's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosalie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 4,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosalie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Emma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

NWTF is presenting Emma's business profile again for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Баходур жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 46 лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Баходур живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Баходура также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Баходур занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей рогатого скота. Также Баходур подрабатывает строителем. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Баходуру в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Баходур собирается женить своего старшего сына. Он готовиться к свадебному мероприятию. Для этого нужно купить очень много вещей для приданного. Но у Баходура не хватает денежных средств, которые он накопил для свадьбы. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для свадьбы своего сына. Баходур очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку
texts.en:
Bahodur is a cheerful and hard-working man.  He is 46 years old and he is married with three children.  He first turned to Arvand when he found out that he had a chance to receive financial support.  Bahodur lives with his family in a village and he doesn't have a higher education, as he never got a chance to go to university because of his family's financial struggles.  His wife is also not educated and she is a housewife, doing work from home and looking after the children.

In order to earn a living, Bahodur has his own business raising and selling cattle.  He also works in construction and he earns a good living from these endeavors.  His wife also helps him, as she sells milk from their cows.  Now Bahodur is preparing to marry off his eldest son.  He is making plans for the wedding, but he needs to buy many things for the dowry and he doesn't have enough money in his savings.  This is why he has turned to Arvand to ask for a loan to buy a dowry for his son's wedding.  Bahodur is hoping for a good result and he thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a wedding dowry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, soap, salt, detergents and dairy products to open a small store.

loans.name: Cheryll Mae

texts.en:
Cheryll Mae is 25 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryll Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shampoo, detergent soap, beer, toothpaste, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, beer, toothpaste, noodles, etc. 

Cheryll Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like shampoo, detergent soap, beer, toothpaste, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Kotognontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  de KOTOGNONTALA 1 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 2 enfants. La plupart d’entre eux vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Koloko un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA  I collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (mil, arachide, sésame, haricot etc.) 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution.
