Avec ce prêt, Madame MARIAM troisième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheter de la semence, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 0,25 hectare d’haricot
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Beleco.
Elle envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 56 000F CFA par campagne qui sera investie dans l’élevage de chèvre.
texts.en:
The Kotognontala 1 group is composed of 10 married women averaging 33 years of age, with two children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Koloko, a village in the Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).
The group members collaborate with Soro Yiriwas in order to better manage their work during the rainy season. They grow millet, peanuts, sesame, and beans, among others. 

They are on their second loan with Soro Yiriwaso.
With this loan, Mrs. Mariam, the third one standing from right to left in the photo, plans to pay the cost of labor and weeding and buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and small tools in order to work her land plot of about 0.25 ha [0.6 acres], where she grows beans.
At the end of the agricultural cycle, the produce is sold for cash in Beleco. Mariam plans to earn an average revenue of 56,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle, which will be invested in her goat farming business.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, weeding and small tools.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling of firewood and charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Gloria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Gloria's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of raw materials for the production of furniture

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
The Kerto Sato group succeeded in paying off their loan on time. All the members come to pay their own loans to the head of the group, Ni Ketut. 

Ni Ketut’s daily life is as a housewife and also as a pig breeder. Her husband works as a farmer. From the last loan, she succeeded in maintaining the pigs. She sold the pigs for fattening. She earns a satisfactory profit and enough to fulfill her family’s needs and also save. She’s very happy and said thank you for the support she had. 

The Kerto Sato group is receiving their new loan, and they are using it to support their pigs businesses. 

Ni Ketut and her husband are hard workers, not only as farmers, but also as pig breeders. The loan will be used to purchase two piglets, 500,000 IDR each, and the rest of the loan for feed. Now the price for piglets and feed are very high. Ni Ketut needs to very wisely manage the loan and run the business to gets maximum profits in the end. She hopes that during the period, the pigs can grow fast and fat, away from diseases. 

Ni Ketut and the members of Kerto Sato also hope MUK will still support the group until they have capital to run the businesses by themselves.

One member couldn’t attend the meeting because she had a religious ceremony at the Temple.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is 27 years old and single. She owns and manages a small computer shop and a retail store within the local community, which is near the school campus. She dreams of making her business profitable in order to help her parents gain income to sustain their daily necessities. To improve her business, she would like to access financial assistance from the Kiva lenders through ASKI in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy computer parts and grocery items to sell. Through this loan, she is hoping that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy the needed computer parts and grocery items to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Juliana Marleni

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural, la cual queda en la Caserio Culpon s/n - Nueva Arica, distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de chiclayo, región de Lamabyeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juliana se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, y ella solicita préstamo para invertirlo en un activo fijo, pues desea comprar de una mototaxi para su negocio, de esta amnera podrá aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juliana is 41 years old, is married and has no dependent children. She lives in her own house in a rural zone within the Caserio Culpon, Nueva Arica, in the district of Cayaltí, in the Chiclayo province in the Lamabyeque region on the north coast of Peru.

For the last fifteen years, Juliana has made a living raising and selling farm animals. Her business is located in her house, and she is requesting this loan to invest it in an asset. She would like to buy a moto-taxi for her business. By doing so, she will be able to increase her income, improve her profits and thus improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an asset: a moto-taxi for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy a welding machine and other materials for her business for her welding shop business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years and earns more income from her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and other materials for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 49 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Gina has a general store business in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gina has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Jenny requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Jenny would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Beverly works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Beverly is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, thread and zippers for her business

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 51 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband are farmers who plant and harvest rice. Esmeralda wants to improve her harvest, so she needs additional capital. 

She is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help maintain crop nutrition. She hopes to harvest her crop fruitfully and gain income for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 52 years old, married, and blessed with nine children. She is engaged in a vegetable selling business while her husband cultivates their small farm. Due to hardships in her life, she aims to make her business profitable in order gain a higher income. 

She planned to acquire more stocks of various fruits and vegetables to resell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy said stocks of various fruits and vegetables to resell. She believes that her loan will help her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of various fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Famela

texts.en:
Famela is 30 years old and has two children. She has a live-in partner and both of her children are in school.

Famela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Famela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Famela has been raising livestock for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Famela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Lalaine successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Lalaine's business profile again for a new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 38 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Margie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from buying and selling food supplements.

Margie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and coffee

loans.name: Ma. Lira

texts.en:
Ma. Lira is 46 years old and single.  

She is involved in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Lira requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Lira has been in the pig fattening business for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
Romanita is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Romanita is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Romanita has been involved in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be business-oriented. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a developing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cooking oil to sell. 

His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have his own company. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 to 13 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are mostly ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to excel in business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Sofe Ann

texts.en:
Sofe Ann is 24 years old and married with two children.  

Sofe Ann is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Sofe Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nasario

texts.es:
Nasario de 56 años de edad, es una persona acompañada convive con su esposa y su hijo de 25 años de edad. 

 Nasario se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijo que le apoyan en las actividades agrícolas, trabajan en las parcelas que alquilan durante la mañana mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde Nasario se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y a cuidarlas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar dos  vacas que necesita para incrementar la producción de leche que ocupa para la elaboración de queso, crema que ofrece su esposa en su domicilio a los vecinos y en los alrededores.

Nasario planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de lácteos,  la siembra y del préstamo para la compra de las vacas; podrá comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales y poder sembrar.
texts.en:
Nasario is 56 years old, is married and lives with his wife and his 25 year old son.

Nasario wakes up at 5:00 am along with his wife and son, who help him with his agricultural activities. In the morning, he and his son work on the plots that they rent while his wife takes care of the household work. In the afternoon, Nasario cares for and milks the cows.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy two cows that he needs to increase his production of milk which allows him to make cheese and cream which his wife sells from home to their neighbors and in the surrounding areas.

With the revenue that he obtains from the sale of the dairy products, his crops, and from the loan to buy the cows, he plans to be able to buy some land for his animals to graze on and to plant crops.

loans.use: to buy two cows that he needs to increase his production of milk which allows him to make cheese and cream which his wife sells from home to their neighbors and in the surrounding areas.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old, married and has four children. She and her husband are farmers. In the farming business, they plant and harvest rice twice a year. Their income of about PHP 20,000 each harvest season goes for meals and bills at home. Another part of it serves as revolving capital in the business. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to have additional capital for buying herbicides and insecticides to use in farming. This will help protect the crops from insects destroying the crops. She also promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 42 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

Leah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Leah has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 26 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Leah aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ronal Alexander

texts.es:
Ronal de 27 años de edad, es una persona soltera convive junto a sus padres, estudio hasta bachillerato. Él se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus padres que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas. 

Ronal se dedica  a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres, trabaja durante la mañana en la parcela junto a su padre que le ayuda, en la tarde ordeña las vacas y su madre se dedica a vender la leche.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, para comprar el abono, veneno, semilla y podrá pagar el alquiler de la tierra y el pago al arador de la tierra.

Ronal planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de leche, de la siembra, podrá  en un futuro iniciar un negocio de pollo de engorde.
texts.en:
Ronal is 27 years old, single and lives with his parents. He attended school through high school. He wakes at 5:00 am, together with his parents who help him with his agricultural activities and in caring for the cattle.

Ronal makes a living in farming, which he learned from his parents. In the morning, he works on the plot together with his father who helps him. In the afternoon he takes care of the cattle and his mother makes a living selling milk.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy fertilizer, poison and seeds and to pay the rent for his land and the cost for someone to plow the land.

With the revenue he obtains from the sale of milk and the crops, in the future, Ronal plans to be able to start a broiler chicken business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, poison and seeds and to pay the rent for his land and the cost for someone to plow the land.

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
ELIZABETH PERTENECE AL GRUPO "MADRES EMPRENDEDORAS" Y SE CONSIDERA UN MADRE CORAJE, ES CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS
A QUIENES LLAMA SU ADORACIÓN, LE GUSTA EL NEGOCIO DE VENTAS, ES POR ELLO QUE TIENE UNA BODEGA Y APARTE DE ESO DE DEDICA A LA VENTA  DE ARTÍCULOS DE BELLEZA.SOLICITO EL PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS PARA SU BODEGA Y PODER INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS, TIENE LA META DE INAUGURAR MAS TIENDAS Y MEJORAR SUS INGRESOS Y AYUDAR EN TODO LO  NECESARIO A SUS HIJOS.SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA Y AGRADECIDA CON LOS INVERSIONISTAS DE KIVA DE CONTRIBUIR CON EL CRECIMIENTO DE SU NEGOCIO Y POR CONSEGUIR LA CONFIANZA DE PERSONAS QUE AYUDAN EL MEJORAMIENTO EMPRESARIAL DE EMPRENDEDORES COMO ELLA.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a member of the "Madres Emprendedoras" group and considers herself a courageous mother. She is married and has two children whom she calls her devotion. She likes sales, and it is for that reason that she has a store and also she works selling beauty products. She asks for the loan to purchase food supplies for her store and to be able to increase her sales. She has the goal to open more stores and increase her income and help in everything necessary for her children. She is very happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for contributing to the growth of her business and to gaining the confidence of people that they help -- the business improvements of entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: to purchase food products for her store.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 50 años, es soltero, sin carga familiar conocido en el medio, por su labor de servicio de fotocopiado y tipeos. Vive en casa propia con su madre, quien percibe una pensión de jubilación de viudez y hermano que se acaba de jubilar. Oswaldo cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecionos, él vive en una comunidad ubidcada a 45 kms de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque costa norte de Perú, dicha comunidad cuenta con un clima calido y con gente muy amigable, y su población en su mayoría se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia.

Oswaldo se dedica a prestar servicio de fotocopiado y tipeos en computadora, desde hace más de 14 años; y necesita el préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo: compra de utiles de oficina ya que desea impletar sel servicio que ofrece con la venta de utiles para generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y con ello podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 50 years old, single, without family responsibilities. He is known in the area for his work providing photocopy and typing services. He lives in his own house with his mother, who receives a widow's retirement pension and a brother who recently retired. Oswaldo has good references from his neighbors. He lives in a community located 45 km from Chiclayo, in Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.  This community has a warm climate and very friendly people; the majority of the population works in trade, agriculture, and animal husbandry.

Oswaldo has worked providing photocopying and computer typing services for over 14 years, and he needs a loan to invest in working capital, to purchase office equipment since he wants to start a service that sells equipment to generate more income, better profits and, with that, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in working capital, to purchase office equipment.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province’s Memot district, Sochea is 39 years old and a mother of three children. To deal with her daily cost of living, she grows peppers and sells grocery items. 

Sochea has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sochea has requested a first-time loan in order to pay for a vocational training course where she will major in clothes tailoring. She hopes that she can earn specialized credentials in order to get a good job to gain more income.

loans.use: To pay for a vocational training course majoring in clothes tailoring

loans.name: Teresa Victoria

texts.es:
Teresa victoria tiene 51 años, es soltera, sin carga familiar, es muy conocida en el medio, por su labor de elaboracion y venta de comida, ella vive en casa propia con hijo(indeendiente), el cual trabaja como obrero agricola. Ella es una persona con buenas referencias or parte de su familiares y vecinos, su comunidad está ubicada el distrito de La Lagunas, a 40 kms de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, dicho pueblo cuenta con un clima tropical y con gente muy amigable, y su población se dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia.

Teresa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida como ceviche, papa rellena, cebada, etc., desde hace más de 3 años. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de una refrigeradora, lo que le va a permitir almacenar sus materia prima de producción en un mejor estado, y de esta manera podrá ofrecer a sus clientes un servicio más saludable e higiénico, además le permitirá aumentar sus ventas, asi como sus ingresos y por consiguiente su ganancias creceran y mejorará su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa Victoria is 51 years old, single and with no family to support. She is very well known in the area for her work making and selling food. She lives in her own home with her son who is financially independent and works as a farm laborer. Teresa is a person with good references from her family and neighbors. Her community is located in the district of La Lagunas, 40km from Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. Her town has a tropical climate and very friendly people. Its population makes a living in business, farming and livestock.

Teresa has made a living making and selling food like ceviche, stuffed potato, barley, etc. for over three years. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of a refrigerator, which will allow her to store the raw materials for her food production in a better state. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers a more healthy and hygienic service. It will also allow her to increase her sales and her profits, and as a result, her earnings will grow and her quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a refrigerator in order to be able to store the raw materials she uses to make her food.

loans.name: Agricultoras Del Palmar #1 Group

texts.es: Erika, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 5 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Ella se ha dedicado a las labores del hogar y hace tres años decidió por tener su propia fuente de ingresos, cultiva maíz el cual vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo en forma grupal de 12,500 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes, y pago de mano de obra para limpieza y poder tecnificar su cultivo de maíz. Su plan es aumentar el área de cultivos para aumentar la producción. El grupo se llama productoras del Palmar #1, esta formado por tres miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y residen en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal es por 34,000 Lempiras, que lo utilizaran para darle asistencia a sus cultivos. En la foto Erika esta a la izquierda, Porfirio en medio y Matilde a la derecha.
texts.en: Erika, is 23 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage with her husband with whom she has 5 children and lives in a village in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. She has worked in household tasks and three years ago decided that in order to have her own source of income, she would grow corn which she sells in the local market. She has asked for a group loan of 12,5000 Lempiras, which will go to purchase fertilizer and to pay labor costs to clean and to modernize her corn crop. Her plan is to increase the cultivation area to increase production. The group is called Productoras del Palmar #1 and is made up of three members who work in agriculture and live in the same community. The group loan is for 34,000 Lempiras, which will be used to provide assistance for their crops. In the picture, Erika is on the left, Porfirio in the middle, and Matilde on the right.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay labor costs for assistance with her crops.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a farmer who grows rice to sell. He is 49 years old, married and lives in Amulung with his family. He wanted to give enough sustenance to his crop but had insufficient funds to buy farm inputs. His income from the previous harvest was just enough to cover other expenses of the family like school fees and meals. So he is now asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pay farm labor costs. This will help crops grow fruitfully and he will be able to pay laborers who help him with farming activities. 

He will invest  the additional revenue in his children's education. He will be happy if all his children are able to get a degree someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay farm labor costs

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hija, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos.

Consuelo se dedica a la actividad de venta de chupetes y refrescos, desde hace más de 5 años, en su propio domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de una nueva congeladora, para pdoer incrementar el volumen de sus chupetes y/o refrescos y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, lo cual le va a permitir obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar sus ganancias lo q a la vez mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 56 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her daughter in her own house, in a large community in a rural zone of Cayalti, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors.

Consuelo has worked selling popsicles and cold drinks for over 5 years, in her own home. She asks for the loan to purchase a new freezer to be able to increase the volume of her popsicles and cold drinks and in this way grow her business, which will allow her more income and to be able to increase her profits, which will also improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a new freezer.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es viudo y tiene 4 hijos Jose vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Jose es jubilado y percibe una renta, no obstante, se gana dinero extra trabajando como tramitador, este oficio le ha causado problemas de vista  por eso necesita un prestamo para pagar una operación de la vista Jose es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita ayuda
texts.en: Jose is a widower and has 4 children. He lives in El Alto in a house of brick and cement which is his property. Jose is retired and receives an income. Nevertheless, he earns extra money working as a clerk. This work has caused him vision problems, and for this reason he needs a loan to pay for an eye operation. Jose is the only source of income in his household, and he needs help.

loans.use: to pay for an eye operation

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Veronica es soltera no tiene hijos y vive en El Alto en una casa que le pertenece a sus padres y tiene casi todos los servicios basicos Veronica se dedica a la elaboracion de chalecos y necesita un credito para comprar telas, cierres y otros materiales Veronica es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita ayuda
texts.en: Veronica is single, doesn't have children, and lives in El Alto in a house that belongs to her parents and has almost all the basic services. Veronica works making vests and needs a loan to purchase fabric, fasteners and other materials. Veronica is the only source of income in her household and needs help.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, fasteners and other materials.

loans.name: Ramon Orlando

texts.es: Ramón, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 1 hijo, actualmente vive con sus padres, en una aldea del municipio de El Progreso. Se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y frutas como ser bananos, papas, yuca, repollo, tomate, chile, cebolla, papaya, melón, patastes, zanahoria, naranjas,  etc. Este negocio lo tiene hace 7 años, y vende en forma ambulante con su vehículo. El monto de préstamo es de 15,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá para aumentar su volumen de compra de productos como ser bananos, cebolla, chile, tomate, papas, repollo, papayas, etc. Y lograr obtener mayor ganancia. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, que le permita darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ramón is 28 years old, single, has 1 child, and currently lives with his parents in a village in the municipality of El Progreso. He works buying and selling vegetables and fruits such as bananas, potatoes, yuca, cabbage, tomatoes, chiles, onions, papaya, melons, patastes (a type of squash), carrots, oranges, etc. He has had this business for 7 years and sells from his truck.  The amount of the loan is 15,000 lempiras, this money will be invested in increasing the volume of his purchases of products such as bananas, onions, chiles, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, papayas, etc. and to manage to have increased profit. His goal is to grow his business which will allow him to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase products such as bananas, onions, chiles, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, papayas, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is a 47-year-old mother who owns and manages a small variety store in her village. She aims to generate a higher income to support her family's necessities. She plans to increase her product offering but has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to request a loan of PHP30,000 to buy more stock of beverages, seasoning, laundry  detergent, soft drinks, soaps, assorted candies, and biscuits to resell. She believes that this loan will greatly help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beverages, seasoning, laundry  detergent, soft drinks, soaps, assorted candies, and biscuits to resell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es casada tiene 4 hijos  y vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Teodora se dedica a la venta de comida y necesita un prestamo para  comprar viveres (arroz, aceite y otros) para su negocio  Por el momento Teodora es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Teodora is married, has 4 children, and lives in El Alto in a house made of brick and cement which is her own property. Teodora works selling food and needs a loan to purchase supplies (rice, oil and others) for her business. At the moment, Teodora is the only source of income in her household, for which she needs its help.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (rice, oil, and others)

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is 35 years old and a married man who has two dependent children. He lives in a community in Pursat Province. To earn a living, he and his wife manage a rice farming business which is their sole source of income. So far, they have been in this occupation for almost fourteen years, with an average income of USD $7 a day. 

Phal wants to improve the general living conditions of his entire family by building a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Shujaa Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her early 20s, is married with one school-going child.  For the past three years, she has been selling different types of clothes, including sarongs, fabrics, and Moslem-style dresses.  She works from 9 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Salma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy sarongs, fabrics, and Moslem-style dresses.  She dreams of building her own house.  

Salma will share this loan with her loan group "Shujaa," which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy sarongs, fabrics, and Moslem-style dresses

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk for selling. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers come from all kinds of backgrounds. She will use the KES30,000 loan to buy farm equipment. Her business goal is to have a big dairy farm within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more cows.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber es joven emprendedor, de 29 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Tiene dos maravillosos hijos y una esposa que lo apoya de manera incondicional. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 6 meses trabaja como Operario en una prestigiosa empresa de Embutidos y le va muy bien gracias a su excelente desempeño. 
Wilber está necesitando una nueva cocina porque la que tiene en su domicilio está un poco deteriorada, es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá renovar y comprar una nueva cocina para que de esta manera su esposa pueda sentir mayor seguridad cuando cocine. Con ello estará mejorando su calidad de vida y así seguirá esforzándose por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber is a young entrepreneur, 29 years old, and lives in Ica with his family. He has two marvelous children and a wife who supports him unconditionally. He is a person with a great desire to get ahead. For more than 6 months he has worked as an operator in a prestigious cold cut business and it is going very well for him thanks to his excellent performance.

Wilber needs a new stove because the one he has in his house is a bit deteriorated, and for this reason he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help that they have offered him, he will be able to renovate and purchase a new stove so that in this way his wife will feel safer when she cooks. With this he will be improving their quality of life and also continue working hard for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a stove to furnish his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a taxi to earn money

loans.name: Wende Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid-forties, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Hadija's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients and a fridge to start selling cold drinks. She dreams of owning a hotel. 

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group "WENDE" which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and a fridge to start selling cold drinks.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.en:
Ozoda is a hardworking woman. She lives with her family in the southern part of Tajikistan. Ozoda has four children. She is divorced and her former husband does not help her provide for the children.

For the last ten years, Ozoda has been sewing traditional women dresses for a living. For each dress, Ozoda earns 60 Somoni. Ozoda work 18 days a month and manages the business alone.

Ozoda needs financial support because her son is ill. She is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni to buy medicines to treat her son. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her son

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 63-year-old married woman, who has thirteen years of experience in the mouneh (preserved fruit) business. In 2005, she established her own business to support her husband in their living. Today, her business is going on just fine, but like some other businesses, sometimes they need extra support to develop and improve more.

For this reason, Houda is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy special seasonal fruits in order to prepare and conserve them for the coming seasons to stay ready for various customers' requests and increase her business capital.

Houda hopes to keep on developing her business in a well managed way to make sure that she and her husband will have a peaceful life.

loans.use: To buy special seasonal fruits in order to prepare and conserve them for the coming seasons

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of groceries. Her business goal is to have a wholesale grocery shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a responsible father who owns and manages a small welding shop in the local community to generate additional income. He is 50 years old and has three children. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, he needs to earn a higher income to sustain their necessities and finance the schooling of his children. With this regard, he aimed to improve more of his business to increase his income. Having inadequate capital, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy iron and other materials needed in the welding shop. Through hard work, he believes that he will improve the business and generates a higher income.

loans.use: to buy iron and other materials needed in the welding shop

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en  unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo y reside con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Concepción Sur Santa Barbara. Lorenzo se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 6 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la mecánica automotriz. La producción la vende en el mercado de la zona. Ha decidido solicitar el segundo ciclo de préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y limpieza de la finca, con el fin de mejorar la producción y  los ingresos. Su plan es seguir sembrando café en un área de terreno que tiene para que su familia tenga un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en: Lorenzo is 26 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife with whom he has 1 child. He lives with his family in a village in the municipality of Concepción Sur Santa Barbara. Lorenzo has worked growing coffee for the last 6 years. Previously, he worked as an auto mechanic. He sells his products in the market in the zone. He decided to ask for a second loan cycle of 10,000 Lempiras; this loan will be invested in purchasing fertilizers and cleaning his plantation, with the goal to improve his production and income. His plan is to continue planting coffee in an area of land that he has, so that his family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and clean his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hiperbanco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HIPERBANCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia continua trabajando a pedido para todos sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose al negocio de preparación y venta de refrigerios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones entre otros.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "HIPERBANCO"; this bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco in the Cusco department. 

The featured partner is Carmen Rosa, she makes a living by selling clothing. She continues taking orders from friends, family, customers and others. She also works making and selling snacks. She is a responsible and earnest person, making her the one to support her family. 

The member is requesting a loan to buy pants and other items.  The members who appear in the inset to the accompanying photo asked permission to be late for the meeting. 

The partner is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium, and is committed to comply with the repayments of her loan by their deadlines.

loans.use: to buy pants and other things.

loans.name: Touch Group

texts.en:
In the picture, the small girl is a granddaughter of a group member. Touch is 53 years old, a farmer cultivating rice and also fattening pigs to resell. She has been a farmer since 1981. She is a widow with two children living in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Both of her children make concrete stairs for sale. Together, they can earn approximately $21 per day. 

Now Touch would like to request a loan as part of a group of five members and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her live in better conditions and keep the environment clean. In the future, she is going to expand her pig fattening and renovate her house.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Hello! Meet Christine, who is a 36-year-old, hardworking mother and farmer who is easy to get along with. She hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the world’s best long distance runners, many of whom have won gold medals in international marathons. She is happily married and blessed with 3 lovely children. She passionately loves dairy farming and has been practising it for the past 5 years. She has never regretted starting to farm. Her primary source of income is milk, eggs, and crop farming. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family and she has always yearned to have more dairy cows. Accordingly, she is seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will be producing between 15-20 litres of milk per day. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as “the ideal drinking milk”, because it will not lack an adequate amount of fat and will possess desirable quantities of protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production in her farm, which will translate to more sales volume and better income for her and her family. Because of this high milk production potential, she will save more money to fully repay the loan. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as disciplined. She operates a retail business where she sells dresses and shirts, and also does tailoring. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 48-year-old resident of Estancia, Iloilo, Philippines and she is married to Alex. She and his husband manage their household while operating the business. They work hard for their child and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Myrna maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Myrna is also a water distributor and it helps with their everyday expenses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. 

Myrna dreams to become successful both in business and in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Warmicuna Llanqanchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLANQANCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth ella es conviviente y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su trabajo como profesora del nivel primario,la socia enseña a niños desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of this group belong to the community bank of Warmicuna Llanqanchis. The bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

This member is Ruth. She is 42 years old, has two children, and lives with her partner. She works as an elementary school teacher, and teaches the children from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. She has been working at this job for 4 years now, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a clothing store. She is requesting a loan to purchase a television for her home.

The other members of the group earn a living selling clothes, selling chicha (a drink made from corn), selling groceries, and selling animals.

Ruth is thankful to those who form a part of her dream, and for this reason she is committed to making all of her repayments according to the agreement.

loans.use: to buy a television for her home.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas e su motocicleta a través de las veredas del municipio de Santa Fe De Antioquia posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas aéreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, es padre de dos hijos de 8 y 4 años a los cuales siempre ha procurado por ofrecerles la mejor educación.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su motocicleta ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su moto y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis is a very hard-working and organized man. He earns a living offering people transportation services on his motorcycle through the paths of the township of Santa Fe de Antioquia, enabling travel from the community to the different areas of the township.

He is a friendly man, accommodating and very entrepreneurial. He is the father of two children, ages 8 and 4, to whom he has always tried to offer the best education.

He is applying for a loan to do maintenance and repairs on his motorcycle, since it is his only means of work.

With this loan he will be able to improve the condition of his motorcycle, and he will be able to continue offering his service with total security and without risking his life or those of his customers.

loans.use: to do repairs and maintenance on his motorcycle in order to continue offering his transportation service.

loans.name: Khupching Group

texts.en:
Suanzaching (33), a featured member of the group with her hand raised, is a very talented and God-gifted weaver spending most of her time in weaving traditional shawls to sustain her family. She has four school-going children who still need support. Her husband is a carpenter and draws his income from selling his products. Both of them work hard to sustain their humble family with their meager income.

As their present income does not suffice for their household expenses anymore, Suanzaching decided to broaden the horizons of her weaving business, that is, to buy a loom for weaving. The loom will help her to work faster and produce more of her products that will lead her to increase her income. She believed that by owning a loom her monthly income will increased twice as much as the present income. It will benefit the whole family in improving their economic condition. She is very happy that she came across WSDS to be in a position to get a loan to buy her desired loom without creating any financial problems in her family.

The group of Khupching was formed by women of similar interest to get a loan for improving their business endeavours.

loans.use: To buy a loom used for weaving traditional shawls (namely Pon loupi shawls and Sinnel  shawls).

loans.name: Molhoipah Group

texts.en:
Lhaikhoneng (48) with her hand raised is a featured member of the group Molhoipah.  There are three adults and two school-going children in their family. Her total monthly income comes up to 18,200 INR, with a total household income of 20,000 INR, which means that she is the bread earner of the family. 

She makes clothes, including cushion covers, mosquito nets, school uniforms, curtains, etc., with her sewing machine and sells her products, making it her main source of income. She wanted to expand her business by buying more sewing machines and employing more people so that she could generate more income. Her family lives in a rented house and she runs her business in the house itself. At present she is in the process of expanding her business by opening a tailoring shop in the market place and is in urgent need of money. Fortunately, she received loan from WSDS and was able to fulfill her plan. She says, "Thank you so much, Kiva, for the loan."

The Molhoipah group was formed by members of similar interest to get a loan. The other group members are in similar businesses who also sell clothes which they buy from the suppliers and earn a small profit from those products they have sold. Most of them are the main source of income for their family and are very much concerned about improving the financial condition of their families.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for opening a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for his cafeteria to resell.

loans.name: Dania

texts.es: Dania es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Dania prepara cafe y vende emparedados y quiere un credito para poder comprar un quiosco movil para vender sus productos Dania es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Dania is single but she has two children. She lives in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement that she rents. Dania makes coffee and sells sandwiches, and is requesting a loan to buy a mobile kiosk to sell her products in. Dania is the only source of income in her home and needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a mobile kiosk for her business.

loans.name: Hiari  Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a mother of one son and three daughters who are in school. She is in her early thirties and is married. She now supports her family with a business. She has a secondhand clothing business (commonly known as Mitumba) in Tanzania for three years. Sarah works from 7 am to 6 pm per working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Sarah used the previous credits, since repaid, to replenish her business with more clothes. She currently looks happy because her business sales have grown. Sarah earned an extra income which she used to help her family, by covering school fees and household expenses. With her new loan request, she will buy stock to resell. Her dream is to expand her business portfolio.

She will share this loan with her two-member group, Hairi Ya Moya. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a business that her family will depend on. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL NACIENTE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maura ella es soltera y tiene 54 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members pictured belong to the communal bank "Sol Naciente." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Member Senora Maura is single, 54 years old, and has 4 children. She has her own business, a restaurant, where she prepares different dishes like chicken and potatoes, soups, and sauteed beef. She works from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m. She has had her business for ten years and has done very well. Her dream is to expand her restaurant. She is asking for the loan to buy cooking ingredients like chicken, beef, and vegetables.

The other members make a living in handicraft sales, restaurants, grocery stores, and clothing stores. The member is grateful to anyone that can contribute to her dream through the loan, and she promises to pay her dues by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients, like chicken, beef, and vegetables.

loans.name: Cosmetics Group

texts.en:
Nemlemhhoi (25) is a divorcee and has been living with her parents since her divorce. She left her daughter with her husband since the divorce but still supports her daughter. After the divorce, life was hard and she was jobless too. She wanted to earn an income to improve her condition that leads her to open a cosmetic stall in the main market in Churachandpur. She needed capital to start the business, for which she has taken loan from WSDS and wanted to take a loan again for the second cycle.

Nemlemhhoi is a very hard working woman, trustworthy and giving her best effort to generate income to support herself and her daughter. She said that she will make the best use of the loan to improve her business by buying different products and facilitating her customers to attract more people. 

The first cycle of the loan has been very helpful in her business endeavour and she wanted to take second cycle of the loan again.  The Cosmetics group was formed by women with similar interests to take a loan that will help in their business endeavor.

loans.use: To buy inventory including body lotion, lipstick, nail polish, rubber bands, earrings, toys, etc.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es viudo y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas y con paredes de adobe, la casa esta ubicada en  La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de todo tipo de trabajos en madera ya que es carpintero trabajando por más de diez horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios médicos de su familia, es por eso que solícita el crédito ya que desea  comprar más madera y pegamento para la elaboración de trabajos y posteriormente venderlos ya que con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para comprar material.
El sueño de Emilio, es construir más habitaciones en su domicilio y ampliar su taller para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emilio is a widower and has two children who are of school age. They live in their own house with walls of adobe, occupying two small rooms. The house is located in La Paz.

He now does all types of work with wood, since he is a carpenter. He works for more than 10 hours a day, since he is the only one who covers the expenses of food, education, and medical services for his family. It is for this reason that he is applying for the loan, since he wants to buy more wood and glue to make his works and later sell them, since with the little that he earns, it does not go far enough to buy materials.

Emilio's dream is to build more rooms in his house and expand his workshop to improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Kotognontala Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  de KOTOGNONTALA II est constitué de 10 femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et 5 enfants. La plupart d’entre eux vivent dans des familles polygamiques à Koloko un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA II collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso à fin de mieux organisé leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (mil, arachide, sésame, haricot etc.) 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Madame MAGNA deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte payer ses frais de labour, de sarclage, acheter de la semence, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide et autre petit équipement pour entretenir son champ d’environ 0,5 hectare d’arachide
A la fin de la campagne, les productions sont vendues en espèce à Beleco.
Elle envisage réalise un bénéfice moyen de 75 000F CFA par campagne qui sera investie dans le commerce.
texts.en: The Kotognontala II group is made up of 10 married women who, on average, are 47 years old and have five children. For the most part, they live in polygamous families in Koloko, one of the villages of the Dioïla prefecture, region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The women of the Kotognontala II group are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their seasonal activities. The crops cultivated are, among others, millet, peanuts, sesame, beans, etc. They are on their second joint effort with the institution. With this loan, Mrs. Magna, the second person from the right to the left in the standing row, expects to pay for the cost of labor and hoeing and the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, and other small equipment to maintain her field, about .5 hectares of peanuts. At the end of the campaign, the productions are sold for cash in Beleco. She plans to make a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA per field, which will be invested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, hoeing, and small tools.

loans.name: Benkelema  1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FOFO, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec MAMINE YAYA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 120 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkelema 1 group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old, have two children and all live in polygamous families in Fofo, commune of Kolondieba, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their first loan with the institution. The crops cultivated are rice, peanuts, and corn. Mamine Yaya is the first person to the left of the photo in a standing position. With her loan, she expects to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and the costs of labor for agricultural fields to run 2 hectares of land. The produce is sold in Kolondieba after the harvest to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 120,000 francs CFA which will permit her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband in the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and the costs of labor for agricultural fields.

loans.name: Benkelema 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA  3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FOFO, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec FANTA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The BENKELEMA 3 group is made up of married women who are, on average, 42 years old with three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Fofo, commune of  Kolondieba (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their first farming loan with the institution.

Fanta, a member of the group, grows rice, groundnut and maize. In the photo, she is in the back row, standing first from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs and seeds, and also to cover her plowing costs to maintain two hectares of land. After the harvest, she sells her crop in Kolondieba and her customers are both men and women. She is expecting to make a profit of 150,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover her plowing costs during the farming season.

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FOFO, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mais  avec RAMATOU 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 1 hectare. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkelema 2 group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old, have three children and all live in polygamous families in Fofo, commune of Kolondieba, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their first loan with the institution. The crops cultivated are peanuts and corn. Ramatou is the first person to the left of the photo in a standing position. With her loan, she expects to pay for fertilizers, seeds, and the costs of labor for agricultural fields to run 1 hectare of land. The produce is sold in Kolondieba after the harvest to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 75,000 francs CFA which will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband in the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and the costs of labor for agricultural fields.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 57 years old, married and manages a small store selling grocery items to the people in his village. He hopes to increase his sales but has insufficient funds to increase his goods to sell. He is now asking for additional capital of 5,000 pesos to buy soap, sugar, coffee and canned goods to sell. He hopes to provide good services to all his customers.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, coffee and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 69 years old and married with six children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and pig fattening.

Milagros aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria tiene 66 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, en el sector de Santa Rosa Baja, distrito Cayaltí, provinciad e Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; la comunidad donde reside es pequeña y la población en su mayoría se muy tranquila y armoniosa.

silveria se dedica a las actividad de venta de comida con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el cual está ubicado en el mercado de Cayaltí, ella solicita préstamo para la ampliación su negocio, pues desea comprar bancos y mesas para atender a un número mayor de clientes comensales, dicha inversión le servirá para aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y con ello también su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silveria is 66 years old and lives with her spouse in the sector of Santa Rosa Baja, Cayaltí district, province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The community she lives in is small and the majority of the population are very peaceful and harmonious.

Silveria makes a living selling food and has over ten years of experience in the business, which is located in the market in Cayaltí. She is requesting the loan for the expansion of her business. She wants to buy benches and tables to cater for a larger number of dining customers. That investment will serve to increase her profits, improve her earnings and with that, also improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy benches and tables to expand her business.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 29 years old, married and had a child. Her family lives at Amulung. She operates a small store selling grocery items for income. Her income goes for meals and bills at home. Another part is also used for revolving capital. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 pesos to buy sardines, biscuits, noodles and sugar to sell. 

Someday, she hopes to keep maintaining good sales and earnings to construct a more convenient stall.

loans.use: to buy sardines, biscuits, noodles and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his business more through purchasing many kinds of accessories and simple electronic appliances for his store

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 31-year-old married man and a father of only one child who is 2 years old. He is living with his family in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He has a university education and now, he is an employee with a modest salary in the private sector. Sami is a very talented and respected man. He is also very active and dynamic and knows how he can run his life well. He strives hard to achieve a better future for his family. 

Unfortunately, Sami's salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of his family. In order to cover all those expenses, he decided to increase his income through purchasing a taxi to work as a driver to transport people from one place to another inside the capital city to earn money as another income source for his family, and to use it as transportation for himself. 

Sami thinks this business will be very profitable for himself. He could accumulate an amount of money from his salary to purchase a taxi. Unfortunately; that amount of money is not enough. For this reason, Sami is requesting a loan of 1,330,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase a taxi to work as a driver to earn money that will help him improve the living conditions of his family.

Sami looks forward to purchasing another taxi besides the first one to rent it out. His dream in the future is opening an automobile exhibition.

loans.use: To purchase a taxi

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Manngaihchin (45) is the featured member of the group with a raised hand in the photo. She is an expert in weaving different types of traditional shawls and wraparounds. She lives with her two college-going children since her husband left her 10 years ago. She earns and supports her family by weaving traditional shawls and wraparounds, namely Gungal, Senior, Karbi, Puanthupi and Akshipak (local names). She could hardly provide for her children’s education and meet the basic necessities in the household. 

As she is a diligent person, she weaves most of the time and hardly has spare time to relax and enjoy friends and family. Her poor financial condition sometimes limits her from buying yarn for weaving her products, which is her main source of income. Life was in its ups and downs until she heard of WSDS, where she can avail a loan with affordable interest. She is very grateful to receive such a loan from WSDS to help her in times of need. She believes that her hard work will be fruitful one day, and her family will be able to live a comfortable life.

Women of common interest formed the group Lotus in order to get a loan to make use of in their business endeavors. The members wanted to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Magdalena Maria

texts.es:
Magdalena, es una mujer de 45 años de edad que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales. 

Inició con una pequeña legumbrera ubicada en su casa, hasta finales del año 2012 lo cerró, porque quería incursionar en el área comercial de la venta de hielo y desde inicios de este año, comenzó efectivamente con este negocio ofreciendo hielo a todas las personas del municipio de La Dorada que necesiten de este producto. 

La titular se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar su crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de un congelador grande con el cual podrá producir y vender mucho mas hielo. 

De esta forma podrá consolidar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su esposo y sus hijos al brindarles una mejor educación.

Apoya a una madre con gran deseo de sacar a su familia adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 45-year-old woman who has done different kinds of work for the past several years.

She started a small vegetable stand located in her home until she closed it at the end of 2012 because she wanted to enter into ice sales and, at the beginning of the year, she actually started that business selling ice to everyone in the municipality of La Dorada who needs this product.

The borrower is known for being an enterprising, kind woman of vision with a great drive to get ahead, which is why she is requesting this loan to invest in a large freezer she can use to produce and sell more ice. 

This will consolidate her business and improve the quality of life of her husband and her children by providing them with a better education. 

Support a mother with a great desire to get her family ahead with a loan!
