loans.use: to buy a large freezer to produce and store thrice she sells, which will allow her to provide her children with a better education.

loans.name: Wilnald

texts.fr: Wilnald est un informaticien,il vit a Miragoane département des Nippes Haiti. Wilnald est marie et il a deux enfants. Il veut intégrer les produits EarthSpark Enèji Pwòp dans sa boutique pour aider les gens a lutter contre le black-out.
texts.en: Wilnald is a computer specialist. He lives in Miragoane in the Nippes department of Haiti. Wilnald is married and has two children. He would like to bring EarthSpark “Enèji Pwòp” products into his boutique in order to help people prevent blackouts.

loans.use: sell renewable energy products.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MENA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le mais  avec SAFIATOU 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 220 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married. On average, they are 38 years old and have three children. They all live in polygamous families in Mena, which is located in Kolondieba Cercle, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their faming activities through the rainy season. This is their ninth loan with the institution. Their previous loans were repaid.

They grow rice, peanuts, and corn with Safiatou who is standing at left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for three hectares. 

After the harvest, they sell their crops in Kolondieba to a clientele comprised of men and women. They would like to earn 220,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio es casado y tiene dos hijos vive en La Paz en una casa de adobe donde paga un alquiler Su domcilio presenta varias filtraciones ocasionadas por el agua Antonio es chofer y necesita un prestamo para arreglar las rajaduras en su domicilio para terminar con las filtraciones y no tener problemas en temporada de lluvia La esposa trabaja como niñera pero la pareja tiene muchos gastos y por eso necesitan ayuda
texts.en: Antonio is married and has two children.  He lives in La Paz in an adobe house where he pays rent.  His home has several leaks caused by water.  Antonio is a driver and he needs a loan to fix the cracks in his home to get rid of the leaks and not have problems during the rainy season.  His wife works as a nanny but the couple has many expenses and therefore needs help.

loans.use: to fix the cracks in his home

loans.name: Guilmar Alejandro

texts.es:
Guilmar es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Pisco junto a su familia. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres pudo estudiar la carrera de Arquitectura y actualmente brinda servicios de Arquitectura e Ingeniería, le va muy bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y con su trabajo apoya a su familia.
Guilmar quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá pintarrajear las paredes de su domicilio y mejorar los ambientes, de esta manera estará brindando mayor bienestar a sus padres y en poco tiempo podrá comprarse su casa propia para poder independizarse.
texts.en:
Guilmar is a very hardworking and enterprising person.  He is 54 years old, single, and lives in Pisco with his family.  Thanks to his parents' support he was able to pursue a degree in architecture and he currently does architectural and engineering work.  It is going very well for him because he always puts effort into everything he does and he supports his family with his work.  

Guilmar wants to improve his family's quality of life, which is why he is very thankful to Kiva's lenders because with the support they have offered him he will be able to plaster the walls of his home and improve its conditions.  In so doing, he will be offering his parents greater wellbeing and, in a short time, he will be able to buy his own home and become independent.

loans.use: to plaster his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw material, such as wood, to start his business and achieve his dream of independence

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and a mother of three. 

She manages a small retail store while her husband works on their farm. Due to financial hardship, she would like to improve and increase her business to generate a higher income, and so she wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to resell. As she has limited capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, junk foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps and seasonings.

She hopes she will receive this financial assistance as she believes that it will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, junk foods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps and seasonings to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne is a female Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more potatoes and tomatoes. Her business goal is to open another business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have an improved lifestyle. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is aged 31, married and blessed with two children.

She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 daily. Her net income from this business usually goes towards their savings. 

However, due to inadequate capital to run her business, she would now like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase beverages, charcoal, rice, detergent soap, canned goods and noodles to sell. 

She hopes that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, charcoal, rice, detergent soap, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Jema

texts.en: Jema is 30 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in Morogoro district and she is a volunteer in her nearby secondary school. Jema is a businesswoman selling clothes in her shop. She is traveling from one region to another to buy clothes at wholesale for a lower price. She travels about 200 kilometers. Jema can’t afford to use vehicles to transport her stock due to the small capital she owns. She depends on her business to pay school fees for her children, having her social needs and taking care of her relatives by buying food, clothes and shelter for her them. Her family appreciates Jema for being a helper in the family and her community adores Jema's products. Jema was inspired by her fellow women who make their living from profits they earn through business. That encouraged Jema to start her business of selling women's clothes. Jema is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business from a retail to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to expand her clothing business from retail to wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Reasmey

texts.en: Reasmey is 20 years old and a student. He lives with his parents in Kratie Province of Cambodia. Because of the lack of financial support, Reasmey would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fee. This loan will help him graduate. In the future, he is going to find a good job in an NGO or local company.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Ubwa

texts.en:
Ubwa is an enthusiastic 21-year-old who is looking to expand her business selling men’s clothing in Rufiji District, Tanzania. She saw an opportunity to open her store when she realized that men had to travel to town whenever they wanted to shop for clothing, unlike women who have many clothing boutiques to choose from in Ubwa’s village. After this discovery, her family, whom she lives with, gave her a small amount of capital to start the business. With the capital, she went to town, bought men’s clothing at a wholesale price and then returned to her village where she began selling the clothing for a profit at the retail price.
 
When Ubwa goes to fetch new stock, she leaves the shop in the care of her family because the travel to town takes about two days. She loves and enjoys her business and the support she gets from her family. Ubwa has been reinvesting most of her profits in her business because her dream is to one day own a boutique.
  
Ubwa is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more quality and new fashion men clothes in bulk to meet her customers' needs. With the profits, Ubwa wishes to employ one person in her shop and enroll in higher education.

loans.use: to buy more quality, new fashion men's clothes in bulk

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 26 years old and runs a women's clothing shop in Bagamoyo, Tanzania. For the past few years, she has run the shop selling items at a retail price and earning a profit, since the items were initially bought in bulk from a nearby town. Her choice of products to purchase depends on the new fashion in the market, which most of the time comes from her customers' recommendations. 

Apart from running a business, Farida spends two and a half hours a week volunteering at a youth program in her village. The program organizes youth groups who come together to share skills that will be beneficial for life after school. Farida is also supporting her younger sister’s education by paying her school fees. With the requested Kiva loan, Farida will buy more merchandise to expand her business. With the additional profits, she hopes to support 30 vulnerable children in her community with school supplies, including notebooks and pens that they need to succeed in school.

loans.use: To purchase up-to-date clothing designs

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 27 years old and lives with her one child in Kilolo district, Tanzania. To give back to her community, she volunteers in her local secondary school identifying and discussing challenges with students and guiding them to find solutions so that they can pursue their future studies. 

Vicky is a businesswoman selling women’s clothes including Kanga and Vitenge (colorful African garments) in a small shop. She travels 50 miles from her home to town in order to purchase the clothing she sells in her shop. Vicky uses the profits she earns for household expenses. 

Vicky is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by purchasing Kanga and Vitenge (colorful African garments) in bulk to fill the empty spaces in her shop so that she can employ someone to run the business on her behalf. This will give her more time to travel to another region to buy different quality Kanga and Vitenge to attract more customers. Vicky plans to use the additional profits to expand her shop and provide her family with a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing in bulk

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
28-year-old Christina lives in Kilombero District, Tanzania with her two children, husband and two of her uncle’s children. She is a volunteer in her nearby secondary school where she helps girls and boys understand their wellbeing by encouraging them to study hard and attend school regularly. Christina also helped one student with school exercise books, pens and support to meet her basic needs. Christina is a role model in her community because she is a fighter against poverty and encourages her fellow girls not to accept early marriage. 

To support her family, Christina is a businesswoman selling cosmetics in her small shop. Customers do like Christina's products because she sells quality goods and provides receipts. Christina uses her profits to purchase more products for the shop and household goods and to pay school fees for her children. Christina is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase goods in bulk. She will use the profit to repair her business building, expand her shop to sell items at a wholesale cost and pay school fees for her children so that they can receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Remina

texts.en:
Remina is 28 years old and lives in Kilolo District, Tanzania. She volunteers in her local secondary school helping students identify and overcome challenges that impact their learning and performance.
 
Remina works very hard at her business selling beverages in a small shop. She uses the profits she makes to support herself and her family with food, health care and school fees for her siblings. Remina is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing the amount of stock she has available to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola lives with her son, mother, and younger sister in the Iringa District, Tanzania. As the breadwinner of the family, Scola works hard to provide support through her tailoring business. With her earnings, she is able to support her son’s education and cover other living costs.
 
At the age of 25, Scola is a role model to youth in her village. She is tutoring young girls to tailor so they can employ themselves later in life. She also organizes school youth groups to have discussions on issues that matter to them and helps students do well inside and outside of school.

Scola is requesting a Kiva loan so she can purchase more sewing machines, which will enable her to hire youths with an interest and skill in tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machines

loans.name: Kulwa

texts.en:
Kulwa is a 31-year-old single mother of one child living in Bagamoyo, Tanzania. For more than three years, she has owned and been working full-time in a beauty salon where she does hair styling for women and girls. The profits from this permanent job allow her to support herself and her child. 
Kulwa is requesting a Kiva loan to improve her business by buying dryers, steamers and modern beauty products and to renovate the salon to attract more customers. With the additional profits earned, Kulwa is planning to take her child to school and support her family with food, healthcare and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase dryers, steamers and modern beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her shop to a wholesale shop

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
At the age of 24, Doris lives with her husband, mother, and siblings in Kilombero district, Tanzania. She supports her family with food, clothing and hospital care with the income she earns from her small retail shop where she sells groceries, including salt, cooking oil and soap. 

Once a week, Doris spends time working with youth in a secondary school, where she talks with students about life in and after school. She is also supporting one child who is in primary school with a uniform, exercise books and other school costs. Doris, whose education was supported by Camfed, recognizes the power of giving back to other vulnerable children in her community. With this generous spirit, she contributes some of the profits from her grocery store each month to help vulnerable primary school students with uniforms and exercise books. 

Doris is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business and employ someone who will provide help in buying and selling commodities. 

Doris dreams of using her profit to fill her shop with quality products in order to cater to conferences and wedding ceremonies. She wishes to have a quality life and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: to expand her shop and hire someone.

loans.name: Kulab

texts.en:
Kulab is a resident of Kandal province, where she grows rice. She is 60 years old and has eight children. Currently only one child is in school. 

Besides her agribusiness, she also sells handmade baskets, which she weaves herself. She has been involved in her current businesses for many years. 

Despite the difficulty, she still wants to focus more on her son’s education, and so she is applying for an education loan to pay for his tuition fees. She hopes that he will study hard, get good grades and then get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years of age, very young, full of energy and very hardworking. He is based in Soy Village in Eldoret, an area that is referred to as “the city of champions“ because it's home to the best marathon runners that the world has ever produced. He is still single and has been doing mixed farming for the past two years. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop farming. He passionately loves dairy farming because of the constant income that he gets and has even nicknamed one of his cows "Karait”. Dairy farming is a very profitable business venture in Soy Village and has seen an upsurge in growth but the demand has been so high that the supply of milk cannot be met. Emmanuel is seeking a loan to buy an additional good breed of dairy cow. Having understood the market requirements, he wants to take full advantage of the ready demand that is there. The dairy cow he wants to buy is a quality breed that can produce 10-20 liters of milk a day and this will boost his production level significantly. Increased milk production will translate to more profits; hence improving his living conditions. The breed of cow he will buy has so many advantages. It has high resistance to diseases and its milk has high protein and moderate fats.

Through your loan he is going to make more profits and increase his income level. Profits from milk selling will be used to take care of his parents and improve his livelihood financially. Being still single and young he wants to lay a good foundation for his family to come.

loans.use: to purchase a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as humble. He operates a retail business where he sells rice, soap, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a location suitable for business and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap and other items. His business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have another business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a food stall where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good place. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy cooking utensils. His business goal is to open a hotel within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
This is Ramil, 41, resident of Sara, Iloilo, Philippines. He is married to Roselyn, who also operates a direct selling business, and they have two children. He, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ramil also runs a corn growing farm. He grows corn on their farm located in Iloilo, which is in the high lands where it is suited to growing corn and other fruits. He sells his product at the market, to the fruit stores that he supplies regularly, and to the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every week.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business. Part of the loan will also go on the maintenance of his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands.

Ramil dreams of expanding his farm business further and growing other fruit staples. He wants his children to finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for his business.

loans.name: Mereyra

texts.es:
Mereyra tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su hija, en casa propia, en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, ella goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos.

Mereyra se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores como patos y gallinas, con más de 10 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en el sector nuevo México. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Mereyra is 47 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her daughter in a small community in a rural part of Cayalti in the province of Chiclayo, which is located on the northern coast of Peru in the department of Lambayeque. She has many good references (personal and work-related) from her neighbors.

Mereyra makes a living from breeding and selling animals like ducks and chickens. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business, specifically in the new Mexican sector. She is asking for the loan in order to buy animals, as well as feed for them. This way, she will be able to grow her business, earn more income, and better the quality of life for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
La socia Sixta  se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sixta makes a living selling food. She makes many different plates, such as baked chicken, soup, and sauteed beef. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. She already has 8 years of experience in this business, and she has done very well.

Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for the loan in order to buy cooking products, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking products, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Hoàn operates a food stall selling tofu. She is requesting a loan to purchase soybeans to make and sell tofu.

Hoàn is 39 years old and married with three children. Hoàn is the group leader of the Nhom 01 Đông Cương Group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoàn's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoàn has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Hoàn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase soybeans to make and sell tofu

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang is 36 years old. She lives with her family in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. Chheang is married and has two dependent children; both of them are in school. Her main business is from rice farming. To better support her family, she also raises ducks for resale. She has been working for 18 years. This is the first loan for Chheng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and will use a portion of her loan to buy duck feed and more ducklings. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income from her current businesses so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy duck feed and more ducklings.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel tiene 61 años, es casada, conocida en el medio, por su labor de crianza y venta de cerdos. Vive en casa propia con conyuge y 02 hijos de los cuales uno estudia y el otro trabaja. Maria Isabel cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. Vive en una comunidad ubicada a 45 kms de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, su clima es calido y su población son personas muy amigables que se dedicadan a la agricultura y ganaderia.

María Isabel se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 17 años aproximadamente; su conyuge es trabajador de empresa agroindustrial de Cayalti. Ella necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de cerdos y alimentos para estos lo que le generará mayor ingreso a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 61 years old, married, and is known in the media for her work raising and selling pigs. She lives in her own home with her spouse and two children, one of whom studies, while the other works. Maria Isabel has great references from her neighbors.

She lives in a community located 45 kms from Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The climate is warm, and the population is friendly with people making a living mostly from agriculture or livestock.

Maria Isabel has been making a living raising and selling pigs for more than 17 years. Her spouse works at the agroindustrial business in Cayalti. She needs the loan in order to invest in the purchase of pigs and feed, which will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of pigs and feed, which will generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza un plato que se llama ceviche que es a base de pescado y limon que va acompañado con camote, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pescado,limon y camote.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen makes a living selling food, specifically a dish called "ceviche." It has a fish and lime base, and is accompanied by sweet potato. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. She has eight years of experience with this type of work, and has done very well.

Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for this loan to buy cooking products, such as fish, lime, and sweet potato. She is very grateful for the loan and promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as fish, lemon, and sweet potato.

loans.name: Javith Shg - Valathur Group

texts.en:
Ameenabevia is the leader of the Javith Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Valathur village in the Tanjore district. Ameenabevia is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her child and husband. Her husband is small marginal farmer. 

Ameenabevia is requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than the traditional mud stove. As the latter emits a lot of smoke, it is also called a kitchen killer as it consumes more time and money. A smokeless stove is affordable, designed for daily use, and is much better than traditional stove.

Along with Ameenabevia, the other members are requesting a loan for the same purpose and are hoping for a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Deepam Shg - Kelakabeesthalam Group

texts.en:
People Action for Transformation is the local NGO. They formed the Deepam Self-Help Group, which contain six members from the same locality.    

Mala is the leader of the Deepam Self-Help group and she lives in Kelakabeesthalam village of Tanjore district in Tamil Nadu. Mala lives in her own house with her husband. Her husband is a farmer. He works on a daily wage basis. 

Mala and the other members want to purchase a smokeless stove manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs 1,400 INR. It is better than their traditional mud stove. Apart from providing a better cooking environment, the stove is easy to use and maintain, and can be used with indigenous biomass as fuel.

These women are looking forward to have a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Eberardo

texts.es:
El socio trabaja como profesor del nivel primario, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un colegio propio. El socio solicita le crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eberado works as a primary school teacher. He works from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m., and has been doing this work for eight years. He has done very well, and dreams of one day having his own school.

He is asking for the loan in order to buy a television for his house. He is grateful for the loan and promises to pay his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a television for his house.

loans.name: Moltinchan Group

texts.en:
Hoichingthem, 22, the featured member of the group with her hand raised, is a businesswoman. She lives with her husband and a baby daughter. She is a very active young woman who works hard to maintain her household. She runs a variety shop and at the same time looks after the household chores while her husband goes to the office. As the family is newly settled, they wanted capital to improve their finances and stabilize their business by buying inventory for the shop. Hoichingthem needed capital to buy inventory to innovate her shop. While she was in urgent need of money, she came across WSDS where she could get a loan for her business purpose. She was very grateful to receive such a loan from WSDS and feels lucky to meet her needs without any difficulties.

The group Moltinchan was formed by women with similar interests to get a loan for improving their business endeavor. The other members also are engaged in similar businesses. The loan will help them to buy inventory for their variety shops, which are the main source of income for their families.

loans.use: To buy inventory including sugar, milk, flour, oil, grain, eggs, canned fish, biscuits, soap, toothpaste, detergent powder, and toothbrushes

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1954. She was widowed in 1993. Her family's living condition was poor. She decided to start a business to find a source of income. Hanifa began her business deal by selling shoes. She has sold men and women's shoes for more than 21 years and has great experience. She sells goods in a local market where she has a selling place. Every season, she renews her assortment of goods. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy men and women's shoes for the new season. She is a repeat client of IMON and Kiva. She thanks Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: to buy men and women's shoes for the new season

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 38 años de edad, no estudio más que primer grado de primaria y no fue que no quisiera estudiar, sino que los padres no tuvieron varones, solo hembras y eran quines tenían que dedicarse a la agricultura, está acompañada  y tiene tres hijos solo estudia uno y una está acompañada.

María todo su vida a dependido de la agricultura, ahora su compañero de vida es quien trabaja.  A ella ya se le dio la oportunidad  la primera vez de trabajar con crédito y está muy agradecida, esta vez necesita el dinero para comprar abono y sembrar maíz y ajonjolí para la segunda temporada del año ya que en la primera temporada lo necesito para sembrar sandia. Ella dice que le gustaría que se le diera la oportunidad nuevamente de trabajar y así obtener los ingresos que necesita para sacar a su familia adelante y llegar a tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old. She did not study higher than first grade; this is not because she did not want to study, but because her parents did not have any sons (just daughters), and they had to make a living in agriculture. She is married and has three children; one of them studies, and one of them is married.

All of her life, Maria depended on agriculture, but now, her life partner is the one who works. This is her first opportunity to take out a loan and she is very grateful, because she needs the money to buy fertilizer as well as corn and sesame seeds to plant for the second harvest of the year (because in the first she needs to plant watermelon).

She says that she would like to take the opportunity to begin work again, and therefore obtain the income she needs to take home to her family, as well as have her own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and corn and sesame seeds for the second harvest of the year

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 to 12 years old. She describes herself to be visionary, patient and ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells school uniforms. She has been involved in this business for six years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of school uniforms. Her business goal is to open another shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of school uniforms

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children. She operates an electrical shop at the market on a retail basis. She serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last six years. She takes care of additional family members. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cables, wires, switches, bulbs, flat irons and kettles. Her major challenge includes transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to start repairing machines like refrigerators. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, cables, wires and switches

loans.name: Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita tiene 26 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotun, en la provincia de Chiclayo, en la región de Lambayeque; este distrito es una zona rural en la que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y a la venta de animales de corral.

Erlita se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza con varios años de experiencia en el rubro, ella solicita préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa por el monto de 1500 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de más productos para tener un stock variado y poder vender más de ellos y generar mayores ingresos para apoyar a su familia, dado que a mayores ventas mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Erlita is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in her own house in the district of Oyotun, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque. This district is a rural area, in which the population works in agriculture, commerce, and the sale of farm animals. 

Erlita makes a living selling beauty products. She has several years of experience in this line of work. She is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from the Edpyme Alternativa. She will invest the money in the purchase of more products to have a varied stock. This way, she can sell more and generate more income so that she can support her family, given that more sales mean more profits.

loans.use: to invest in working capital; for the purchase of cosmetics for her business so that she can increase her inventory.

loans.name: Vualngaih Group

texts.en:
Chingbiakmawi, 29, a featured member of the group with her hand raised, is a businesswoman. Her husband runs a carpentry shop while she makes  cushion covers for the sofa sets that are made by her husband. They have been helping each other to maintain their own business and working hard to become self-reliant. They have two school-going children and have been supporting the family through the carpentry business. The supply of the cushions and cushion covers has become costly and does not give them much profit. They decided to keep their own supply so they need capital for buying inventory including cushions and cushion covers. She feels grateful and happy to get such a loan from WSDS. She said that it will be much more productive to supply her own cushions to her customers instead of getting them from others. By having her own supply, she can provide better services to her customers with affordable prices for cushions and cushion covers and attract new customers.

The Vualngaih group was formed by women with a common interest to get a loan and use it in their business endeavours. They wanted to improve their business and support themselves through this loan.

loans.use: To purchase cushion and cushion cover materials

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.es:
Lauriana tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, es tranquila su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a vender pan y dulces en el mercado de abastos, realizando esta actividad desde hace un año, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de dulces y gaseosas y de esta manera generar hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lauriana is 39 years old and lives in the district of Pucara. The community is calm but has hot weather, and most residents make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaen, which belongs in the Cajamarca region in the north of Peru.

She makes a living selling bread and sweets in a wholesale food market. She has been doing this for one year. She is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles in order to buy candy and soda. These will help her to grow her business and increase her income, which will improve her profits and allow her to better her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying candy and soda.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es una mujer de  62 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que para poder ir a la escuela tenía que caminar unas 4 horas solamente para llegar. Tuvo 8 hijos y murieron 3 los otros se acompañaron y solo uno está con ellos, siempre juntos con su esposo se dedican al cultivo de la sandía y aunque en esta temporada comenta que no fue tan buena tienen el deseo de seguir trabajando siempre con sandia y otras cultivos como maíz, maicillo y ajonjolí.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagar a las personas que le ayudan a la preparación de la tierra y la siembra y otra parte para comprar abono. Ella espera siempre contar con el apoyo de la institución, ya que en ocasiones anteriores se ha dado la oportunidad de trabajar con préstamo y se siente muy agradecida ya que de no ser así no podría trabajar en grande.
texts.en:
Cruz is 62 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study, because in order to go to school she had to walk four hours each way. She had eight children, although three of them died. The others are married, and only one lives with them. With her husband, she makes a living planting watermelon. Although this past season was not great, they still want to keep working with watermelon, and other crops like corn, sorghum, and sesame.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to pay the people that help her to prepare the land, and to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to always have the support of the institution. She had been given the chance to work with a loan in the past, and feels very grateful because she could not accomplish so much otherwise.

loans.use: to pay the people helping her to prepare her land, and to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Betiz Noemy

texts.es:
Betiz de 42 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos, está casada, estudio hasta noveno grado, luego se casó su esposo es albañil, solamente vive con su esposo y 4 hijos, 3 estudian y una ya se casó.

Desde hace 20 años Betiz se dedica  a la sastrería, aprendió por medio de la hermana de su esposo, a ella le llamo la atención el trabajo y decidió dedicarse a ese trabajo,  luego continuo preparándose en una academia de alta costura, ahora tiene una escuela de costura donde unas 9 personas se involucran.

 Ella trabaja haciendo los uniformes de la escuela y  necesita el préstamo  para la reparación de algunas máquinas y la compra de otra para seguir enseñando lo que a ella tanto le gusta.

A Betiz le gustaría poner una tienda de cosas relacionadas con la costura y poner una escuela o academia de manera formal.
texts.en:
Betiz is 42 years old, married and has five children. She has a ninth grade education. After school she married; her husband is a builder. Betiz lives with her husband and four of her children. Three of Betiz’ children are in education; one is married.

For 20 years Betiz has been a tailor. She learned the trade from her husband’s sister. She really liked the work and decided to start this business. Betiz later continued learning the trade at a sewing school. She now has her own school with nine students.

Betiz makes school uniforms. She needs this loan in order to repair some machines and to buy another one in order to continue teaching, which she really likes doing.

Betiz would like to start a shop selling sewing items and to start a sewing school within the formal economy.

loans.use: to repair some machines and buy another one in order to continue teaching, which she really likes doing.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.es:
Herbert es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia. Desde que era joven se dedica a la agricultura porque apoyaba a sus padres en su chacra, es por ello que tiene muchos conocimientos en cuanto a los cultivos. Desde hace más de 10 años viene dedicándose exclusivamente al cultivo de cacao, le va muy bien porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad y muy buenas ofertas.
Herbert necesita algunos insumos orgánicos para poder realizar el abonamiento de sus cultivos y pagar por la limpieza del terreno, es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar todo lo que necesita para que su producción sea de mejor calidad, con esto seguirá luchando para poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Herbert is very hard-working. He is 50 years old, single and lives in Yarinacocha with his family. Herbert has worked in farming since he was a young man because his parents supported him in the field. He has a good knowledge of crops. For over ten years, Herbert has been working exclusively growing cacao. The work is going well as Herbert always offers good quality products at very good prices.

Herbert needs some organic supplies in order to lay manure on his crops and pay to clean his land. He is therefore very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy everything that he needs so that his crops are of a better quality. With this loan, Herbert will continue fighting in order to keep on supporting his family.

loans.use: to look after and lay manure on cacao crops.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo es una persona con muchas ganas de brindar un mejor futuro a su familia, tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia. Tiene dos hijos que son su mayor motivación en la vida y por quienes lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor. Desde muy joven apoya a sus padres en la agricultura y desde hace más de 15 años con mucho esfuerzo obtuvo sus terrenos agrícolas y hoy se dedica al cultivo de cacao, le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable y sobre todo porque siempre lucha por sus sueños.
Segundo necesita para esta cosecha comprar algunos insumos orgánicos y pagar el mantenimiento de los cultivos, es por eso que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar los materiales que requiere para que su cosecha mejore y con esos ingresos adicionales pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Así pues, seguirá trabajando para más adelante poder ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Segundo really wants to provide a better future for his family. He is 54 years old and he is not married. He lives in Yarinacocha with his family. He has two children, who are his biggest motivation and he works hard every day so that he can give them a better future. From a young age, he supported his parents in agriculture, and 15 years ago, with a lot of hard work, he got his own piece of farm land. Nowadays, he makes a living farming cacao. He does well, because he is very hard working, responsible, and, above all, he always fights for his dreams. For this harvest, Segundo needs to buy some organic supplies and to pay for the maintenance of the crops. Because of this, he is very grateful to the people who loan to KIVA  because with the support that they have given him, he will be able to buy the materials that he needs for his harvest to get better and, with this additional income, he will improve his family's quality of life. Accordingly, he will continue working so that, someday, he will be able to expand his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for cacao farming

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana Maria se dedica al negocio de venta de mochilas,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las mochilas.La socia solicita le credito para comprar mochilas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana Maria makes a living selling backpacks. She sells from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. She has been doing this for 5 years now and she does very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she could sell the backpacks. She is asking for this loan to buy backpacks. 

She is happy, thanks to the loan, and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy backpacks.

loans.name: Maricho

texts.en:
Maricho is a hardworking entrepreneur from Sara, Iloilo. She is 41 years old and has one child. Together with her husband, she breeds and raises pigs to provide income for their everyday needs and expenditures.

She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also retails rice within her community. She earns a minimum of 10,000 PHP in sales every month. 

Maricho is taking out a 35,000 PHP loan to buy additional hogs and feed. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products and other materials which are necessary to increase her inventory.

Maricho hopes to improve the quality of her business and service. She dreams of giving her child a better life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Benar

texts.en:
Benar lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Benar operates a retail shop at the market, and she has been in this business for the last 20 years.  She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

She has requested a loan of 2,900,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, beans, and flour. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Benar aspires to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, sugar, rice, cooking oil, beans, and flour

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a female Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be visionary and honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraint. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Bab Al Gana 50389 Group

texts.en:
Rihab is the featured borrower of Bab Al Gana 50389 group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and live at the same time.

Rihab is a 28-year-old single lady who has been working as a hairdresser and makeup artist at her own beauty salon for four years. She is a hard worker well known in her region with her special talents and good reputation in her domain.

Rihab is working hard to develop her business, thus for this reason her acquired loan will be invested in updating her business with newly released beauty products, hair treatments and tools, especially for the summer and the coming winter season.

Rihab is the first lady at the far right side of the picture, as for the other group members, Noura is the second from the right, Nouha is the first from the left, and Rawan is the second from the left.

loans.use: To update her business with newly released beauty products, hair treatments and tools, especially for the summer and the coming winter season

loans.name: Mutisya

texts.en:
Mutisya is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 8 to 14 years. He describes himself to be committed to work. 

He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes and also does branding. He has been involved in this business for nine years. His primary customers are mostly schools. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more tailoring machines. He hopes that in the future, he will put up a permanent residence. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new machines for her clothes washing and ironing business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 53 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, dicha comunidad está ubicada en la Provincia de Jaèn que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios de transporte por moto taxi, realizando esta actividad desde hace 3 años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar labores agricolas como arado con yunta, batido de terrenos arroceros, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para arreglos a su movilidad y de esta manera tener estar seguro del buen funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro is 53 years old and lives in Pomahuaca District, a community of hot weather with a quiet population that works in agriculture, trade and farming. The community is located in the Province of Jaèn belonging to the Cajamarca Region in the north highlands of Peru.

He provides transportation services via motorcycle taxi and has done so for 3 years. He also works in agriculture plowing with oxen tilling rice fields.
He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 1500 soles for repairs to his vehicle thus ensure the proper functioning of his work tool.

loans.use: to invest in repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
Medie is 45 years old, married and manages a retail store for income. His income goes for educational expenses and meals. His wife also works as a housemaid. 

Medie is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of groceries to sell. Medie is asking for a loan to buy canned goods, coffee, noodles and biscuits. He hopes that this loan will be given to help improve his profits. His photo was taken in his store with the project officer beside him.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, coffee, noodles and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Luan's Group

texts.en:
Luan is a 46-years-old woman living in a small village of Dong Anh District. She has one son and one daughter. The son is married and has his own child. The daughter is studying at the University of Education. Luan is a farmer and she also runs a butcher shop at the market to earn a living. 

Luan has been a loyal participant of SEDA’program since 2006. She successfully repaid a loan of VND 11,118,000 with the current loan cycle being her seventh loan cycle. This time, she would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to buy more meats for her butcher shop. She wishes to get enough money to invest her business and improve her living standard of her family. 

Other members of Luan’s group are included in the following list: 

* Hoa is a farmer who is 56 years old. She is the mother of two children. She is requesting a loan of VND 12,426,000 to raises chickens.
• Nga is 43 years old. She is a teacher who has two children. She would like to borrow VND 12,426,000 to buy a motorbike.
• Hue is 38 years-old- woman who has two children. She wants to borrow VND 6,322,000 to do carpentry. 
• Hang is 31 years-old. She is the mother of two children. She is requesting a loan of VND 12,426,000 to buy vegetables to resell at the market. 
• An is 64 years-old. She has three children. An is applying for a 6,322,000 VND loan through SEDA to raise pigs.
• Hanh is 33 years-old. She has three children. Hanh runs a beverage shop. She is requesting a loan of VND 7,630,000 invest her business.

loans.use: to buy more meats for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to deliver his products to the market

loans.name: Leidys

texts.es: Leidys de 21 años de edad, hace 4 años creó un negocio mediante el cual se dedica a  la elaboración de paños industriales; elementos  utilizados en cualquier campo de la limpieza industrial: artes gráficas, siderúrgia, aeronáutica, automoción, efectos navales e industria en general. Desde el año 2010 cuando aprendió de su amigo dedicado a ello, empezó su tarea productiva y hoy no descansa de producir y vender a empresas, trabajando desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su meta es ampliar su taller y finalmente comprar una casa, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr su propósito. Hoy se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta Organización, mediante la cual comprará una máquina y materia prima e insumos, con ello aumentará la producción, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Leidys is 21 years old. Four years ago, she created a business through which she makes a living producing industrial cloths, elements used in any field of industrial cleaning: printing, iron and steel, aeronautics, automotive, marine, and general industry. Since 2010, when she learned from a friend who made a living from it, she began her productive work and now does not rest from producing and selling to companies, working from 9 in the morning until 7 at night. 

Her goal is to grow her workshop and finally buy a house, but her work capital is insufficient to achieve her purpose. Today she has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to access a Kiva loan. This is the first loan that she has requested from this organization, through which she will purchase a machine, primary materials, and supplies. With these, she will increase production, making her Kiva loan a successful investment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a machine, primary materials, and supplies.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a villager and a married father of six children ranging in age from 11 to 21 years old -  all of them attending school respectively. For almost three years he has been running a little variety store built in his backyard. In addition to this, he has been doing agriculture (planting and selling mostly potatoes, red onions and apple fruits) and also livestock with a focus on dairy cows. 

Ramadan has been making an okay living out of all these activities. The village where he lives is not very far from the main city of Korca and once a week villagers like him can set up their booths at the farmers market to sell their products. The village itself also organizes a farmers market, or ‘Pazar’ called in local language, every week where wholesale buyers buy fresh produce in large quantities.
  
Ramadan is seeking your help to buy a dairy cow and with the rest of the loan being used to stock up his variety store with inventory items. The promise to lenders from him is that he will pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and stock up on inventory items for his variety store in order to increase his income for his six school-aged children.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who all go to school. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 7 the years. She has no additional family members. 

Lydia works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge includes defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expense includes food and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Song, 40-years-old, is a hard-working man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province. He has three dependent children who attend the local school. To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows cassava and sells his agricultural products to the local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this career for fifteen years. The average earning that he can make is USD 5.00 per day.

Song would like to keep his cassava growing well by using natural fertilizers on his farmland. Due to the insufficiency of money, he has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers to use in his farming process. With the supporting from this loan, he hopes his plants will grow well and produce more crops for him. He would like to thank for all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Zion Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lhingvah (57), the featured member of the group Zion, has her hand raised in the photo and is a weaver who earns a meager income. She lives in a very remote place called Bethel village, which is 20 kilometers away from Churachandpur district headquarters, Manipur. She is blessed with seven daughters who are still dependent on their parents. 

She produces three to four of her products monthly by weaving different types of traditional wraparounds and shawls, namely Gungal, Thangsuan, Puandum, Khamtang and Zou puan laisan (local names) at home. Her husband is a manual laborer engaging in building houses. Both parents work hard to sustain their family needs. Their family income is 17000 INR monthly.

In order to start saving for the children's higher education, the family wanted to run a small shop that will become an income generating source for the family. They needed capital for opening the shop. They feel fortunate to get the loan from WSDS without any hardship and have been thankful. They are under the process of opening the shop. The eldest daughter will help the family in running the shop.

The group was formed by women of common interest who want to get a loan to elevate their economic conditions. Most of them live in rented houses. The group members are engaged in different professions like weaving, agriculture activities, etc. The other members will use the loan to purchase yarn for weaving and items for their shops.

loans.use: To buy inventory for selling, including sugar, milk, flour, oil, grain, eggs, canned fish, biscuits, soap, toothpaste, detergent powder, toothbrushes, etc.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be self motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances to boost business. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more inventory of shoes. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a distributor of shoes.

loans.use: buy more inventory of shoes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 48 years old and he is married with children. As a way of generating income, he has engaged in a variety store business within his community in Iloilo, Philippines for eight years now. He, together with his wife, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family. They also manage a food stall business.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, George wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to request a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

George hopes for his business to develop and prosper. He dreams for his children to finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more tables, chairs and dishes for her food stall

loans.name: Eli Noe

texts.es:
Eli Noe tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el Caserio de Playa Azul del Distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es tranquila, se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios de transporte por mototaxi, realizando esta actividad desde hace 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para la reparación de su mototaxi y la compra de repuestos para la misma, y de esta manera asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo y seguir generando ingresos para poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Eli Noe is 27 years old. He lives in Caserio de Playa Azul in the Pucara District, a community with a hot climate. Its population is tranquil. They make a living from agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is situated in the Jaen Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He provides motorcycle taxi transportation services. He has performed this activity for 10 years. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 Nuevo Soles to repair his motorcycle taxi and purchase the replacement parts for the same. In this way, he will assure the correct functioning of his business tool and to continue generating income to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to be able to pay labor costs to repair his motorcycle taxi and to purchase the replacement parts for the motor of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Thavy Group

texts.en:
Thavy is 28 years old, a farmer and a married woman living with her husband and two small children in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2004. Her husband is 35 years old, a tuk tuk driver. Together, they can earn approximately $22 per day. 

Now Thavy would like to request a loan as a member of a group of four and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her and her family live healthily and keep the environment clean. In the future, she is going to buy a taxi for her husband to run, renovate her house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by offering prepaid load service for cellular phones and by selling frozen meat products.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 40,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Elvira wants her grocery store to grow more, and the same with her customers. She also desires for her youngest child to finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Dyna Group

texts.en:
Lhingneihoi (33), a featured member of the group with the raised hand, is a weaver by profession. She is very skilled in weaving cloths, namely lily pah, rose pah, zigzag, mc pah and china rose (local names). She lives with her husband, who is a cultivator, and three school-going children. Both parents work very hard to sustain the family with their meager income and send the children to school and provide them with the basic necessities. She earns her livelihood by weaving different designs of cloths. 

As the present income does not suffice for their family anymore, she wanted to earn more income by buying a weaving machine and employing one person to make her work faster and increase her production. In order to buy the weaving machine, she is in need of capital urgently. She has been very glad that she got a loan from WSDS in times of need and hopes that the loan will benefit her and her family in the future.

The group Dyna was formed by women with similar interest in getting a loan for improving their business endeavors. The other members are engaged in retail shops. The loan will help them to buy inventory for their variety shops, which is the main source of income for their families.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine for better production and to purchase yarn.

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado,  no continuo estudiando debido a que tenía que trabajar junto a su padre, para apoyar a sus hermanos a que salieran adelante con sus estudios y con los gastos del hogar.

José está acompañado su esposa se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas en el centro de la ciudad, con ella ha procreado 3 hijos, el primero de ellos tiene 28 años es hombre y vive en otro país, la segunda es mujer ella tiene 24 años y estudia último ciclo en la universidad licenciatura en administración de empresas, el tercero es hombre y vive en otro país, de él solo depende su esposa, hija y su suegra.

Él se dedica a trabajar como motorista desde hace 20 años, también tiene un negocio de alquiler de sillas y mesas para eventos, con estos trabajos que posee obtiene la fuente de ingresos suficientes para poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, además de esto, su esposa es una mujer emprendedora quien vende pupusas 6 veces por semana en horarios de 4:00pm a 9:00pm en este trabajo se incorpora su esposa, él y su hija ya que este es un negocio familiar, estos negocios de alquiler y pupusería los tiene en su casa.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar más sillas y mesas para alquilar ya que tiene unas que están dañadas y quiere reponerlas, teniendo el dinero en mano podrá cotizar donde le vendan más baratos y comprar a buen precio, así podrá tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes y de mejor calidad.

Él desea ver el sueño de su hija hecho realidad, que es graduarse, que tenga un buen trabajo para que tenga mejores condiciones comparadas con las actuales, desea también realizar mejoras en su vivienda hacerla más grande y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old. He studied until the 9th grade. He did not continue studying owing to that he had to work along with his father, to support his brothers who continued ahead with their studies, and with the home expenses.

José is in a relationship. His wife makes a living from the production of pupusas in the center of the city. With her, he has had 3 children. The first of them is 28 years old. He is a man and lives in another country. The second is a woman. She is 24 years old and is studying in the last year of the university for her degree in business administration. The third is a man who lives in another country. Only his wife, daughter, and mother-in-law depend on him.

He has made a living from working as a motorist for 20 years. He also has a business renting out seats and tables for events. With these jobs that he has, he has sufficient sources of income to be able to come out ahead with the home expenses. Along with this, his wife is an entrepreneurial woman who sells pupusas sometimes during the week on a schedule of from 4:00 p.m. until 9:00 p.m. His wife, he, and his daughter are involved in this work since this is a family business. He has these renting and pupusa businesses in his home.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase more seats and tables to rent out since he has some that are damaged and he wants to replace them. Having the money in hand, he will be able to purchase from where they sell them more cheaply and purchase them at a good price. Thus, he will be able to have more to offer his customers and of a better quality.

He wishes to see his daughter’s dream made reality, which is to graduate, and to have a good job so that he has better conditions compared to those that he currently has. He also wishes to make improvements to his home to make it larger and to be able to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase more seats and tables to rent our since he already has some that are damaged and he wants to replace them; having the money in hand, he will be able to purchase them from where they sell them more cheaply and to purchase them at a good price.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a 36-year-old married woman from the village of Kushi. She has seven family members and they earn a living cultivating a plot of agricultural land where various kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. Susanna and her husband sell the harvested products locally and generate some income. 

In order to increase their trading business, Susanna decided to purchase a mini-bus and sell agricultural products door to door. In this case they will be able make the business more profitable as more clients will make use of their service.
 
The loan will be a great support for this large family, since generating more income will help them tackle financial difficulties. 

Susanna and her family rely on the good will of lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus in order to increase her trading business.

loans.name: Karpakavinayakar Shg - Valathur Group

texts.en:
Geetha is the leader of the Karpakavinayakar Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. Geetha lives in Valathur village, Tanjore district.  

Geetha and her family live in their own house. Her husband is a farmer.

Geetha and other members of the group have taken loans from PAT before for improving their livelihoods. They all are seeking a loan to purchase smokeless stoves, which are efficient, sustainable, durable and designed for daily use.

The traditional mud stove is very inefficient and emits a lot of smoke and soot, which creates many health problems.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun, who is 45 years old, is a hard-working man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province. He has three dependent children who are enrolled in the local school, and he also has two married children. 

To make a living and support his family, he manages and operates a farming business on a small area of farmland which is located near his house. On his farmland, he grows cassava and sells his agricultural product to the local dealers. So far, he has been involved in this career for nearly twenty years. The average earning that he can make is USD 5.00 per day.

Bun would like to keep his cassava growing well by using natural fertilizers on his farmland. Due to insufficient money, he has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers to use in his farming process. With the support from this loan, he hopes his plants will grow well and bring more crops to him. 

He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman and mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Mary Jane earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Several months ago, her business was damaged when a typhoon hit the country. 

As of now, Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, biscuits and bread, soda and beverages, salt, sugar, cooking oil, among other things. 

With this, she will be able to augment her stock, which will attract more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Mary Jane hopes to expand her business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, biscuits and bread, soda and beverages, salt, sugar, cooking oil among other things

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman and a mother of five children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 16 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a farmer.

Lolita is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed and food supplements for the piglets. With this, she will be able to raise more pigs, which she can then sell to the market. In the future, Lolita has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, and animal feed and food supplements for the piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the solar system machine for heating water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils and chairs for customers to use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a dental machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, toothpaste, margi, biscuits, etc. in wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with six children. She takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.
