Some of them are managing grocery shops and others are doing farming. Shanti is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. The lady standing with her raised hand is Shanti. She hopes to increase her rice yield and earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Developpement (1) Group

texts.en:
Serge is a micro-entrepreneur, from Brazzaville, Republic of Congo, with his own small grocery story and restaurant in his home neighborhood. Serge joined HOPE Congo last year and is a member of the community bank group, DEVELOPPEMENT (1). Serge is the leader of a subgroup of six other micro-entrepreneurs, and he is currently on his third loan cycle with HOPE Congo. He would like to take out a small loan of 350,000 XAF in order to purchase additional merchandise such as drinks, sausages and canned food items.

Serge dreams of being able to have enough savings to diversify his businesses by running a chicken farm with several business partners. As the father of two, Serge hopes to support his young son’s dreams by sending him to a school specializing in football (soccer). Eventually, Serge would even like to travel to the Netherlands to learn about the poultry business.

loans.use: to to purchase additional merchandise such as drinks, sausages and canned food items.

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Al grupo solidario Santa Cruz lo integran tres socios emprendedores, lo coordina la señora María Esther de 37 años de edad, casada, quien hace y vende  nacatamales en su domicilio, solicita el crédito para la compra de posta de cerdo, costilla, tocino, hojas de chagüite, manteca de cerdo, flete de leña, quintal de maíz, etc., con el fin de cubrir la demanda que tiene de este producto. 

Las otras socias son la señora Lylieth de 27 años de edad, comerciante de ropa y el señor Domingo de 63 años de edad, comerciante de verduras en el mercado de su municipalidad.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Santa Cruz is formed by three hard-working entreprenuers and is coordinated by María Esther, who is 37 years old and married. She makes Nicaraguan tamales and sells them from her home, and she is requesting a loan to buy pork chunks, pork chops, bacon, plantain leaves, lard, a load of firewood, a quintal (100 lb. or 45 kg) of corn, and the like in order to meet the demand for her product. 

The other members are 27-year-old Lylieth and 63-year-old Domingo. Lylieth sells clothes and Domingo sells vegetables in the municipal market.

loans.use: buy pork chunks, pork chops, bacon, plantain leaves, lard, a load of firewood, a quintal of corn, and the like in order to meet the demand for her tamale product.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: María Gabriela es una microempresaria emprendedora de 34 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos de las edades de 16, 14, 11 y 5 años, quienes han sido su motivación para seguir progresando, es propietaria de una pulpería donde comercializa granos básicos y productos perecederos en su comunidad, la socia con los créditos anteriores ha logrado ampliar su negocio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de un frízer, con el objetivo de ofrecer productos como carne de res, carne de cerdo, lácteos, que son producto que la población siempre está demandando, de manera que sus ingresos podrán mejorar y le podrá brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Maria Gabriela is a 34-year-old micro-entrepreneur, she is married and has four children ages 16, 14, 11 and 5, they are her motivation to continue progressing. She owns a convenience store where she sells basic grains and perishable products to her community. With previous loans she was able to grow her business and the loan requested now is to buy a refrigerator with the goal to offer products such as beef, pork, dairy which are products in demand by her customers, this way her income can improve and she can provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her convenience store.

loans.name: Maira Patricia

texts.es:
Maira de 45 años de edad, es una persona que  estudio sexto grado y esta acompañada. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y sastrería oficio que aprendió de sus padres. Maira se levanta junto a su esposo a las 5:30 a.m.

 Maira se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en las parcelas que posee, oficio que realiza durante la mañana junto a su  esposo. En el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a la elaboración de prendas de vestir que sus vecinos  desean que les elaboren y lo que le ayudar a generar un ingreso adicional para su familia.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono,veneno, etc. Que necesita para sembrar y llegar a obtener una buena cosecha.

 Maira planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de elaboración de prendas de vestir  y  de la siembra, comprar en un futuro  vacas para producir leche.
texts.en:
Maira, 45 years old, is a person who studied up to the sixth grade and is partnered. She works in agriculture and tailoring, a line of work she learned from her parents.She gets up with her partner at 5:30 am to do her daily work.

She works in agriculture in plots she owns, a job she does during the mornings with her partner. During the afternoon, she works making clothing that her neighbors want her to make, and which helps her to generate additional income for her family.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase maize seed, manure, pesticide, etc. which she needs to plant and later get a good harvest.

Maira plans, with the income that she gets from making clothing and from the crop, to purchase dairy cows in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize seed, fertilizer, pesticide etc. that she needs to have a good harvest

loans.name: Bethanie (1) Group

texts.en:
Georges is a micro-entrepreneur and a member of the community bank group BETHANIE (1) in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Georges owns his own food stand, making and selling coffee and small food items. The leader of a small subgroup of 10 other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, George would like to take out his first small loan with HOPE Congo of 250,00 XAF. With this loan Georges hopes to purchase milk, sugar and spaghetti that he will make into a typical breakfast dish with beans. 

Georges draws in clients by creating good relationships, showing them respect and providing good service. In the future he hopes that he’ll be able to grow and expand his business to the point where he is able to open multiple locations in Brazzaville. As the father of two children under the age of six, Georges dreams of being able to take care of his family and becoming financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar and spaghetti that he’ll make into a typical breakfast dish with beans.

loans.name: Bethanie (2) Group

texts.en:
Taurchièles is a young entrepreneur in Brazzaville, Republic of Congo who has his own hot food stand grilling meat on command. Taurichèles recently joined the community bank group BETHANIE (2) and heads up a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville. In order to help grow his business, Taurichèles would like to take out a small loan of 250,000 CFA with HOPE Congo. With this loan he will be able to purchase additional chicken and pork to grill. 

One day Taurchièles hopes his small grilling business with become one of the most well-known in his district. He dreams of being able to support his family financially through his profits.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicken and pork to grill

loans.name: Christ Vivant 3 (2) Group

texts.en:
Raïssa is a micro-entrepreneur from Brazzaville, Republic of Congo. The leader of a subgroup of nine other micro-entrepreneurs in the community bank group Christ Vivant 3 (2), Raïssa is currently on her third loan cycle with HOPE Congo. Raïssa has a small business making and selling fou-fou, a traditional Congolese staple starch made from ground cassava root. She also sells various grocery items at her market stand. With a small loan of 400,000 CFA, Raïssa will be able to purchase additional bags of cassava flour to make into fou-fou.

Little by little Raïssa hopes to increase her savings and grow her business activities. One day she dreams of being able to stand on her own two feet and eventually pass on her business to her four children.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of cassava flour to make into fou-fou

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 24 year old single woman with no children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 1 year. Makerita has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, rolls of material, stencils, a cutter, wooden designs and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, rolls of material, stencils, a cutter, wooden designs and rollers

loans.name: Peleiupu

texts.en: Peleiupu is a 50 year old woman who is married with 9 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Peleiupu has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to improve the living standards of her family. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
In the photograph, in front of the so-called ‘family house’ is Dave, a villager happy by nature and the mother of five grownup kids. She is from northern Albania, dressed in their traditional clothing; a skirt over the pants and a handkerchief. The loan she is seeking from you is to do construction to this home.

Dave’s focus for all her life according to her has been on agriculture. She’s got vineyards and sells grapes and also homemade wine. She produces and sells potatoes, beans and corn in large quantities and in a smaller capacity, seasonal veggies. Dave is not the only one who earns an income at their home. Her husband works as an excavator operator as well.

This will be Dave's fourth loan in good standing with VisionFund Albania.

loans.use: to do some construction in their so called 'home', so that they may live a bit better.

loans.name: Luce

texts.en:
This is Luce who operates a mini-farm with the focus on dairy cows. Currently, she’s got six cows and four grown calves. Luce also owns 14 dynym of agricultural land. She uses 12 dynym to plant watermelon and wheat and in 2 dynym she has orchards.  She needs your help to pay the farming contribution towards her pension. An amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek will help her achieve the goal. The savings she had, she invested in something else recently and was not aware of the contribution that she had to pay soon.
Luce is a mother of five children whose focus has always been on rural activities such as agriculture/livestock, and has successfully operated the activity for the past 22 years.

loans.use: to pay for her farming pension contribution

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in recycled metal sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including metal and solder, as well as a new grinder to be used for smoothing out the metal.

Miguel has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I'm a self-taught and impassioned artist. I was only 13 years old when I began to make my own toys. I used to tear apart other toys and use their components to create my own versions. That's how I got into making sculptures, but this time recycling mechanical parts.

"I'd like to thank each of you for your support on behalf of all artisans. This microcredit will allow me to purchase the materials and equipment I need in order to increase my sales."

Use the link below to view Miguel's recycled metal sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6243

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including metal and solder, as well as a new grinder to be used for smoothing out the metal

loans.name: Utumalamalemele

texts.en: Utumalamalemele is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. Utumalamalemele needs a loan to buy foam cups, sugar, a large jug, cordials, Chinese candy and a large spoon. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Utumalamalemele has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, sugar, a large jug, cordials, Chinese candy and a large spoon

loans.name: Davida

texts.en:
This is Davida, a villager and a religious devotee and a mother of two school aged children, 17 and 12 years old. Davida is photographed with her daughter, the youngest of two. The reason why she is requesting this loan is because she needs to do some home repairs.
Davida has been doing agriculture/livestock for the past 20 years and she says that her activity has been generating an okay income for their family. In particular, she grows pigs and then sells them and also she’s got one dairy cow and sells raw milk and baby calves once a year. Grains such as wheat and corn and also beans are what she plants and sells in large amounts in addition to the seasonal veggies. Davida also works 4 hours/day at the local church and her 17-year-old works as a busboy in a nearby restaurant.

loans.use: to make repairs to their family house seen in the background of the photograph

loans.name: Sunui

texts.en:
Sunui is a 45-year-old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Sunui needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sunui has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Faausu

texts.en: Faausu is a 31-year-old married woman with 6 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Faausu needs a loan to buy donuts, pies, cakes, snacks, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, foam cups and milk. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faausu has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy donuts, pies, cakes, snacks, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, foam cups and milk for her business

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sosefina is a 51-year-old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Sosefina has requested a loan to buy thread, needles, material, measuring tape, hangers and manikins. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with her children's education. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, material, measuring tape, hangers and manikins

loans.name: Iutita

texts.en: Iutita is 22 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cucumbers and pumpkins that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Iutita needs a loan to buy a new watering hose, a new tiller, a pitch fork, fertilizer, chemicals and sprayers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Iutita will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new watering hose, a new tiller, a pitch fork, fertilizer, chemicals and sprayers

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en: Matalena is a 60-year-old widow with 6 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business and has been very successful throughout the years. Matalena has requested a loan to buy rolls of fabric, thread of all colors, needles, a new sewing machine and measuring tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, thread of all colors, needles, a new sewing machine and measuring tape

loans.name: Dave

texts.en: Dave's livestock activity has been going well as per her claims. With your financial help previously, she built a stable. Now that she has more animals, she plans on expanding the barn. To achieve this, Dave is seeking your financial help again. She wants to thank you very much for the help.

loans.use: to exapnd the existing barn; her lifestock activity has grown and now she's got more animals

loans.name: Pologa

texts.en:
Pologa, 34, is unmarried and the mother of two children. For the past year she has managed a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas, which she sells in her community or at the market.

This year Pologa became a member of SPBD. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a sprayer. She will use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a sprayer.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 29-year-old married man blessed with two children. He sells second-hand shoes in his area and this has been his trade for the last 12 years, with a monthly income of about 40,000 Kenya shillings, with which is able to cater to all his family's needs.

He has applied for his second loan which he plans to use to add more stock of shoes to cater for his clients' desires. In the future, he would like to open a big shop and also import new shoes for resale.

loans.use: to add more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 33 years old and married with six children. For the past two years she has managed a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas, which she sells in her community or at the market.

Dorothy has been a member of SPBD since 2012. She is applying for a 1,500 WST loan to buy a new machete, chemicals, a large wheelbarrow, a shovel, sprayers, taro starts and new boots. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new machete, chemicals, a large wheelbarrow, a shovel, sprayers, taro starts and new boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that she may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Falefia

texts.en:
Falefia is a 58-year-old woman who is married with six children. For nearly fourteen years she has run a medium-sized flea market and a BBQ stand in her village.

Falefia joined SPBD in 2001 to gain access to its financial services. She is applying for a 15,000 WST loan to buy a secondhand Dyna truck for her business and a large BBQ set. She will use her profits to pay for her familiy’s weekly expenses and help with her children's school fees.

We at SPBD have witnessed great things from Falefia. She has proved to be one of our most successful clients ever.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand Dyna truck for her business and a large BBQ set.

loans.name: Eme

texts.en:
Eme is 43 years old and married with five children. For the past three years she has managed a small plantation where she grows taro which she can sell in her community or at the market.

Eme has been a member of SPBD since 2011. She is applying for a 2,000 WST loan to buy gloves, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a spade, a tiller and new overalls. She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy gloves, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a spade, a tiller and new overalls.

loans.name: Pene

texts.en: Pene is 56 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of items in her community to earn a living. She has been very successful throughout the years. She has been doing this for 9 years. Pene needs a loan to purchase a large chest freezer, a new display fridge, snacks, soft drinks, canned items, frozen goods and also to pay for the renewal of her business license. She hopes to use her profits to improve the living standards of her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2005 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large chest freezer, a new display fridge, snacks, soft drinks, canned items, frozen goods and also to pay for the renewal of her business license

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 47 years old and is very responsible with his household obligations, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his family in Mahayag. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Jesus wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer. Jesus deeply wishes to support his family.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 50 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. She manages a farm from which she earn a living. She and her husband work hard where they grow corn and beans.

Antonieta wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seed, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Sabali 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SABALI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  44 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA,  une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide, le fonio et le mais  avec FANTA 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 2 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SABALI 2 are married women who average 44 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in DJAN, a commune of the prefecture of KOLONDIEBA in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 7th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.

FANTA grows groundnuts, maize, fonio and rice. She is the member standing first from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 2 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Kolondieba to a clientele consisting of both men and women.  

Fanta expects to earn a profit of 150,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set  so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Geogracia

texts.en:
Geogracia is married with 3 children. Geogracia is 39 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Geogracia operates her own sar-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month she earns P 2500 doing this type of small business. She has requested a loan for P 20000 to buy basic commodity items to display and sell in her store.
Geogracia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Geogracia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to display in her store,sell and retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Rose Shg - Poonthottam Group

texts.en:
Kamala is 42 years old and the leader of the Rose Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu. Kamala lives in Poonthottam village, Tanjore district with her two children and husband in her own house. Her husband is a farmer who works on a daily wage basis.  

Kamala needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is efficient, clean, and easy for daily use for cooking. The traditional stove creates environmental hazards such as deforestation. Smokeless stoves reduce the risk of respiratory illness as they emit much less smoke. 
 
Along with Kamala, the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Aringaranna Shg-Melapalur Group

texts.en:
Shanthi, 42 years old, is the leader of Aringaranna Self Help Group, which was formed by the NGO People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. Shanthi lives in her own house in Melapalur village with her two children and her husband. He is a small marginal farmer. Shanthi has taken loans from PAT previously to improve her livelihood and repaid them on time. 

The fire from a traditional stove creates tangible and adverse effects including stinging eyes, scratchy throats, coughs, and dirty, soot-covered walls. The smokeless stove is the solution to all of these problems, as it cooks faster and emits much less smoke. Shanthi, along with the other members, is requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove. They hope to save time as well as money and to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone and a solar charging set so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51-year-old farmer from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. This season she plans to redouble her efforts to earn more for her family.

Consequently, Gloria has requested a 50,000 PHP loan through PMPC to buy extra fertilizer. She aspires to be a rice supplier in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice fields

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy landed at a right place for her need for capital when she joined PMPC.   She has a farm in Tambulig that supports primarily for her family. She would also like to sell their produce. Nancy is feeling grateful to PMPC  for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed another loan for the next cropping season. She loaned an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Nancy perseveres and always believes she can reach her goal to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 71 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children, who are now adults. 
For her source of living, Lilia has been engaged in managing a little dress shop business for the last 5 years. She earns approximately PHP 8,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cloth, thread and accessories for her dress shop business.
Lilia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lilia hopes to expand her dress shop business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional cloth, thread and accessories

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is married with 3 children. Cerila is 55 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Cerila operates her sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns PHP 4000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for PHP 20000 to purchase grocery items and vegetables for her business.
Cerila has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Cerila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and vegetables to sell/retail

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.en:
Eleuterio joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011 and is a member in good standing. He appreciates and is very active in the various programs, services and educational opportunities that the co-op offers.

Eleuterio is applying for a 40,000 PHP loan. With it he will restock his store with basic commodities.

Eleuterio dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and earn an adequate income from his business.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
While her husband works in a private company, Nelia keeps on taking care of their own farm to make a living. Growing crops on their farm brings better income and it is their main source of income. Nelia's previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. She plans to buy additional organic fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients. For this reason, she has taken out a new loan from GDMPC. 

Nelia hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase additional organic fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: Karen esta casada, tiene 38 años y dos hijos Ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Karen es organizadora de eventos infantiles y es artesana y desea poder establecer una oficina donde pueda ofrecer sus servicios en fiestas infantiles Su esposo la ayuda trabajando en el ambito financiero pero solo puede colaborar con los gastos de la casa por eso Karen necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Karen is married. She is 38 years old and has two children. She lives in La Paz in a brick and mortar home she owns. Karen is an organizer of children's events. She is a craftswoman, and she would like to be able to set up an office where she can offer her children's party services. Her husband, working in the financial field, helps her, but he can only help with the household expenses. This is why Karen needs your help.

loans.use: to set up an office where she can offer her children's party services.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Lucmapampa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE LUCMAPAMPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Teresa, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma ella es conviviente y tiene 45 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, plátanos y cacao, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE LUCMAPAMPA" communal bank. This bank is located in the Santa Teresa district, which is part of the La Convencion province and the Cusco department.

The borrower is Vilma. She is 45 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has five children. She works in agriculture. She has a plot of land where she grows coffee, bananas, and cacao. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has been working in this business for five years, and she is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her farmland. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds.

The other members make a living selling food, selling clothes, running a grocery store, and working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Reynald

texts.en:
Reynald owns and operates an agriculture business growing crops and raising livestock. He has been working on the farm for four years and earns well from these activities. His farm is still doing well and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it. 

Recently, Reynald took a new loan to buy more piglets to raise. This is his primary plan in taking this loan for it earns additional income aside from farming. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Deborah works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. 

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy fishing materials like bamboo and fishing nets for her business. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like bamboo and fishing nets

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Shiela has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Shiela is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 55 years old and from Mahayag. He currently lives with his wife and four children. Renato earns a living through his farming activities.

Renato wants to double his sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to buy six bags of fertilizer. 

In the future, he wants to be rice supplier of his neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer
